name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Introduction

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  1 11/17/2014  INTRODUCTION

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: This Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council (FFIEC) Bank Secrecy Act

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (BSA)/Anti -Money Laundering (AML) Examination Manual  provides guidance to examiners

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: for carrying out BSA/AML and Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) examinations .  An

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: effective BSA/AML compliance program requires sound risk management; therefore, the manual also provides guidance on identifying and controlling risks associated with money

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: laundering and terrorist financing .  The manual contains an overview of BSA/AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance program requirements, BSA/AML risks and risk management expectations, industr y sound practices, and examination procedures .  The development of this manual was

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: a collaborative effort of the federal  and state banking agencies

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1 and the Financial Crimes

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Enforcement Network (FinCEN), a bureau of the U.S. Department of the Treasury, to ensure consistency in the  application of the BSA/AML requirements .  In addition, OFAC assisted in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the development of the sections of the manual that relate to OFAC reviews .  For more

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: guidance, r efer to  Appendi x A (“BSA Laws and Regulations ”), Appendix B ( “BSA/AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Directives ”), and Appendix C (“BSA/AML References ”).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Structure of Manual

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In order to effectively apply resources and ensure compliance with BSA requirements, the manual is structured to allow examiners to tailor the BSA/AML examination scope and procedures to the specific risk profile of the banking organization.  The manual consists of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the following sections:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Introduction.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Core Examination Overview and Procedures for Assessing the BSA/AML Compliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Program.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Core Examination Overview and Procedur es for Regulatory Requirements and Related

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Topics.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Expanded Examination Overview and Procedures for Consolidated and Other Types of BSA/AML  Compliance Program Structures.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Expanded Examination Overview and Procedures for Products and Services.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Expanded Exam ination Overview and Procedures for Persons and Entities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Appendi xes.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The core and expanded overview sections provide narrative guidance and background information on each topic; each overview is followed by examination procedures .  The “Core

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1 The FFIEC was established in March 1979 to prescribe uniform principles, standards, and report forms and to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: promote uniformity in the supervision of financial institutions.  The Council has six voting members: the Board

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, the Federal Deposit I nsurance Corporation, the National Credit

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Union Administration, the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, the Consumer Financial Protection

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Bureau, and the State Liaison Committee.  The Council’s activities are supported by interagency task forces and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: by an advisory State Liaison Committee, comp osed of five representatives of state agencies that supervise

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial institutions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Introduction

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  2 11/17/2014  Examination O verview and Procedures for Assessing the BSA/AML Compliance Program”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and the “Core Examination Overview and Procedures for Regulatory Requirements and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Related Topics” (c ore) sections serve as a platform for the BSA/AML examination and, for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the most part, a ddress legal and regulatory requirements of the BSA/AML compliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: program .  The “Scoping and Planning” and the “BSA/AML Risk Assessment” sections help

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the examiner develop an appropriate examination plan based on the risk profile of the bank.  There may b e instances where a topic is covered in both the core and expanded sections (e.g.,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: funds transfers and foreign correspondent banking) .  In such instances, the core overview  and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: examination procedures address the BSA requirements while the expanded overview  and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: examination procedures address the AML risks of the specific activity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: At a minimum, examiners should use the following examination procedures included within the “Core Examination Overview and Procedures for Assessing the BSA/AML Compliance Program” section of this manual to ensure that the bank has an adequate BSA/AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance program commensurate with its risk profile:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Scoping and Planning (refer to  page  11).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • BSA/AML Risk Assessment ( refer to  page 18).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • BSA/AML Compliance Program ( refer to  page  28).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Developing Conclusions and Finalizing the Examination ( refer to  page  40).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: While OFAC regulations are not part of the BSA, the core sections include overview  and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: examination procedures for examining a bank’s policies, procedures, and processes for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: ensur ing compliance with OFAC sanctions .  As part of the scoping and planning procedures,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: examiners must  review the bank’s OFAC risk assessment and independent testing to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: determine the extent to which a review of the bank’s OFAC compliance program should be conducted during the examination.  Refer to core examination procedures , “Office of Foreign

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Assets Control ,” page  152, for further guidance .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The expanded sections address specific lines of business, products, customers, or entities that may present unique cha llenges and exposures for which banks should institute appropriate

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: policies, procedures, and processes .  Absent appropriate controls, these lines of business,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: products, customers, or entities could elevate BSA/AML risks .  In addition, the expanded

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: section provides guidance on BSA/AML compliance program structure s and management.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Not all of the core and expanded examination procedures are  likely to be applicable to every

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banking organization.  The specific examination procedures that need to be performed

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: depend on the BSA/AML risk profile of the banking organization, the quality and quantity of independent testing, the financial institution’s history of BSA/AML compliance, and other

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: relevant factors.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Introduction

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  3 11/17/2014  Background

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In 1970, Congress passed the Currency and Foreign Transactions Rep orting Act commonly

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: known as the Bank Secrecy Act,2 which established requirements for record  keeping and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reporting by private individuals, banks,3 and other financial institutions .  The BSA was

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: designed to help identify the source, volume, and movement of currency and other monetary

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: instruments transported or transmitted into or out of the United States or deposited in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial institutions .  The statute sought to achieve that objective by requiring individuals,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banks, and other fi nancial institutions to  file currency reports with the U.S. Department of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Treasury (U.S. Treasury ), properly identify persons conducting transactions, and maintain a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: paper trail by keeping appropriate records of financial transactions .  These records enable law

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: enforcement and regulatory agencies to pursue investigations of criminal, tax, and regulatory

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: violations, if warranted, and provide evidence useful in prosecuting money laundering and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: other financial crimes.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The Money Laundering Control Act of 1986 augmented the BSA ’s effectiveness by adding

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the interrelated sections 8(s) and 21 to the Federal Deposit Insurance Act ( FDIA) and section

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 206(q) of the Federal Credit Union Act  (FCUA ), which sections apply equally to banks of all

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: charters.4 The Money Laundering Control Act of  1986 precludes circumvention of the BSA

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirements by imposing criminal liability on a person or financial institution that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: knowingly assists in the laundering of money, or that structures transactions to avoid reporting them .  The 1986 statute directed banks to establish and maintain procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reasonably designed to ensure and monitor compliance with the reporting and recordkeeping requirements of the BSA .  As a result, on January 27, 1987, all federal banking agencies

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: issued e ssentially similar regulations requiring banks to develop programs for BSA

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The 1992 Annunzio–Wylie Anti- Money Laundering Act strengthened the sanctions for BSA

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: violations and the role of the U.S. Treasury .  Two years later, Congress passed the Money

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Laundering Suppression Act of 1994 (MLSA), which further addressed the U.S. Treasury ’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: role in combating money laundering.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In April 1996, a Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) was developed to be used by all banking organizations in the United States .  A banking organization is required to file a SAR

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: whenever it detects a known or suspected criminal violation of federal law or a suspicious

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transaction related to money laundering activity or a violation of the BSA.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In response to the September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks, Congress passed the Uniting and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Strengthening America by Providing Appropriate Tools Required to Intercept and Obstruct Terrorism Act of 2001 ( USA PATRIOT Act ).  Title III of the USA PATRIOT Act is the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 2 31 USC 5311 et seq. , 12 USC 1829b, and 1951 – 1959.  Also refer to 12 USC 1818(s) (federally insured

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: depository institutions) and 12 USC 1786(q) (federally insured credit unions).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 3 Under the BSA, as implemented by 31 CFR 1010.100 (formerly 31 CFR 103.11) , the term “bank” includes

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: each agent, agency, branch,  or office within the United States of commercial banks, sa vings and loan

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: associations, thrift institutions, credit unions, and foreign banks.  The term “bank” is used throughout the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: manual generically to refer to the financial institution being examined.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 4 12 USC 1818(s), 12 USC 1829(b), and 12 USC 1786(q), respe ctively.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Introduction

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  4 11/17/2014  International Money Laundering Abat ement and Anti -Terrorist Financing Act of 2001.  The

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: USA PATRIOT  Act is arguably the single most significant AML law that Congress has

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: enacted since the BSA itself .  Among other things, the USA PATRIOT  Act criminalized the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financing of terrorism and augmen ted the existing BSA framework by strengthening

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: customer identification procedures; prohibiting financial institutions from engaging in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: business with foreign shell banks; requiring financial institutions to have due diligence procedures and, in some cases, enhanced due diligence ( EDD)  procedures for foreign

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: correspondent and private banking accounts; and improving information sharing between financial institutions and the U.S. government .  The USA PATRIOT  Act and its

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: implementing regulations also:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Expanded the AML program requirements to all financial institutions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 5 Refer to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix D ( “Statutory Definition of Financial Institution ”) for further clarification.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Increased the civil and criminal penalties for money laundering.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Provided the Secretary of the Treasury with the authority to impose “ special measures ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: on jurisdictions, institutions, or transactions that are of “ primary money -laundering

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: concern. ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Facilitated records access and required banks to respond to regulatory requests for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: information within 120 hours.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Required federal banking agencies to consider a bank ’s AML record when reviewing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank mergers, acquisitions, and other applications for business combinations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Role of Government Agencies in the BSA

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Certain government agencies play a critical role i n implementing BSA regulations,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: developing examination guidance, ensuring compliance with the BSA, and enforcing the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA .  These agencies include the U.S. Treasury, FinCEN, and the federal banking agencies

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System  (Federal Reserve) , Federal Deposit

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Insurance Corporation (FDIC) , National Credit Union Administration  (NCUA) , and Office of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the Comptroller of the Currency  (OCC ).  Internationally there are various multilateral

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: government bodies that support the fight against money laundering and terrorist financing .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Refer to  Appendix E ( “International Organizations ”) for additional information.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: U.S. Treasury

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The BSA authorizes the Secretary of the Treasury to require financial institutions to establish AML programs, file certain reports, and keep certain records of transactions .  Certain BSA

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: provisions have been extended to cover not only traditional depository institutions, such as banks, savings associations, and credit unions, but also nonbank financial institutions , such as

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 5 The USA PATRIOT Act expanded the AML program requirement to all financial institutions as that term is

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: defined in 31 USC 5312(a)(2).  However, as of the publication of this manual, only certain types of financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institutions are subject to fina l rules implementing the AML program requirements of 31 USC 5318(h)(1) as

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: established by the USA PATRIOT Act.  Those financial institutions that are not currently subject to a final

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: AML program rule are temporarily exempted from the USA PATRIOT Act require ments to establish an AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: program, as set forth in 31 CFR 1010.205 (formerly 31 CFR 103.170) .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Introduction

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  5 11/17/2014  money services businesses, casinos, brokers/dealers in securities, futures commission

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: merchants , mutual funds , insurance companies , and operators of credit card systems.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN , a bureau of the U.S. Treasury, is the delegated administrator  of the BSA .  In this

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: capacity, FinCEN issues regulations and interpretive guidance, provides outreach to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: regulated industries, supports the examination functions performed by federal banking agencies, and pursues civil enforcement actions when warranted .  FinCEN relies on the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: federal banking agencies to examine banks within their respective jurisdictions for compliance with the BSA .  FinCEN ’s other significant responsibilities include providing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: investigative case support to law enforcement, identifying and communicating financial crime trends and patterns, and fostering international cooperation with its counterparts

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: worldwide.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Federal Banking Agencies

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The federal banking agencies are responsible for the oversight of the various banking entities

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: operating  in the United States, including foreign branch offices of U.S. banks .  The federal

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banking agencies are charged with chartering ( NCUA and OCC ), insuring ( FDIC  and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: NCUA), regulating, and supervising banks.6 12 USC 1818(s)(2) and 1786(q) require  that the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: appropriate federal banking agency include a review of the BSA compliance program at each

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: examination of an insured depository institution.  The federal banking agencies may use their

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: authori ty, as granted  under section 8 of the FDIA  or section 206 of the FCUA , to enforce

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance with  appropriate banking rules and regulations, including compliance with the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The federal banking agencies require each bank under their supervision to establish and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: maintain a BSA compliance program.7 In accordance with the USA PATRIOT  Act,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN ’s regulations require certain financial institutions to establish an AML compliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: program that guards against money laundering and terrorist financing and ensures compliance with the BSA and its implementing  regulations .  When the USA PATRIOT  Act

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: was passed, banks under the supervision of a federal banking agency were already required by law to establish and maintain a BSA compliance program that, among other things, requires the bank to identify and report s uspicious activity promptly .  For this reason, 31

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: CFR  1020.210 states that a bank regulated by a federal banking agency is deemed to have

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: satisfied the AML program requirements of the USA PATRIOT  Act if the bank develops and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: maintains a BSA compliance prog ram that complies with the regulation of its federal

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: functional regulator

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 8 governing such programs .  This manual refer s to the BSA compliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: program requirements for each federal banking agency as the “BSA/AML compliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: program.”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 6 The Federal Reserve and FDIC  may collaborate with state banking agencies on the examination, oversight,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and enforcement of BSA/AML for state -chartered banks.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 7 Refer to 12 CFR 208.63, 12 CFR 211.5(m) and 12 CFR 211.24(j) (Federal Reserve); 12 CFR 326.8 ( FDIC );

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 8 Federal functional regulator means: Federal Reserve,  FDIC,  NCUA,  OCC,  Securities and Exchange

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Commission or U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Introduction

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  6 11/17/2014  Banks should take reason able and prudent steps to combat money laundering and terrorist

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financing and to minimize their vulnerability to the risk associated with such activities .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Some banking organizations have damaged their reputations and have been required to pay

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: civil money penalties for failing to implement adequate controls within their organization resulting in noncompliance with the BSA .  In addition, due to the AML assessment required

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: as part of the application process, BSA/AML concerns can have an impact on the bank’ s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: strategic plan .  For this reason, the federal banking agencies ’ and FinCEN ’s commitment to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: provide guidance that assists banks in complying with the BSA remains a high supervisory

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: priority.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The federal banking agencies work to ensure that the organizations they supervise understand

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the importance of having an effective BSA/AML compliance program in place.  Management must be vigilant in this area, especially as business grows and new products and services are introduced .  An evaluation of the bank’ s BSA/AML compliance program and its

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance with the regulatory requirements of the BSA has been an integral part of the supervision process for years .  Refer to  Appendix A ( “BSA Laws and Regulations ”) for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: further information.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: As part of a strong BSA/AML complia nce program, the federal banking agencies seek to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: ensure that a bank has policies, procedures, and processes to identify and report suspicious

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions to law enforcement .  The agencies ’ supervisory processes assess whether banks

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: have established the appropriate policies, procedures, and processes based on their

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML risk to identify and report suspicious activity and that they provide sufficient detail in reports to law enforcement agencies to make the reports useful for investigating suspicious tra nsactions that are reported .  Refer to Appendi xes B ( “BSA/AML Directives ”)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and C ( “BSA/AML References ”) for guidance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: On July 19, 2007, the federal banking agencies issued a statement setting forth the agencies’ policy for enforcing specific anti- money laundering requirements of the BSA .  The purpose

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of the Interagency Statement on Enforcement of Bank Secrecy Act/Anti -Money Laundering

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Requirements  (Interagency Enforcement Statement)  is to provide greater consistency among

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the agencies in enforcement decisio ns in BSA matters and to offer insight into the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: considerations that form the basis of those decisions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC administers and enforces economic and trade sanctions based on U.S. foreign policy and national security goals against targeted foreign countries, terrorists, international narcotics traffickers, and those engaged in activities related to the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction .  OFAC acts under the President ’s wartime and national emergency powers,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: as well as under authority granted by specific legislation, to impose controls on transactions and freeze assets under U.S. jurisdiction.  Many of the sanctions are based on United Nations and other international mandates, are multilateral in scope, and involve close cooperation

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: with allied governments.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 9 Refer to Appendix R (“Enforcement Guidance”) for additional information.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Introduction

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  7 11/17/2014  OFAC requirements are separate and distinct from the BSA, but both OFAC and the BSA

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: share a common national security goal .  For this reason, many financial institutions view

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance with OFAC sanctions as related to BSA compliance obli gations; supervisory

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: examination for BSA compliance is logically connected to the examination of a financial institution ’s compliance with OFAC sanctions .  Refer to  the core overview and examination

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: procedures , “Office of Foreign Assets Control ,” pages 142 and 152, respectively, for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: guidance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The BSA is intended to safeguard the U.S. financial system and the financial institutions that make up that system from the abuses of financial crime, including money laundering,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: terrorist financing, and other illicit financial transactions .  Money laundering and terrorist

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financing are financial crimes with potentially devastating social and financial effects .  From

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the profits of the narcotics trafficker to the assets  looted from government coffers by

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: dishonest foreign officials, criminal proceeds have the power to corrupt and ultimately destabilize communities or entire economies .  Terrorist networks are able to facilitate their

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: activities if they have financial means  and access to the financial system .  In both money

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: laundering and terrorist financing, criminals can exploit loopholes and other weaknesses in the legitimate financial system to launder criminal proceeds,  finance terrorism,  or conduct

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: other  illegal activities , and, ultimately, hide the actual purpose of their activity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Banking organizations must develop, implement, and maintain effective AML programs that address the ever -changing strategies of money launderers and terrorists who  attempt to gain

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: access to the U.S. financial system .  A sound BSA/AML compliance program is critical in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: deterring and preventing these types of activities at, or through, banks and other financial institutions .  Refer to  Appendix F ( “Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing Red Fla gs”)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: for examples of suspicious activities that may indicate money laundering or terrorist

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financing.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Money Laundering

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Money laundering is the criminal practice of processing ill- gotten gains, or “ dirty ” money,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: through a series of transactions; in this way the funds are “ cleaned ” so that they appear to be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: proceeds from legal activities .  Money laundering generally does not involve currency at

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: every stage of the laundering process .  Although money launderi ng is a diverse and often

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: complex process, it basically involves three independent steps that can occur simultaneously:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Placement .  The first and most vulnerable stage of laundering money is placement .  The goal

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: is to introduce the unlawful proceeds into t he financial system without attracting the attention

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of financial institutions or law enforcement .  Placement techniques include structuring

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: currency deposits in amounts to evade reporting requirements or commingling currency

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: deposits of legal and illegal enterprises .  An example may include: dividing large amounts of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: currency into less -conspicuous smaller sums that are deposited directly into a bank account,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: depositing a refund check from a canceled vacation package or insurance policy, or purchasing a ser ies of monetary instruments (e.g., cashier ’s checks or money orders) that are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: then collected and deposited into accounts at another locat ion or financial institution .  Refer

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to Appendix G ( “Structuring ”) for additional guidance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Introduction

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  8 11/17/2014  Layering .  The second stage  of the money laundering process is layering, which involves

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: moving funds around the financial system, often in a complex series of transactions to create

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: confusion and complicate the paper trail .  Examples of layering include exchanging monetary

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: instrumen ts for larger or smaller amounts, or wiring or transferring funds to and through

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: numerous accounts in one or more financial institutions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Integration .  The ultimate goal of the money laundering process is integration .  Once the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: funds are in the financial s ystem and insulated through the layering stage, the integration

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: stage is used to create the appearance of legality through additional transactions .  These

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions further shield the criminal from a recorded connection to the funds by providing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: a plaus ible explanation for the source of the funds .  Examples include the purchase and resale

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of real estate, investment securities, foreign trusts, or other assets.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Terrorist Financing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The motivation behind terrorist financing is ideological as opposed to profi t-seeking, which

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: is generally the motivation for most crimes associated with money laundering .  Terrorism is

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: intended to intimidate a population or to compel a government or an international organization to do or abstain from doing any specific act through the threat of violence .  An

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: effective financial infrastructure is critical to terrorist operations .  Terrorist groups develop

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: sources of funding that are relatively mobile to ensure that funds can be used to obtain material and other logistical items need ed to commit terrorist acts .  Thus, money laundering

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: is often a vital component of terrorist financing.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Terrorists generally finance their activities through both unlawful and legitimate sources .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Unlawful activities, such as extortion, kidnapping, and nar cotics trafficking, have been found

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to be a major source of funding .  Other observed activities include smuggling, fraud, theft,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: robbery, identity theft, use of conflict diamonds,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 10 and improper use of charitable or relief

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: funds .  In the last case, donors may have no knowledge that their donations have been

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: diverted to support terrorist causes.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Other legitimate sources have also been found to provide terrorist organizations with funding; these legitimate funding sources are a key difference between terroris t financiers

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and traditional criminal organizations .  In addition to charitable donations, legitimate sources

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: include foreign government sponsors, business ownership, and personal employment.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Although the motivation differs between traditional money launde rers and terrorist

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financiers, the actual methods used to fund terrorist operations can be the same as or similar to those methods used by other criminals that launder funds .  For example, terrorist financiers

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: use currency smuggling, structured deposits or  withdrawals from bank accounts ; purchases of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: various types of monetary instruments ; credit , debit , or prepaid  cards ; and funds transfers .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: There is also evidence that some forms of informal banking (e.g., “ hawala ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 11) have played a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 10 Conflict diamonds originate from areas controlled by forces or factions opposed to legitimate and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: internationally recognized governments and are used to fund military action in opposition to those governments,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or in contravention of the decisions of the United Nations Security Council .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 11 “Hawala” refers to one specific type of informal value transfer system.  FinCEN describes hawala as “a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: method of monetary value transmission that is used in some parts of the world to conduct remittances, most often by persons who seek to legitimately sen d money to family members in their home country.  It has also

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Introduction

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  9 11/17/2014  role in moving terrorist funds .  Transactions through hawalas are difficult to detect  given the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: lack of documentation, their size, and the nature of the transactions involved.  Funding for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: terrorist attacks does not always require large sums of money, and the associated transactio ns

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: may not be complex.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Criminal Penalties for Money Laundering,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Terrorist Financing, and Violations of the BSA

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Penalties for money laundering and terrorist financing can be severe .  A person convicted of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: money laundering can face up to 20 years in prison and a fine of up to $500,000.12 Any

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: property involved in a transaction or traceable to the proceeds of the criminal activity,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: including property such as loan collateral, personal property, and, under certain conditions,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: entire bank accounts (even if some of  the money in the account is legitimate), may be subject

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to forfeiture .  Pursuant to various statutes, banks and individuals may incur criminal and civil

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: liability for violating AML and terrorist financing laws .  For instance, pursuant to 18 USC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1956 and 1957, the U.S. Department of Justice may bring criminal actions for money laundering that may include criminal fines, imprisonment, and forfeiture actions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 13 In

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: addition, banks risk losing their charters, and bank e mployees risk being removed and barred

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: from banking.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Moreover, there are criminal penalties for willful violations of the BSA and its implementing regulations under 31 USC 5322 and for structuring transactions to evade BSA reporting requirements under 31 U SC 5324(d) .  For example, a person, including a bank employee,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: willfully violating the BSA or its implementing regulations is subject to a criminal fine of up to $250,000 or five years in prison, or both.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 14 A person who commits such a violation while

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: violat ing another U.S. law, or engaging in a pattern of criminal activity, is subject to a fine of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: up to $500,000 or ten years in prison, or both.15 A bank that violates certain BSA provisions,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: including 31 USC 5318(i) or (j), or special measures imposed under 31 USC 5318A, faces criminal money penalties up to the greater of $1 million or twice the value of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transaction.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Civil Penalties for Violations of the BSA

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Pursuant to 12 USC 1818(i)  and 1786(k), and 31 USC 5321, the federal banking agencies

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and FinCEN, r espectively, can bring civil money penalty actions for violations of the BSA .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Moreover, in addition to criminal and civil money penalty actions taken against them,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: individuals may be removed from banking pursuant to 12 USC 1818(e)(2) for a violation of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: been noted that hawala, and other such systems, are possibly being used as conduits for terrorist financing or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: other illegal activity.” For additional information and guidance on hawalas and Fin CEN’s report to Congress in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: accordance with section 359 of the USA PATRIOT Act, refer to www.fincen.gov .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 15 Id.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 16 Id.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Introduction

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  10 11/17/2014  the AML laws under Title 31 of the U.S. Code, as long as the violation was not inadvertent

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or unintentional .  All of these actions are publicly available.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Scoping and Planning — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  11 11/17/2014  CORE EXAMINATION OVERVIEW AND

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: PROCEDURES  FOR ASSESSING THE BS A/AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: COMPL IANCE PROGRAM

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Scoping and Planning — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Identify the bank’s BSA/AML risks, develop the examination scope, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: document the plan.  This process includes determining examination staffing needs  and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: technical expertise, and selecting examination procedures to be completed.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The BSA/AML examination is intended to assess the effectiveness of the bank ’s BSA/AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance program and the bank’ s compliance with the regulatory requirements pertaining

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to the BSA, including a review of risk management practices.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Whenever possible, the scoping and planning process should be completed before entering the bank.  During this process, it may be helpful to discuss BSA/AML matters with bank management, including t he BSA compliance officer, either in person or by telephone .  The

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: scoping and planning process generally begins with an analysis of:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Off-site monitoring information.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Prior examination reports and workpapers.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Request letter items completed by bank managemen t.  Refer to Appendix H ( “Request

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Letter Items  (Core and Expanded) ”) for additional information.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The bank’ s BSA/AML risk assessment.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Information available from the BSA -reporting database, FinCEN Query .  FinCEN Query

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: replaced the former BSA -reporting database, the Web Currency Banking and Retrieval

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: System, as the system of records for all BSA reports  effective January 1, 2013.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Independent reviews or audits.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Review of the Bank ’s BSA/AML Risk Assessment

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The scoping and planning process should be guided by the examiner ’s review of the bank ’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML risk assessment .  Information gained from the examiner ’s review of the risk

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: assessment assist s the scoping and planning process as well as the evaluation of the adequacy

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of the BSA/AML compliance program .  If the bank has not developed a risk assessment, this

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: fact should be discussed with management .  For the purposes of the examination, whenever

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the bank has not completed a risk assessment, or the risk assessment is inadequate, the examiner must complete a risk as sessment .  Refer to  the core overview section, “ BSA/AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Risk Assessment ,” page  24, for guidance on developing a BSA/AML risk assessment .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Evaluating the BSA/AML risk assessment is part of scoping and planning the examination, and the inclusion of a section on risk assessment in the manual does not mean the two processes are separate.  Rather, risk assessment has been given its own section to emphasize

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: its importance in the examination process and in the bank’s design of effective risk- based

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: controls.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Scoping and Planning — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  12 11/17/2014  Indepe ndent Testing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: As part of the scoping and planning process, examiners should obtain and evaluate the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: supporting documents of the independent testing (audit) of the bank’ s BSA/AML compliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: program .  The federal banking agencies’ reference to “audit” does n ot confer an expectation

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: that the required independent testing must be performed by a specifically designated auditor, whether internal or external.  However, the person performing the independent testing must not be involved in any part of the bank’s BSA/ AML compliance program (for example,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: developing policies and procedures or conducting training).  Audit findings should be reported directly to the board of directors or a  designated board committee composed

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: primarily of or completely of outside directors. The scope and quality of the audit may provide examiners with a sense of particular risks in the bank, how these risks are being managed and controlled, and the status of compliance with the BSA .  The independent

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: testing  scope and workpapers can assist examiners in understanding the audit coverage and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the quality and quantity of transaction testing .  This knowledge assist s the examiner in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: determining the examination scope, identifying areas requiring greater (or lesser) s crutiny,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and identifying when expanded examination procedures may be necessary.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Examination Plan

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: At a minimum, examiners should conduct the examination procedures included in the following sections of this manual to ensure that the bank has an adequate BSA /AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance program commensurate with its risk profile:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Scoping and Planning ( refer to page  11).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • BSA/AML Risk Assessment ( refer to  page 18).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • BSA/AML Compliance Program ( refer to  page 28 ).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Developing Conclusions and Finalizing the Examination ( refer to  page 40).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The “Core Examination Overview  and Procedures for Regulatory Requirements and Related

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Topics”  section includes an overview and examination procedures for examining a bank’ s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: policies, procedures, and processes to ensure  compliance with OFAC sanctions .  As part of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the scoping and planning procedures, examiner s must  review the bank’ s OFAC risk

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: assessment and independent testing to  determine the extent to which a review of the bank ’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC  compliance  program should be conduc ted during the examination.  Refer to core

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: overview and examination procedures , “Office of Foreign Assets Control,” page 142 and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 152, respectively, for further guidance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The examiner should develop and document an initial examination plan commensurate with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the overall BSA/AML risk profile of the bank.  This plan may change during the examination

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: as a result of on -site findings, and any changes to the plan should likewise be documented.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The examiner should prepare a request letter to the bank .  Suggested re quest letter items are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: detailed in Appendix H ( “Request Letter Items  (Core and Expanded) ”).  On the basis of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: risk profile, quality of audit, previous examination findings, and initial examination work, examiners should complete additional core and expanded examination procedures, as

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: appropriate .  The examiner must  include an evaluation of the BSA/AML compliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: program within the supervisory plan or cycle .  At larger, more complex banking

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Scoping and Planning — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  13 11/17/2014  organizations, examiners may complete various types of examinations throughout the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: supervisory plan or cycle  to assess BSA/AML compliance.  These reviews may focus on one

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or more business lines (e.g., private banking, trade financing, or foreign correspondent banking relationships) , based upon the banking organizati on’s risk assessment and recent

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: audit and examination findings .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Transaction Testing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Examiners perform transaction testing to evaluate the adequacy of the bank ’s compliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: with regulatory requirements, determine the effectiveness of its policies, procedure s, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: processes, and evaluate suspicious activity monitoring systems .  Transaction testing is an

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: important factor in forming conclusions about the integrity of the bank’ s overall controls and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: risk management processes .  Transaction testing must be  perform ed at each examination  and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should be risk- based .  Transaction testing can be performed either through conducting the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transaction testing procedures within the independent testing (audit) section ( refer to the core

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: examination procedures , “BSA/AML Complianc e Program ,” page  38, for further guidance )

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or completing the transaction testing procedures contained elsewhere within the core or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: expanded sections.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The extent of transaction testing and activities conducted is based on various factors

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: including the examiner ’s judgment of risks, controls, and the adequacy of the independent

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: testing .  Once on site, the scope of the transaction testing can be expanded to address any

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: issues or concerns identified during the exam ination .  Examiners should document their

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: decision regarding the extent of transaction testing to conduct , the activities for which it is to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: be performed, and  the rationale for any changes to the scope of transaction testing that occur

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: during the examinati on.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Information Available From BSA -Reporting Database

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The FinCEN Query replaced the BSA -reporting database, Web  Currency Banking and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Retrieval System, as the system of records for all BSA reports.  Examination planning should also include an analysis of th e Suspicious Activity Reports (S ARs), Currency Transaction

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Reports (CTR), and CTR exemptions that the bank has filed.  SARs, CTRs, and CTR exemptions may be exported or downloaded from or obtained directly online  from the BSA -

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reporting database ( FinCEN Query ).  Each federal banking agency has staff authorized to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: obtain this data from the BSA  reporting database.  When requesting searches from the BSA

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reporting database, the examiner should contact the appropriate person (or persons), within his or her age ncy, sufficiently in advance of the examination start date in order to obtain the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requested information.  When a bank has recently purchased or merged with another bank, the examiner should obtain SARs, CTRs, and CTR exemptions data on the acquired bank, a s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: well.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Downloaded information can be displayed on an electronic spreadsheet, which contains all of the data included on the original document filed by the bank as well as the  BSA Identification Number (BSA -ID), and the date the document was entered into the BSA -

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reporting database.  Downloaded information may be important to the examination, as it

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: helps examiners:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Identify high -volume currency customers.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Scoping and Planning — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  14 11/17/2014  • Assist in selecting accounts for transaction testing.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Identify the number and characteristics of SARs f iled.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Identify the number and nature of exemptions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Scoping and P lanning — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  15 11/17/2014  Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Scoping and Planning

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Identify the bank’s BSA/AML risks, develop the examination scope, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: document the plan.  This process i ncludes determining examination staffing needs  and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: technical expertise, and selecting examination procedures to be completed.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: To facilitate the examiner ’s understanding of the bank’ s risk profile and to adequately

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: establish the scope of the BSA/AML examination, the examiner should complete the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: following steps , in conjunction with the review of the bank’s BSA/AML risk assessment :

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1. Review prior examination or inspection reports, related workpapers, and management ’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: responses to any previously identified BSA issues; identify  completed  examination

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: procedures ; obtain BSA contact information; identify reports  and processes the bank uses

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to detect unusual activity; identify previously noted higher -risk banking operations;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: review recommendations for the next examination .  In addition, contact  bank

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: management  as appropriate to discuss the following:
