name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • BSA/AML compliance program.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • BSA/AML risk assessment.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Suspicious activity monitoring and reporting systems.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Level and extent of automated BSA/AML systems.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: For the above topics, refer to the appropriate overview and examination procedures sections in the manual for guidance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 2. Develop list of BSA items to be incorporated into the integrated examination request

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: letter .  If the BSA portion of the examination is a stand -alone examination, send the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: request letter to the bank .  Review the request letter documents provided by the bank.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Refer to Appendix H ( “Request Letter Items  (Core and Expanded) ”).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 3. Review  correspondence between the bank and its primary regulator , if not already

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: completed by the examiner in charge or other dedicated examination personnel .  In

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: addition, review  correspondence that the bank or the primary regulators have received

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: from, or sent to, outside regulatory and law enforcement agencies relat ing to BSA/AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance.  Communications, particularly those received from FinCEN may document

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: matters relevant to the examination, such as the following:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Filing errors for SARs , CTRs , and CTR exemptions  received electronically from

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN BSA E -Filing S ystem .  Refer to Appendix T for additional information on

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: filing through the BSA E -Filing System.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Civil money penalties issued by or in process from FinCEN.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Law enforcement subpoenas or seizures.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Scoping and P lanning — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  16 11/17/2014  • Notification of ma ndatory account closures of non cooperati ve foreign customers

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: holding correspondent accounts as directed by the Secretary of the Treasury or the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: U.S. Attorney General.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 4. Review SARs, CTRs, and CTR exemption information obtained from the BSA -reporting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: database.  The number of SARs, CTRs, and CTR exe mptions filed should be obtained for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: a defined time period, as determined by the examiner .  Consider the following

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: information, and analyze the data for unusual patterns, such as:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Volume of activity, and whether it is commensurate with the customer ’s occup ation

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or type of business.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Number and dollar volume of transactions involving higher -risk customers.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Volume of CTRs in relation to the volume of exemptions (i.e., whether additional

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: exemptions resulted in significant decreases in CTR filings).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Volume of SA Rs and CTRs in relation to the bank’ s size, asset or deposit growth, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: geographic location.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The federal banking agencies do not have targeted volumes or “ quotas ” for SAR and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: CTR filings for a given bank size or geographic location.  Examiners should not criticize a bank solely because the number of SARs or CTRs filed is lower than SARs or CTRs filed by “peer” banks .  However, as part of the examination, examiners must review

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: significant changes in the volume or nature of SARs and CTRs filed and assess potential

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reasons for these changes.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 5. Review internal and  external audit reports and workpapers for BSA/AML compliance, as

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: necessary, to determine the comprehensiveness and quality of audits, findings, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: management responses and corrective action.  A revi ew of the independent audit ’s scope,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: procedures, and qualifications provide s valuable information on the adequacy of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML compliance program.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 6. While OFAC regulations are not part of the BSA, evaluation of OFAC compliance is

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: frequently included in BSA /AML examinations .  It is not the federal banking agencies’

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: primary role to identify OFAC violations, but rather to evaluate the sufficiency of a bank’s implementation of policies, procedures, and processes to ensure compliance with OFAC laws and regulatio ns.  To facilitate the examiner’s understanding of the bank’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: risk profile and to adequately establish the scope of the OFAC examination, the examiner

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should complete the following steps:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Review the bank ’s OFAC risk assessment .  The risk assessment , which may be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: incorporated into the bank’s overall BSA/AML risk assessment, should consider the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: various types of products, services, customers, entities, transactions , and geographic

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: locations in which the bank is engaged, including those that are processed by,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: through, or to the bank to identify potential OFAC exposure.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Review the bank ’s independent testing of its OFAC compliance program.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Scoping and P lanning — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  17 11/17/2014  • Review correspondence received from OFAC and , as needed, the civil penalties area

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: on the OFAC W eb site to determine whether th e bank had any warning letters, fines ,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or penalties imposed by OFAC since the most recent examination .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Review correspondence between the bank and OFAC (e.g., periodic reporting of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: prohibited transactions and, if applicable, annual OFAC reports on blocked property).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In addition to the above, a t larger, more complex banking organizations, examiners may

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: complete various types of examinations throughout the supervisory plan or cycle to assess OFAC compliance .  These reviews may focus on one or more business lines.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 7. On the basis of the above examination procedures, in conjunction with the review of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank’s BSA/AML risk assessment, develop an initial examination plan .  The examiner

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should adequately document the plan, as well as any changes to the plan that occur during the examination .  The scoping and planning process should ensure that the examiner is

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: aware of the bank ’s BSA/AML compliance program, OFAC compliance program,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance history, and risk profile ( i.e., products, services, customers, entities,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions, and geographic locations).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: As necessary, additional core and expanded examination procedures may be completed .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: While the examination plan may change at any time as a result of on -site findings, the initial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: risk assessment enables  the examiner to establish a reasonable scope for the BSA/AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: review .  In order for  the examination process to be successful, examiners must maintain open

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: communication with the bank’ s management and discuss relevant concerns as they arise.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Risk Assessment — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  18 11/17/2014  BSA/AML Risk Assessment — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the BSA/AML risk profile of the bank and evaluate the adequacy of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank ’s BSA/AML risk assessment process.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Evaluating the BSA/AML risk assessment should be part of scoping and planning the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: examination , and the inclusion of a section on risk assessment in the manual does not mean

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the two processes are separate.  Rather, risk assessment has been given its own section to emphasize its importance in the examination process  and in the bank’s design of effective

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: risk-based controls .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The same risk management principles that the bank uses in traditional operational areas should be applied to assessing and managing BSA/AML risk.  A well -developed risk

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: assessment assist s in identifying the bank’s BSA/AML risk profile .  Understanding the risk

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: profile enables the bank to apply appropriate risk management processes to the BSA/AML compliance program to mitigate risk .  This risk assessment process enables management to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: better  identify and mitigate gaps in the bank’s controls .  The risk assessment should provide a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: comprehensive analysis of the BSA/AML risks in a concise and organized presentation, and should be shared and communicated with all business lines across the bank, board of directors, management , and appropriate staff; as such, it is a sound practice that the risk

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: assessment be reduced to writing.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: There are many effective methods and formats used in completing a BSA/AML risk assessment; therefore, examiners should not  advocate a particular method or format .  Bank

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: management should decide the appropriate method or format, based on the bank’s particular risk profile .  Whatever format management  chooses to use for its risk assessment, it should

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: be easily understood by all  appropriate parties.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The development of the BSA/AML risk assessment generally involves two steps: first, identify the specific risk categories (i.e., products, services, customers, entities, transactions, and geographic locations) unique to the bank; and second, conduct a more detailed analysis

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of the data identified to better assess the risk within these categories .  In reviewing the risk

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: assessment  during the scoping and planning process , the examiner should determine whether

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: management has considered al l products, services, customers, entities , transactions, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: geographic locations, and whether management’s detailed analysis within these specific risk categories was adequate.  If the bank has not developed a risk assessment, this fact should be discusse d with management .  For the purposes of the examination, whenever the bank has

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: not completed a risk assessment, or the risk assessment is inadequate, the examiner must

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: complete a risk assessment  based on available information.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Evaluating the Bank’s BSA/AM L Risk Assessment

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: An examiner must review the bank’s BSA/AML compliance program with sufficient

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: knowledge of the bank’s BSA/AML risks in order to determine whether the BSA/AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance program is adequate  and provides the controls necessary to mitigate risks .  For

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: example, during the examination scoping and planning process, the examiner may initially

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 17 Refer to  “Examiner Development of a BSA/AML Risk Assessment ,” page 24,  for guidance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Risk Assessment — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  19 11/17/2014  determine that the bank has a high -risk profile, but during the examination, the examiner may

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: determine th at the bank’s BSA/AML compliance program adequately mitigates these  risks .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Alternatively, the examiner may initially determine that the bank has a low - or moderate -risk

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: profile; however, during the examination, the examiner may determine that the bank’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML compliance program does not adequately mitigate the se risks.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In evaluating the risk assessment, an examiner should not necessarily take any single

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: indicator as determinative of the existence of a lower or higher BSA/AML risk.  The assessment of risk  factors is bank- specific, and a conclusion regarding the risk profile should

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: be based on a consideration of all pertinent information.  Banks may determine that some factors should be weighed more heavily than others .  For example, the number of funds

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transfers is certainly one factor to be considered in assessing risk; however, in order to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: effectively identify and weigh the risks, the examiner should look at other factors associated with those funds transfers, such as whether they are international or dom estic, the dollar

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: amounts involved, and the nature of the customer relationships.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Identification of Specific Risk Categories

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The first step of the risk assessment process is to identify the specific products, services, customers, entities, and geographic l ocations unique to the bank.  Although attempts to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: launder money, finance terrorism, or conduct other illegal activities through a bank can emanate from many different sources, certain products, services, customers, entities, and geographic locations may be more vulnerable or have been historically abused by money

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: launderers and criminals .  Depending on the specific characteristics of the particular product,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: service, or customer, the risks are not always the same.  Various factors, such as the number and volume of transactions, geographic locations , and nature of the customer relationships ,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should be considered when the bank prepares its risk assessment .  The differences in the way

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: a bank interacts with the customer (face -to-face contact versus electronic ba nking) also

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should be considered.  Because of these factors , risks vary from one bank to another .  In

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reviewing the bank’s risk assessment, examiners should determine whether management has

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: developed an accurate risk assessment that identifies the signific ant risks to the bank.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The expanded sections in this manual provide guidance and discussions on specific lines of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: business, products, and customers that may present unique challenges and exposures for which banks may need to institute appropriate policies, procedures, and processes .  Absent

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: appropriate controls, these lines of business, products, or customers could elevate aggregate BSA/AML risks .  The examiner should expect the bank’s ongoing risk assessment process to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: address the varying degrees of risk a ssociated with its products, services, customers , entities,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and geographic locations , as applicable.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Products and Services

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Certain products and services offered by banks may pose a higher risk of money laundering or terrorist financing depending on the nat ure of the specific product or service offered .  Such

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: products and services may facilitate a higher degree of anonymity, or involve the handling of high volumes of currency or currency equivalents .  Some of these products and services are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: listed below, but  the list is not all inclusive:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Risk Assessment — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  20 11/17/2014  • Electronic funds payment services — prepaid access (e.g., prepaid  and payroll cards),

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: funds transfers (domestic and international), payable upon proper identification (PUPID)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions, third- party payment processors, remittance activity, automated

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: clearinghouse (ACH)  transactions , and automated teller machines (ATM) .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Electronic banking.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Private banking (domestic and international).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Trust and asset management services.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Monetary instruments.18

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Foreign correspondent accounts (e.g., bulk shipments of currency, pouch activity,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: payable through accounts  (PTA ), and U.S. dollar drafts).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Trade finance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Services provided to third- party payment processors or senders.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Foreign exchange.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Special use or concentration accounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Lending activities, particularly loans secured by cash collateral  and marketable securities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Nondeposit account services (e.g., nondeposit investment products  and insurance).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The expanded sections of the manual provide guidance and discussion on specific products and services detailed above.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Customers and Entities

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Although any type of account is potentially vulnerable to money laundering or terrorist

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financing, by the nature of their business, occupation, or anticipated transaction activity, certain customers and entities may pose specific risks .  At this stage of the risk assessment

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: process, it is essential that banks exercise judgment and neither define nor treat all members of a specific category of customer as posing the same level of risk .  In assessing customer

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: risk, banks should consider other variables, such as services sought and geographic locations .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The expanded sections of the manual provide guidance and discussion on specific customers

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and entities that are detailed below:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Foreign financial institutions, including banks and foreign money services providers (e.g.,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: casas de cambio , currency exchanges , and  money transmitters ).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Nonbank financial institutions (e.g., money services businesses; casinos and card clubs; brokers/dealers in securities; and dealers in precious metals, stones, or jewels).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Senior foreign political figures and their immediate family members and close associates (collectively known as p olitically exposed persons (PEP )).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 18 Monetary instruments in this context include official bank checks, cashier’s checks, money orders, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: traveler’s checks.  Refer to  the expanded overview section, “Purchase and Sale of Monetary Instruments,” page

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 240, for further discussion on risk factors and risk mitigation regarding monetary instruments.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Risk Assessment — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  21 11/17/2014  • Nonresident alien (NRA)20 and accounts of foreign individuals.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Foreign corporations and domestic business entities, particularly offshore corporations

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (such as domestic shell companies and Pr ivate Investment Companies (PIC ) and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: international business corporations (IBC ))21 located in higher -risk geographic locations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Deposit brokers, particularly foreign deposit brokers.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Cash -intensive businesses (e.g., convenience  stores, restaurants, retail stores, liquor

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: stores, cigarette distributors, privately owned ATMs, vending machine operators, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: parking garages).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Nongovernmental organizations and charities (foreign and domestic).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Professional service providers (e.g., att orneys, accountants, doctors, or real estate

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: brokers).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Geographic Locations

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Identifying geographic locations that may pose a higher risk is essential to a bank’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML compliance program .  U.S. banks should understand and evaluate the specific

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: risks asso ciated with doing business in, opening accounts for customers from, or facilitating

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions involving certain geographic locations .  However, geographic risk alone does

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: not necessarily determine a customer’s or transaction’s risk level, either positiv ely or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: negatively.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Higher -risk geographic locations can be either international or domestic .  International

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: higher -risk geographic locations generally include:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Countries subject to OFAC sanctions, including state sponsors of terrorism.22

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Countries identified as supporting international terrorism under section 6(j) of the Export

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Administration Act of 1979, as determined by the Secretary of State.23

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Jurisdictions determined to be “of primary money laundering concern” by the Secretary

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of the Treasury, a nd jurisdictions subject to special measures imposed by the Secretary of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the Treasury, through FinCEN, pursuant to section 311 of the USA PATRIOT  Act.24

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 19 Refer to core overview, “Private Banking Due Diligence Program (Non -U.S. Persons),” page 125, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: expanded overview, “Politically Exposed Persons,” pages 290,  for additional guidance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 20 NRA accounts may be identified by obtaining a list of financial institution customers who filed W -8s.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 21 For explanations of PICs and IBCs and additional guidance, refer to expanded overview, “Business Entities

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (Domestic and For eign),” page 314.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 22 A list of such countries, jurisdictions, and governments is available on the OFAC Web site .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 23 A list of the countries supporting international terrorism appears in the U.S. Department of State’s annual

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Country Reports on Terrorism .  This report is available on the U.S. Department of State Web site .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 24 Notices of proposed rulemaking and final rules accompanying the determination “of primary money

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: laundering concern,” and imposition of a special measure (or measures) pursuant to section 311 of the USA

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: PATRIOT Act are available on the FinCEN Web site .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Risk Assessment — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  22 11/17/2014  • Jurisdictions or countries monitored for deficiencies in their regimes to combat money

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: laundering and te rroris t financing  by international entities such as the Financial Action

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Task Force (FATF ).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Major money laundering countries and jurisdictions identified in the U.S. Department of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: State’s annual International Narcotics Control Strategy Report (INCSR), in particular,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: countries that  are identified as jurisdictions of primary concern.25

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Offshore financial centers (OFC ).26

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Other countries identified by the bank as higher -risk because of its prior experiences or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: other factors (e.g., legal considerations, or allega tions of official corruption). 27

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Domestic higher -risk geographic locations may include, but are not limited to, banking

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: offices doing business within, or having customers located within, a U.S. government -

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: designated higher -risk geographic location.  Domestic higher -risk geographic locations

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: include:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – High Intensit y Drug Trafficking Areas (HIDTA ).28

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – High Intensi ty Financial Crime Areas (HIFCA ).29

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Analysis of Specific Risk Categories

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The second step of the risk assessment process entails a more detailed an alysis of the data

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: obtained during the identification stage in order to more accurately assess BSA/AML risk.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: This step involves evaluating data pertaining to the bank’s activities (e.g., number of: domestic and international funds transfers; private banki ng customers; foreign correspondent

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: accounts; PTA s; and domestic and international geographic locations of the bank’s business

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: area and customer transactions) in relation to Customer Identification Program (CIP) and customer due diligence (CDD) information.  The level and sophistication of analysis may

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 25 The INCSR, including the lists of high- risk money laundering countries and jurisdictions, may be accessed on

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the U.S. Department of State’s Bureau of International Narcotics and Law Enforcement Affairs Web site .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 26 OFCs offer a variety of financial products and services.  For additional information, including assessments of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFCs, refer to  the International Monetary Fund’s OFC page .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 27 The Basel Anti -Money Laundering (AML) Index  is an additional resource that may be useful in assisting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banks to evaluate geographic locations.  The Basel AML Index is a composite in dex that evaluates indicators

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: from various publicly available sources such as the FATF, World Bank, Transparency International and World

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Economic Forum.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 28 The Anti -Drug Abuse Act of 1988 and The Office of National Drug Control Policy (ONDCP)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Reauthorization Act of 1998 authorized the Director of ONDCP to designate areas within the United States that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: exhibit serious drug trafficking problems and harmfully impact other areas of the country as HIDTAs.  The

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: HIDTA Program provides ad ditional federal resources to those areas to help eliminate or reduce drug

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: trafficking and its harmful consequences.  A listing of these areas can be found at the White House’s Office of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: National Drug Control Policy Web site .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 29 HIFCAs were first announced in the 1999 National Money Laundering Strategy and were conceived in the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Money Laundering and Financial Crimes Strategy Act of 1998 as a means of concentratin g law enforcement

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: efforts at the federal, state, and local levels in high intensity money laundering zones.  A listing of these areas can be found at  the FinCEN Web site

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Risk Assessment — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  23 11/17/2014  vary by bank.  The detailed analysis is important because within any type of product or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: category of customer there are accountholders that pose varying levels of risk.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: This step in the risk assessment process  gives management a better understanding of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank’s risk profile in order to develop the appropriate policies, procedures, and processes to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: mitigate the overall risk .  Specifically, the analysis of the data pertaining to the bank’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: activities should consider, as appropriate, the following factors:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Purpose of the account.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Actual or anticipated activity in the account.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Nature of the customer’s business /occupation.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Customer’s location.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Types of products and services used by the customer.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The value of a two -step risk assessment process is illustrated in the following example .  The

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: data collected in the first step of the risk assessment process reflects that a bank sends out 100 international funds transfers per day .  Further analysis may show that approximat ely 90

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: percent of the funds transfers are recurring well -documented transactions for  long -term

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: customers .  On the other hand, the analysis may show that 90 per cent of these transfers are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: nonrecurring or are for noncustomers .  While the numbers are the same for these two

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: examples, the overall risks are different.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: As illustrated above, the bank’s CIP and CDD information take on important roles in this process .  Refer to  the core overview sections, “Customer Identification Program” and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: “Customer Due Diligence ,” found on pages 47 and 56, respectively, for additional guidance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Developing the Bank’s BSA/AML Compliance Program Based U pon Its

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Risk Assessment

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Management should structure the bank’s BSA/AML compliance program to adequately address its risk profile, as identified by the risk assessment.  Management should understand the bank’s BSA/AML risk exposure and develop the appropriate policies, procedures, and processes to monitor and control BSA/AML risks .  For example, the bank’s monitoring

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: systems to identify,  research, and report suspicious activity should be risk- based, with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: particular emphasis on higher -risk products, services, customers, entities, and geographic

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: locations as identified by the bank’s BSA/AML risk assessment.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Independent testing (audit) shoul d review the bank’s risk assessment for reasonableness .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Additionally, management should consider the staffing resources and the level of training

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: necessary to promote adherence with these policies, procedures, and processes .  For those

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banks that assume a  higher -risk BSA/AML profile, management should provide a more

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: robust BSA/AML compliance program that specifically monitors and controls the higher risks that management and the board have accepted .  Refer to Appendix I (“Risk Assessment

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Link to the BSA/AM L Compliance Program”) for a chart depicting the risk assessment’s link

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to the BSA/AML compliance program.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Risk Assessment — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  24 11/17/2014  Consolidated  BSA/AML Compliance Risk Assessment

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Bank s that implement a consolidated or partially consolidated BSA/AML compliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: program should assess risk both individually within business lines and across all activities

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and legal entities .  Aggregating BSA/AML risks on a consolidated  basis for larger or more

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: complex organizations may enable an organization to better identify risk s and risk exposures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: within and across specific lines of business or product categories .  Consolidated information

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: also assists senior management and the board of d irectors in understanding and appropriately

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: mitigating risks across the organization.  To avoid having an outdated understanding of the BSA/AML risk exposures, the banking organization should continually reassess its

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML risks and communicate with business units, functions, and legal entities .  The

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: identification of a BSA/AML risk or deficiency in one area of business may indicate concerns elsewhere in the organization, which management should identify and control .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Refer to the expanded overview section, “BSA/AML Compliance Program  Structure s,” page

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 155, for additional gui dance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Bank’s Updating of the Risk Assessment

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: An effective BSA/AML compliance program controls risks associated with the bank’s products, services, customers, entities, and geographic locations; therefore, an effective risk

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: assessment should be an ongoing process, not a one -time exercise.  Management should

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: update its risk assessment to identify changes in the bank’s risk profile, as necessary (e.g.,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: when new products and services are introduced, existing products and services change, higher -risk customers ’ open and close accounts, or the bank expands through mergers and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: acquisitions) .  Even in the absence of such changes, it is a sound practice for banks to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: periodically reassess their BSA/AML risks at least every 12 to 18 months.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Examiner Development of a B SA/AML Risk Assessment

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In some situations, banks may not have performed or completed an adequate BSA/AML risk assessment and examiners must complete one based on available information.  When doing so, examiners do not have to use any particular format .  In such instances, documented

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: workpapers should include the bank’s risk assessment, the deficiencies noted in the bank’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: risk assessment, and the examiner -prepared risk assessment.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Examiners should ensure that they have a general understanding of the bank’s  BSA/AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: risks and, at a minimum, document these risks within the examination scoping process .  This

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: section provides some general guidance that examiners can use when they are required to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: complete a BSA/AML risk assessment .  In addition, examiners may sha re this information

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: with bankers to develop or improve their own BSA/AML risk assessment.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The risk assessment developed by examiners generally are not as comprehensive as one

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: developed by a bank.  However, similar to what is expected in a bank’s risk asses sment,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: examiners should obtain information on the bank’s products, services, customers, entities, and geographic locations to determine the volume and trend for potentially higher -risk areas .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: This process can begin with an analysis of:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Information retrieved from FinCEN Query, the BSA -reporting database.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Risk Assessment — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  25 11/17/2014  • Prior examination or inspection reports and workpapers.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Response to request letter items.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Discussions with bank management and appropriate regulatory agency personnel.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Reports of Conditi on and Income (Call Report) and Uniform Bank Performance Report

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (UBPR).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Examiners should complete this analysis by reviewing the level and trend of information

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: pertaining to banking activities identified, for example:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Funds transfers.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Private banking.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Mone tary instrument sales.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Foreign correspondent accounts and PTA s.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Branch locations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Domestic and international geographic locations of the bank’s business area.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: This information should be evaluated relative to such factors as the bank’s total asset size,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: customer base, entities, products, services, and geographic locations .  Examiners should

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: exercise caution if comparing information between banks and use their experience and insight when performing this analysis .  Specifically, examiners should avoid comparin g the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: number of SARs filed by a bank to those filed by another bank in the same geographic location .  Examiners can and should use their knowledge of the risks associated with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: products, services, customers, entities, and geographic locations to help them determine the bank’s BSA/AML risk profile .  Examiners may refer to Appendix J (“Quantity of Risk

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Matrix”) when completing this evaluation.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: After identifying potential higher -risk operations, examiners should form a preliminary

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML risk profile of the ba nk.  The preliminary risk profile provide s the examiner with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the basis for the initial BSA/AML examination scope and the ability to determine the adequacy of the bank’s BSA/AML compliance program .  Banks may have an appetite for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: higher -risk activities, but these risks should be appropriately mitigated by an effective

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML compliance program tailored to those specific risks.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The examiner should develop an initial examination scoping and planning document commensurate with the preliminary BSA/AML risk prof ile.  As necessary, the examiner

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should identify additional examination procedures beyond the minimum procedures that must be completed during the examination.  While the initial scope may change during the examination, the preliminary risk profile enable s the examiner to establish a reasonable scope

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: for the BSA/AML review.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Examiner Dete rmination of the Bank’s BSA/AML Aggregate Risk Profile

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: During the “Developing Conclusions and Finalizing the Examination” phase of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML examination, the examiner should assess whether the controls of the bank’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Risk Assessment — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  26 11/17/2014  BSA/AML compliance program are appropriate to manage and mitigate its BSA/AML risks .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Through this process the examiner should determine an aggregate risk profile for the bank.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: This aggregate risk profile shoul d take into consideration the risk assessment developed

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: either by the bank or by the examiner and should factor in the adequacy of the BSA/AML compliance program .  Examiners should determine whether the bank’s BSA/AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance program is adequate to appr opriately mitigate the BSA/AML risks, based on the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: risk assessment .  The existence of BSA/AML risk within the aggregate risk profile should

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: not be criticized as long as the bank’s BSA/AML compliance program adequately identifies, measures, monitors, and controls this risk as part of a deliberate risk strategy .  When the risks

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: are not appropriately controlled, examiners must communicate to management and the board of directors the need to mitigate BSA/AML risk.  Examiners should document deficiencies as

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: directed in the core examination procedures , “Developing Conclusions and Finalizing the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Examination ,” page 43.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Risk Assessment — Examinat ion Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  27 11/17/2014  Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Risk Assessment

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the BSA/AML risk profile of the bank and evaluate the adequacy of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank’s BSA/AML risk assessment process.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1. Review the bank’s BSA/AML risk assessment .  Determine whether the bank has included

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: all risk areas, including any new products, services , or customers , entities,  and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: geographic locations .  Determine whether the bank’s process for periodically reviewing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and updating its BSA/AML risk assessment is adequate.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 2. If the bank has not developed a risk assessment, or if the risk assessment is inadequate, the examiner must complete a risk assessment.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 3. Examiners should document and discuss the bank’s BSA/AML risk profile and any

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: identified deficiencies in the bank’s BSA/AML risk assessment process with bank

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: management.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Compliance Program — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  28 11/17/2014  BSA/AML Compliance Program — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the adequacy of the bank’s BSA/AML compliance program .  Determine

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: whether the bank has developed, administered, and maintained an effective program for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance with the BSA and all of its implementing regulations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Review of the bank ’s written policies, procedures, and processes is a first step in determining

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the overall adequacy of the BSA/AML compliance program .  The completion of applicable

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: core and, if warranted, expan ded examination procedures is necessary to support the overall

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: conclusions regarding the adequacy of the BSA/AML compliance program .  Examination

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: findings should be discussed with the bank’s management, and significant findings must be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: included in the report of examination  or supervisory correspondence .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The BSA/AML compliance program30 must be written, approved by the board of directors,31

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and noted in the board minutes .  A bank must have a BSA/AML compliance program

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: commensurate with its respective BSA/AML r isk profile .  Refer to the core overview section,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: “BSA/AML Risk Assessment ,” page  18, for additional guidance on developing a BSA/AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: risk assessment .  Refer to Appendix I ( “Risk Assessment Link to the BSA/AML Compliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Program ”) for a chart depicting the risk assessment’s link to the BSA/AML c ompliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: program .  Furthermore, the  BSA/AML compliance  program must be fully implemented and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reasonably designed to meet the BSA requirements .32 Policy statements alone are not

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: sufficient; p ractices must coincide with the bank ’s written policies, procedures, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: processes .  The BSA/AML compliance program must provide for the following minimum

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirements:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A system of internal controls to ensure ongoing compliance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Independent testing of BSA/ AML compliance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 30 The Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System  (Federal Reserve)  requires Edge and agreement

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: corporations and U.S. branches, agencies, and other offices of foreign banks supervised by the Federal Reserve

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to establish and maintain procedures reasonably designed to ensure and m onitor compliance with the BSA and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: related regulations (refer to Regulation K, 12 CFR 211.5(m)(1) and 12 CFR 211.24(j)(1)).  In addition, because

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the BSA does not apply extraterritorially, foreign offices of domestic banks are expected to have policies,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: procedures, and processes in place to protect against risks of money laundering and terrorist financing (12 CFR

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 The Federal Reserve, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation  (FDIC), and the Office of the Comptroller of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the Currency  (OCC) , each require the U.S. branches, agencies, and representative offices of the foreign banks

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: they supervise operating in the United States to develop written BSA compliance programs that are approved by

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: their respective bank’s board of directors and  noted in the minutes, or that are approved by delegatees acting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: under the express authority of their respective bank’s board of directors to approve the BSA compliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: programs.  “Express authority” means the head office must be aware of its U.S. AML prog ram requirements

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and there must be some indication of purposeful delegation.  For those U.S. branches, agencies, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: representative office of foreign banks that were already in compliance with existing obligations under the BSA

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (and usual and customary bus iness practices), the BSA compliance program requirement should not impose

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: additional burden.  Refer to 71 Fed. Reg.  13936 (March 20, 2006).  Refer to expanded overview section,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: “Foreign Branches and Offices of U.S. Banks,” page  164, for further guidance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 32 Refer to Appendix R  (“Enforcement Guidance”) , for additional information.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Compliance Program — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  29 11/17/2014  • Designate an individual or individuals responsible for managing BSA compliance (BSA

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance officer).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Training for appropriate personnel.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In addition, a CIP must be included as part of the BSA/AML compliance program .  Refer to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the core o verview section , “Customer Identification Program ,” page  47, for additional

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: guidance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Internal Controls

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The board of directors, acting through senior management, is ultimately responsible for ensuring that the bank maintains an effective BSA/AML internal control structure, including suspicious activity monitoring and reporting .  The board of directors and management should

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: create a culture of compliance to ensure staff adherence to the bank ’s BSA/AML policies,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: procedures, and processes .  Internal controls are the bank ’s policies, procedures, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: processes designed to limit and control risks and to achieve compliance with the BSA .  The

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: level of sophistication of the internal controls should be commensurate with the size, structure, risks , and complexity of t he bank .  Large complex banks are more likely to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: implement departmental internal controls for BSA/AML compliance .  Departmental internal

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: controls typically address risks and compliance requirements unique to a particular line of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: business or department and are part of a comprehensive BSA/AML compliance program.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Internal controls should:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Identify banking operations ( i.e., products, services, customers, entities, and geographic

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: locations) more vulnerable to abuse by money launderers and criminals; provide for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: periodic updates to the bank’ s risk profile; and provide for a BSA/AML compliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: program tailored to manage risks.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Inform the board of directors, or a committee thereof, and senior management, of compliance initiatives, identified compliance deficiencies,  and corrective action taken,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and notify directors and senior management of SARs  filed.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Identify a person or persons responsible for BSA/AML compliance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Provide for program continuity despite changes in management or employee composition

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or structure.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Meet  all regulatory recordkeeping and reporting requirements, meet recommendations for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML compliance , and provide for timely updates in response to changes in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: regulations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Implement risk -based CDD policies, procedures, and processes.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Identify reportable transactions and accurately file all required reports including SARs,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: CTRs,  and CTR exemptions .  (Banks should consider centralizing the review and report -

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: filing functions within the banking organization.)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 33 Refer to Appendix P (“BSA Record Retention Requirements”) for guidance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Compliance Program — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  30 11/17/2014  • Provide for dual controls and the segregation of duties  to the extent possible .  For

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: example, employees that complete the reporting forms (such as SARs, CTRs, and CTR

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: exemptions) generally should not also be responsible for  the decision to file  the reports or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: grant the exemptions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Provide sufficient controls and systems for filing CTRs and CTR exemptions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
