content: cash transactions.” Refer to 73 Fed. Reg.  74010, 74014 (December 5, 2008).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 89 Refer to FinCEN’s administrative ruling, Definition of Motor Vehicles of Any Kind, Motor Vehicles, Vessels,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Aircraft, and Farm Equipment  as it Relates to Potential CTR Exemption for a Non -Listed Business , FIN-2012-

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: G005, September 10, 2012.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Currency Transaction Reporting Exemptions — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  88 11/17/2014  • Operating a pawn brokerage.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Engaging i n gaming of any kind (other than licensed pari -mutuel betting at race tracks).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Engaging in investment advisory services or investment banking services.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Operating a real estate brokerage.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Operating in title insurance activities and real estate closings.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Engaging in trade union activities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Engaging in any other activity that may, from time to time, be specified by FinCEN , such

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: as marijuana- related businesses .90

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: A business that engages in multiple business activities may qualify for an exemption as a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: non-listed  business as long as no more than 50 percent of its gross revenues per year91 are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: derived from one or more of the ineligible business activities listed in the rule.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: A bank must consider and maintain materials and other supporting information that allow it to substantiate that the decision to exempt the customer from currency transaction reporting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: was based upon a reasonable determination  that the customer derives no more than 50

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: percent of its annual gross revenues from ineligible business activities .  Such a reasonable

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: determination should be based upon its understanding of the nature of the customer’s business, the purpose of the customer’s accounts, and the actual or anticipated activity in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: those accounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Payroll Customers

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: A “payroll customer ” is define d solely with respect to withdrawals for payroll purposes from

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: existing exemptible accounts and as a person who: (i) has maintained a transaction account at

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the bank for at least two months or prior to the passing of two months’ time if the bank undertakes  a risk -based analysis of that customer that allows it to form and document a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reasonable belief that the customer has a legitimate business purpose for conducting frequent large currency transactions ; (ii) operates a firm that frequently

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 93 withdraws more th an

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 90 See FinCEN’s Guidance: BSA Expectations Regarding Marijuana- Related Businesses , FIN-2014- 001,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: February 14, 2014.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 91 Questions often arise in determining the “gross revenue” of gaming activities, such as lottery sales.  FinCEN

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: has ruled that for the purpose of determining if a business derives more than 50 percent of it s gross revenue

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: from gaming, the term gross revenue is intended to encompass the amount of money that a business actually

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: earns from a particular activity, rather than the sales volume of such activity conducted by the business.  For example, if a business  engages in lottery sales, the “gross revenue” from this activity would be the amount of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: money that the business actually earns from lottery sales, rather than the amount of money that the business

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: takes in on behalf of the state lottery system.  Refer to FinCEN Ruling 2002- 1, at the FinCEN Web site

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 92 For additional details, refer to Guidance on Supporting Information Suitable for D etermining the Portion of a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Business Customer's Annual Gross Revenues that is Derived from Activities Ineligible for Exemption from

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Currency Transaction Reporting Requirement s, FIN-2009- G001, April 27, 2009.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 93 FinCEN issued a final rule substituting the term “frequently” for “regularly” in the provision of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: exemption rules dealing with payroll customers 77 Fed. Reg. 33639, (June 7, 2012) and issued guidance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Currency Transaction Reporting Exemptions — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  89 11/17/2014  $10,000 in order to pay its U.S. employees in currency; and (iii) is incorporated or organized

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: under the laws of the United States or a state, or is registered as and is eligible to do business

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: within the United States or a state.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Filing Time Frames

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: After a bank has decided to exempt a Phase II customer, the bank must file a Designation of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Exempt Person report  through the BSA E -Filing System within 30 days after the first

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transaction in currency that the bank plans  to exempt.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Annual Review

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The information supporting each designation of a Phase II exempt person must be reviewed

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and verified by the bank at least annually .  The bank should document the annual review .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Moreover, consistent with this annual review, a bank must review and verify a t least annually

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: that management monitors these Phase II accounts for suspicious transactions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Safe Harbor for Failure to File CTRs

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The rules ( 31 CFR 1020.315(e)(10 )(g); provide a safe harbor that a bank is not liable for the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: failure to file a CTR for a tr ansaction in currency by an exempt person, unless the bank

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: knowingly provides false or incomplete information or has reason to believe that the customer does not qualify as an exempt customer .  In the absence of any specific knowledge

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or information indica ting that a customer no longer meets the requirements of an exempt

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: person, the bank is entitled to a safe harbor from civil penalties to the extent it continues to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: treat that customer as an exempt customer until the date of the customer ’s annual review.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Effect on Other Regulatory Requirements

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The exemption procedures do not have any effect on the requirement that banks file SARs  or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: on other recordkeeping requirements .  For example, the fact that a customer is an exempt

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: person has no effect on a bank’ s obligation to retain records of funds transfers by that person,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or to retain records in connection with the sale of monetary instruments to that person.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: If a bank has improperly exempted accounts  or ceases to treat a customer as exempt , it may

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: revoke the exemption  by filing a Designation of Exempt Persons (DOEP) report and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: checking the “Exemption Revoked” box or revoke the exemption by filing CTRs on the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: customer .  In the case of improperly exempted accounts , the bank should begin filing CTRs

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and should contact FinCEN’s Regulatory Helpline94 to request a determination on whether

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the backfiling of unreported currency  transactions is necessary.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Additional information can be found on the FinCEN Web  site.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: updating the exemption eligibility for payroll customers.  Refer to Guidance on Determining Eligibility for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Exemption from Currency Transaction Reporting Requirements , FIN-2012- G003, June 11, 2012.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 94 Please direct all inquiries to the FinCEN Reso urce Center by calling  the toll -free number  (800) 767-2825 or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (703) 905- 3591 or by e -mailing FRC@fincen.gov .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Currency Transaction Reporting Exemptions — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  90 11/17/2014  Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Currency Transaction Reporting Exemptions

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the bank ’s compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: exemptions from the currency transaction reporting requirements.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1. Determine whether the bank uses the Currency Transaction Report (CTR) exemption

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: process .  If yes, determine whether the policies, procedures, and processes for CTR

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: exemptions are adequate.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Phase I Exemptions ( 31 CFR 1020.315(b)(1) -(5)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 2. Determine whether the bank files the Designation of Exempt Person report electronically through FinCEN’s E -Filing System to exempt eligible listed public companies and their

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: subsidiaries  from CTR reporting as defined in 31 CFR 1020.311.  The report should be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: filed within 30 days of the first reportable transaction that was exempted.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 3. Assess whether ongoing and reasonable due diligence is performed, including required annual reviews to determine whether a listed public company or subsidiary  remains

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: eligible for designation as an exempt person under the regulatory requirements .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Management should properly document exemption determinations (e.g., with stock

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: quotes from newspapers and consolidated returns for the entity).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Phase II Exemptions ( 31 CFR 1020.315(b )(6)-(7)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Under the regulation, the definition of exempt persons includes “ non-listed businesses ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and “ payroll customers ” as defined in 31 CFR 1020.315(b)( 6)-(7).  Nevertheless, several

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: businesses remain ineligible for exemption purposes; refer to 31 CFR 1020.315(e)(8)  and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the “ Currency Transaction Reporting Exemptions  — Overview” section of this manual.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 4. Determine whether the bank files a Designation of Exempt Person report electronically

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: through the FinCEN E -Filing System to exempt a customer, as identif ied by

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: management, from CTR reporting.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 5. Determine whether the bank maintains documentation to support that the “ non-listed

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: businesses ” it has designated as exempt from CTR reporting do not receive more than 50

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: percent of gross revenue from ineligible bus iness activities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 6. Assess whether ongoing and reasonable due diligence is performed, including required annual reviews, to determine whether a customer is eligible for designation as exempt from CTR reporting .  Customers must meet the following requireme nts to be eligible for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: exemption under the regulation:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Have frequent

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 95 currency transactions in excess of $10,000 ( including withdrawals to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: pay domestic employees in currency in the case of a payroll customer).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 95 FinCEN has noted that when interpreting the term “frequently” for purposes of 31 CFR 1020.315(b)(6)(ii):

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: “[Banks] may designate an otherwise eligible customer for Phase II exemption after the customer has within a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Currency Transaction Reporting Exemptions — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  91 11/17/2014  • Be incorporated or organized under the laws of  the United States or a state, or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: registered as and eligible to do business within the United States or a state.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Maintain a transaction account at the bank for at least two months (or prior to the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: passing of two months’ time if the bank has conducted a ris k-based analysis of a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: customer that allows it to form and document a reasonable belief that the customer has a legitimate business purpose for conducting frequent large currency

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Transaction Testing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 7. On the basis of a risk assessment, prior  examination reports, and a review of the bank’ s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: audit findings, select a sample of Designation of Exempt Person (DOEP) reports  from the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank to test compliance with the regulatory requirements (e.g., only eligible businesses are exempted  and adequate supporting documentation is maintained).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 8. On the basis of examination procedures completed, including transaction testing, form a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: conclusion about the ability of policies, procedures, and processes to meet regulatory

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirements associated with currency transaction reporting exemptions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: year conducted five or more reportable cash transactions.” Refer to 73 Fed. Reg.  74010, 74014 (December 5,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Information Sharing — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  92 11/17/2014  Information Sharing — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the financial institution ’s compliance with the statutory and regulatory

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirements for  the “ Special Information Sharing Procedures to Deter Money Laundering

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and Terrorist Activity ” (section 314 Information Requests).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: On September 26, 2002, final regulations (31 CFR 103.100 and 31 CFR 103.110)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: implementing section 314 of the USA PATRIOT  Act became effective.  The regulations

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: established procedures for information sharing to deter money laundering and terrorist activity .  On February 5, 2010, FinCEN amended the regulations to allow state, local, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: certain foreign law enforcement agencies  access to the information sharing program.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Information Sharing Between Law Enforcement and Financial Institutions

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: — Section 314( a) of the USA PATRIOT  Act ( 31 CFR 1010.520 )

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: A federal , state, local, or foreign97 law enforcement agency investigating terrorist activity or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: money laundering may request that FinCEN solicit, on its behalf, certain information from a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial institution or a group of financial institutions .  The law enforcement agency must

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: provide a written certification to FinCEN attesting that th ere is credible evidence of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: engagement or reasonably suspected engagement in terrorist activity or money laundering for each individual, entity, or organization about which the law enforcement agency is seeking

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: information .  The law enforcement agency also  must provide specific identifiers, such as a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: date of birth and address, which would permit a financial institution to differentiate among

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: common or similar names .  Upon receiving a completed written certification from a law

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: enforcement agency, FinCEN may require a financial institution to search its records to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: determine whether it maintains or has maintained accounts for, or has engaged in transactions

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: with, any specified individual, entity, or organization.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Search Requirements

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Upon receiving an information request,98 a financial institution must conduct a one -time

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: search of its records to identify accounts or transactions of a named suspect .  Unless

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: otherwise instructed by an information request, financial institutions must search their

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: records for current accounts, accounts maintained during the preceding 12 months, and transactions conducted outside of an account by or on behalf of a named suspect during the preceding six months .  The financial institution must search its records and report any

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: positive ma tches to FinCEN within 14 days, unless otherwise specified in the information

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: request.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In March 2005, FinCEN began posting section 314(a) subject lists through the W eb-based

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 314(a) Secure Information Sharing System .  Every two weeks, or more frequently if an

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: emergency request is transmitted, the financial institution’s designated point(s) of contact

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: receives  notification from FinCEN that there are new postings on the  FinCEN ’s secure W eb

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 96 Refer to 75 Fed. Reg.  6560 (Febru ary 10, 2010).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 97 A foreign law enforcement agency must come from a jurisdiction that is a party to the Agreement on Mutual

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Legal Assistance between the United States and the European Union.  Id.  at 6560- 61.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 98 If the request contains multiple suspects, it is often referred to as a “314(a) list.”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Information Sharing — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  93 11/17/2014  site.  The point of contact is  able to access the current section 314(a) subject list (and one

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: prior) and download the files in various formats for searching .  Financial institutions should

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: report all positive matches via the Secure Information Sharing System  (SISS) .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN has provi ded financial institutions with General Instructions and Frequently Asked

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Questions (FAQ ) relating to the section 314(a) process .  Unless otherwise instructed by an

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: information request, financial institutions must search the records specified in the Genera l

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Instructions.99 The General Instructions or FAQs are made available to the financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institutions on the SISS.100

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: If a financial institution identifies any account or transaction, it must report to  FinCEN that it

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: has a match .  No details should be provided to FinCEN other than the fact that the financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institution has a match .  A negative response is not required.  A financial institution may

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: provide the  314(a)  subject lists to a third -party service provider or vendor to perform or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: facilitate record search es as long as the institution takes the necessary steps, through the use

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of an agreement or procedures, to ensure that the third  party safeguards and maintains the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: confidentiality of the information.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: According to the FAQs available on the S ISS, if a financ ial institution receiving 314(a)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: subject lists through the SISS  fails to perform or complete searches on one or more

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: information request received during the previous 12 months, it must immediately obtain

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: these prior requests from FinCEN and perform a retroactive search of its records.101 A

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial institution is not required to perform retroactive searches in connection with information sharing requests that were transmitted more than 12 months before the date upon which it discovers that it failed to perfo rm or complete searches on prior information

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requests .  Additionally, in performing retroactive searches a financial institution is not

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: required to search records created after the date of the original information request.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Use Restrictions and Confidentiality

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Financial institutions should develop and implement comprehensive policies, procedures, and processes for responding to section 314(a) requests .  The regulation restricts the use of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: information provided in a section 314(a) request ( 31 CFR 1010.520( b)(3)(iv )).  A financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institution may only use the information to report the required information to FinCEN, to determine whether to establish or maintain an account or engage in a transaction, or to assist in BSA/AML compliance .  While the section 314(a)  subject  list could be used to determine

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 99 For example, regarding funds transfers, the “General Instructions” state that, unless the instructions to a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: specific 314(a) request state otherwise, banks are required to search funds transfer records maintained p ursuant

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to 31 CFR 1010.410, to determine whether the named subject was an originator/transmittor of a funds transfer

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: for which the bank was the originator/transmittor’s financial institution, or a beneficiary/recipient of a funds

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transfer for which the bank was the beneficiary/recipient’s financial institution.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 100 The General Instructions and FAQs also can be obtained by calling  the FinCEN  Resource Center ’s toll -free

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: number  (800) 767-2825 or (703) 905 -3591 or by e -mailing FRC@fincen.gov .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 101 The financial institution should contact FinCEN’s 314 Program Office by  e-mailing sys314a@fincen.gov to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: obtain prior information requests.  If the financial institu tion discovers a positive match while performing a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: retroactive search, it should contact the 314 Program Office ’s toll-free number at (866) 326-8314.  Financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institutions must respond with positive matches within 14 days of receiving a prior information  request;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: however, if a retroactive search results in no positive matches then no further action is required.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Information Sharing — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  94 11/17/2014  whether to establish or maintain an account, FinCEN strongly discourages financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institutions from using this as the sole factor in reaching a decision to do so unless the request specifically states otherwi se.  Unlike the OFAC lists, section 314(a) subject lists are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: not permanent “ watch lists. ” In fact, section 314(a)  subject  lists generally relate to one -time

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: inquiries and are not updated or corrected if an investigation is dropped, a prosecution is declined, or a subject is exonerated.  Further, the names do not correspond to convicted or indicted persons; rather a 314(a) subject need only be “ reasonably suspected”  based on

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: credible evidence of engaging in terrorist acts or money laundering .  Moreover, FinC EN

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: advises that inclusion on a section 314(a) subject list should not be the sole factor used to determine whether to file a SAR .  Financial institutions should establish a process for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: determining when and if a SAR should be filed.  Refer to the core overv iew section ,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: “Suspicious Activity Reporting ,” page  60, for additional guidance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Actions taken pursuant to information provided in a request from FinCEN do not affect a financial institution ’s obligations to comply with all of the rules and regulations of O FAC nor

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: do they affect a financial institution ’s obligations to respond to any legal process .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Additionally, actions taken in response to a request do not relieve a financial institution of its obligation to file a SAR and immediately notify law enforcemen t, if necessary, in accordance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: with applicable laws and regulations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: A financial institution cannot disclose to any person, other than to FinCEN, the institution’ s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: primary banking  regulator, or the law enforcement agency on whose behalf FinCEN is

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requestin g information, the fact that FinCEN has requested or obtained information.  A

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial institution should designate one or more points of contact  for receiving information

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requests .  FinCEN has stated that an affiliated group of financial institutions may  establish

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: one point of contact  to distribute the section 314(a) subject list to respond to requests .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: However, the section 314(a)  subject  lists cannot be shared with any foreign office, branch, or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: affiliate (unless the request specifically states otherwise), and the lists cannot be shared with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: affiliates, or subsidiaries of bank holding companies, if the affiliates or subsidiaries are not

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial institutions as described in 31 USC 5312(a)(2).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Each financial institution must maintain adequate procedures to protect the security and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: confidentiality of requests from FinCEN .  The procedures to ensure confidentiality are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: considered adequate if the financial institution applies procedures similar to those it has established to comply with section 501 of the Gramm –Leach –Bliley Act (15 USC 6801) for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the protection of its customers ’ nonpublic personal information.  Financial institutions may

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: keep a log of all section 314(a) requests received and of any positive matches identified and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reported to FinCEN.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Documentation

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Additionally, documentation that all required searches were performed is essential .  Banks

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: may print or store a search self -verification document from the Web -based 314(a) SISS for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: each 314(a ) subject list transmission .  Additionally , a Subject Response List can be printed

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: for documentation purposes .  The Subject Response List displays the total number of positive

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: responses submitted to FinCEN for that transmission, the transmission date, the submitted

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: date, and the tracking number and subject name that had the positive hit .  If the financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institution elects to maintain copies of the section 314(a) requests, it should not be criticized

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Information Sharing — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  95 11/17/2014  for doing so, as long as it appropriately secures them a nd protects their confidentiality .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Audits should include an evaluation of compliance with these guidelines within their scope.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN regularly updates a list of recent search transmissions, including information on the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: date of transmission, tracking number, and number of subjects listed in the transmission.102

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Bankers and examiners may review this list to verify that search requests have been received .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Each bank should contact its primary federal regulator for guidance to ensure it obtains the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: section 314(a) subject list and for updating contact information.103

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Voluntary Information Sharing — Section 314( b) of the USA PATRIOT

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Section 314(b) encourages financial institutions104 and associations of financial institutions105

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: located in the United States to share information in order to identify and report activities that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: may involve terrorist activity or money laundering .  Section 314(b) also provides specific

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: protection from civil liability .106 To avail itself of this statutory safe harbor from liability,  a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial institution or an association must notify FinCEN of its intent to engage in information sharing and that it has established and w ill maintain adequate procedures to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: protect the security and confidentiality of the information.  Failure to comply with the requirements of 31 CFR 1010.540 result s in loss of safe harbor protection for information

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: sharing and may result in a violation of privacy laws or other laws and regulations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: If a financial institution chooses to voluntarily participate in section 314(b), policies,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: procedures, and processes should be developed and implemented for sharing and receiving of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: information.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: A notice to share  information is effective for one year.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 107 The financial institution should

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: designate a point of contact  for receiving and providing information.  A financial institution

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should establish a process for sending and receiving information sharing requests .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 102 This list, titled “Law Enforcement Information Sharing with the Financial Industry,” is available on the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: “Section 314(a)” page of FinCEN Web sit e.  The list contains information on each search request transmitted

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: since January 4, 2005, and is updated after each transmission.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 103 Refer to the FinCEN Web site  for secti on 314(a) contacts for each primary regulator.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 104 31 CFR 1010.540 generally defines “financial institution” as any financial institution described in 31  USC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 5312(a)(2) that is required to establish and maintain an AML compliance program.  Refer to FinCEN’s Section

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 314(b) Fact Sheet dated October 2013 for general information.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 105 In July 2012, FinCEN issued an administrative ruling that  clarified the meaning of “association of financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institutions.”  See FIN -2012- R006 .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 106 FinCEN has indicated that a financial institution participating in the section 314(b) program may share

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: information relating to transactions that the institution suspects may involve the proceeds of one or more

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: specified unlawful activities (SUAs) and such an institution will still remain within the protection of the section

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 314(b) safe harbor from liability.  Information related to the SUAs may be shared appropriately within the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 314(b) safe harbor to the extent t hat the financial institution suspects that the transaction may involve the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: proceeds of one or more SUAs and the purpose of the permitted information sharing under the 314(b) rule is to identify and report activities that the financial institution suspects  may involve possible  terrorist activity or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: money laundering.  Refer to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Guidance on the Scope of Permissible Information Sharing Covered by Section

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 314(b) Safe Harbor of the  USA PATRIOT Act , FIN-2009- G002, June 16, 2009.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 107 Instructions on submitting a notification form (initial or renewal) are available on the FinCEN Web site .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Information Sharing — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  96 11/17/2014  Additionally, a financial institution must take reasonable steps to verify that the other

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial institution or association of financial institutions with which it intends to share

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: information has also submitted the required notice to FinCEN .  FinCEN provi des

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: participating financial institutions with access to a list of other participating financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institutions and their related contact information.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: If a financial institution receives such information from another financial institution, it must

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: also limit use of the information and maintain its security and confidentiality ( 31 CFR

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1010.540(b)(4) .  Such information may be used only to identify and, where appropriate,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: report on money laundering and terrorist activities; to determine whether to establish or maintain an account; to engage in a transaction; or to assist in BSA compliance .  The

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: procedures to ensure confidentiality are considered adequate if the financial institution applies procedures similar to the ones it has established to comply with section 501 of the Gramm –Leach –Bliley Act (15 USC 6801) for the protection of its customers ’ nonpublic

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: personal information.  The safe harbor does not extend to sharing of information across international borders .  In addition, section 314(b) does not authorize a financial institution to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: share a SAR, nor does it permit the financial institution to disclose the existence or nonexistence of a SAR .  If a financial institution shares information under section 314(b)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: about the subject of a prepared or filed SAR, the inf ormation shared should be limited to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: underlying transaction and customer information.  A financial institution may use

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: information obtained under section 314(b) to determine whether to file a SAR, but the intention to prepare or file a SAR cannot be shared with another financial institution .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Financial institutions should establish a process for determining when and if a SAR should be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: filed.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Actions taken pursuant to information obtained through the voluntary information sharing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: process do not affect a financial institution ’s obligations to respond to any legal process .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Additionally, actions taken in response to information obtained through the voluntary

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: information sharing process do not relieve a financial institution of its obligation to file a SAR a nd to immediately notify law enforcement, if necessary, in accordance with all

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: applicable laws and regulations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Information Sharing — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  97 11/17/2014  Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Information Sharing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the financial institution ’s compliance w ith the statutory and regulatory

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirements for the “ Special Information Sharing Procedures to Deter Money Laundering

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and Terrorist Activity ” (section 314 Information Requests).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Information Sharing Between Law Enforcement and Financial Institutions

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (Sect ion 314(a))

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1. Verify that the financial institution is currently receiving section 314(a) requests from

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN or from an affiliated financial institution that serves as the subject financial institution ’s point of contact .  If the financial institution is not receiving information

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requests or contact information changes, the financial institution should update its contact information with its primary regulator in accordance with the instructions on the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Web site .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 2. Verify that the financial institution has sufficient policies, procedures, and processes to document compliance; maintain sufficient internal controls; provide ongoing training; and independently test its compliance with 31 CFR 1010.520, which impleme nts section

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 314(a) of the USA PATRIOT  Act.  At a minimum, the procedures should accomplish the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: following:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Designate a point of contact  for receiving information requests.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Ensure that the confidentiality of requested information is safeguarded.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Establish a process for responding to FinCEN ’s requests.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Establish a process for determining if and when a SAR should be filed.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 3. Determine whether the search policies, procedures, and processes the financial institution uses to respond to section 314(a) requests are  comprehensive and cover all records

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: identified in the General Instructions for such requests .  The General Instructions include

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: searching accounts maintained by the named subject during the preceding 12 months and transactions conducted within the last si x months .  Financial institutions have 14 days

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: from the transmission date of the request to respond to a section 314(a) Subject

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Information Form.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 4. If the financial institution uses a third -party vendor to perform or facilitate searches,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: determine whether  an agreement or procedures are in place to ensure confidentiality.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 5. Review the financial institution ’s internal controls and determine whether its

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: documentation to evidence compliance with section 314(a) requests is adequate .  This

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: documentation could i nclude, for example , the following:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Copies of section 314(a) requests.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A log that records the tracking numbers and includes a sign -off column.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Information Sharing — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  98 11/17/2014  • Copies of SISS -generated search self -verification documents.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • If appropriate , request documentation from FinCEN re garding the bank’s history of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: accessing the SISS.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • For positive matches, copies of the form returned to FinCEN  (e.g., SISS -generated

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Subject Response Lists)  and the supporting documentation should be retained.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Voluntary Information Sharing (Section 314(b))

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 6. Determine whether the financial institution has decided to share information voluntarily .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: If so, verify that the financial institution has filed a notification form with FinCEN and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: provides an effective date for the sharing of information that is withi n the previous 12

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: months.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 7. Verify that the financial institution has policies, procedures, and processes for sharing information and receiving shared information, as specified under 31 CFR 1010.540,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (which implements section 314(b) of the USA PATRIOT  Act).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 8. Financial institutions that choose to share information voluntarily should have policies,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: procedures, and processes to document compliance; maintain adequate internal controls;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: provide ongoing training; and independently test its compliance with 31 C FR 1010.540.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: At a minimum, the procedures should:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Designate a point of contact  for receiving and providing information.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Ensure the safeguarding and confidentiality of information received and information

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requested.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Establish a process for sending and responding to requests, including ensuring that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: other parties with whom the financial institution intends to share information

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (including affiliates) have filed the proper notice.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Establish procedures for determining whether and when a SAR should be filed.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 9. If the financial institution is sharing information with other entities and is not following

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the procedures outlined in 31 CFR 1010.540(b) , notify the examiners reviewing the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: privacy rules.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 10. Through a review of the financial institution’ s documentation (including account

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: analysis) on a sample of the information shared and received, evaluate how the financial institution determined whether a SAR was warranted .  The financial institution is not

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: required to file SARs solely on the basis of information obtai ned through the section

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 314(b) voluntary information sharing process .  In fact, the information obtained through

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the section 314(b) voluntary information sharing process may enable the financial institution to determine that no SAR is required for transact ions that may have initially

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: appeared suspicious .  The financial institution should have considered account activity in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: determining whether a SAR was warranted.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Information Sharing — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  99 11/17/2014  Transaction Testing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 11. On the basis of a risk assessment, prior examination reports, and a review of the financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institution ’s audit findings, select a sample of positive matches or recent requests to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: determine whether the following requirements have been met:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The financial institution ’s policies, procedures, and processes enable it to search all of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the records identified in the General Instructions for section 314(a) requests .  Such

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: processes may be electronic, manual, or both.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The financial institution searches appropriate records for each information request

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: received .  For positive matches:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: − Verify that a response was provided to FinCEN within the designated time period

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: − Review the financial institution ’s documentation (including account analysis) to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: evaluate how the financial institution determined whether a SAR was  warranted .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Financial institutions are not required to file SARs solely on the basis of a match

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: with a named subject; instead, account activity should be considered in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: determining whether a SAR is warranted.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The financial institution uses information only  in the manner and for the purposes allowed

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and keeps information secure and confidential ( 31 CFR 1010.520(b)(3) (iv).  (This

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirement can be verified through discussions with management.)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 12. On the basis of examination procedures completed, including t ransaction testing, form a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: conclusion about the ability of policies, procedures, and processes to meet regulatory requirements associated with information sharing.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Purchase and Sale of Monetary Instruments Record Keeping — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  100 11/17/2014  Purchase and Sale of Monetary Instruments Recordkeeping —

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the bank ’s compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements for the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: recording of information required for the purchase and sale of monetary instruments for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: currency in amounts between $3,000 and $10,000, inclusive .  This section covers the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: regulatory requirements as set forth by the BSA .  Refer to the expanded sections of this

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: manual for additional discussions and procedures on specific money laundering risks for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: purchase and sale of monetary inst ruments activities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Banks sell a variety of monetary instruments (e.g., bank checks or drafts, including foreign

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: drafts, money orders, cashier ’s checks, and traveler ’s checks) in exchange for currency .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Purchasing these instruments in amounts of less than $10,000 is a common method used by money launderers to evade large currency transaction reporting requirements .  Once

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: converted from currency, criminals typically deposit these instruments in accounts with other banks to facilitate the movement of funds through the payment system .  In many cases, the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: persons involved do not have an account with the bank from which the instruments are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: purchased.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Purchaser Verification

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Under 31 CFR 1010.415 banks are required to verify the identity of persons purchasing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: monetary instruments for currency in amounts between $3,000 and $10,000, inclusive, and to maintain records of all such sales.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Banks may either verify that the purchaser of monetary instruments is a deposit

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: accountholder with identifying information on record with the bank, or a bank may verify the identity of the purchaser by viewing a form of identification that contains the customer ’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: name and address and that the financial community accept s as a means of identification when

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: cashing checks for noncustomers .  The bank must obtain additional information for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: purchasers who do not have deposit accounts .  The method used to verify the identity of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: purchaser must be recorded.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Acceptable Identif ication

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The U.S. Treasury ’s Administrative Ruling 92 -1 provides guidance on how a bank can verify

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the identity of an elderly or disabled customer who does not possess the normally acceptable forms of identification .  A bank may accept a Social Security , Medicare, or Medicaid card

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: along with another form of documentation bearing the customer ’s name and address .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Additional forms of documentation include a utility bill, a tax bill, or a voter registration card.  The forms of alternate identification a bank decides to accept should be included in its

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: formal policies, procedures, and processes.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Contemporaneous Purchases

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Contemporaneous purchases of the same or different types of instruments totaling $3,000 or more must be treated as one purchase.  Multiple purchases during one business day totaling $3,000 or more must be aggregated and treated as one purchase if the bank has knowledge

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: that the purchases have occurred.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Purchase and Sale of Monetary Instruments Record Keeping — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  101 11/17/2014  Indirect Currency Purchases of Monetary Instruments

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Banks may implement a policy requiring custo mers who are deposit accountholders and who

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: want to purchase monetary instruments in amounts between $3,000 and $10,000 with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: currency to first deposit the currency into their deposit accounts .  Nothing within the BSA or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: its implementing regulations prohibits a bank from instituting such a policy.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: However, FinCEN takes the position108 that when a customer purchases a monetary

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: instrument in amounts between $3,000 and $10,000 using currency that the customer first

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: deposits into the customer ’s account, the transa ction is still subject to the recordkeeping

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirements of 31 CFR 1010.415.  This requirement applies whether the transaction is

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: conducted in accordance with a bank’ s established policy or at the request of the customer .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Generally, when a bank sells monetary instruments to deposit accountholders, the bank already maintain s most of the information required by 31 CFR 1010.415 in the normal course

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of its business.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Recordkeeping and Retention Requirements

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Under 31 CFR 1010.415, a bank ’s records of sales must contain, at a minimum, the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: following information:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • If the purchaser has a deposit account  with the bank:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: − Name of the purchaser.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: − Date of purchase.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: − Types of instruments purchased.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: − Serial numbers of each of the instruments purchased.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: − Dollar amounts of each of the instruments purchased in currency.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: − Specific identifying information, if applicable.109

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • If the purchaser does not have a deposit account with the bank:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Name and address of the purchaser.
