name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Social Security or alien identification number of the purchaser.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Date of birth of the purchaser.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Date of purchase.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 108 FinCEN’s Guidance on Interpreting Financial Institution Policies in Relation to Recordkeeping

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Requirements under 31 CFR 103.29 , November 2002.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 109 The bank must verify that  the person is a deposit accountholder or must verify the person’s identity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Verification may be either through a signature card or other file or record at the bank, provided the deposit

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: accountholder’s name and address were verified previously and that i nformation was recorded on the signature

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: card or other file or record, or by examination of a document that is normally acceptable within the banking

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: community and that contains the name and address of the purchaser.  If the deposit accountholder’s identit y has

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: not been verified previously, the bank shall record the specific identifying information (e.g., state of issuance and number of driver’s license) of the document examined.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Purchase and Sale of Monetary Instruments Record Keeping — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  102 11/17/2014  – Types of instruments purchased.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Serial numbers of each of the instruments purchased.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Dollar amounts of each of the instruments purchased.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Specific identifying information for verifying the purchaser ’s identity  (e.g., state of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: issuance and number on driver ’s license).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: If the purchaser cannot provide the required information at the time of the transaction or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: through the bank’ s own previously verified records, the transaction should be refused.  The

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: records of monetary instrument sales must be retained for five years and be available to the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: appropriate agencies upon request.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Purchase and S ale of Monetary Instruments Record Keeping — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  103 11/17/2014  Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Purchase and Sale of Monetary Instrum ents Recordkeeping

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the bank ’s compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements for the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: recording of information required for the purchase and sale of monetary instruments for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: currency in amounts between $3,000 and $10,000, inclusive .  This section covers the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: regulatory requirements as set forth by the BSA .  Refer to the expanded sections of this

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: manual for additional discussions and procedures on specific money laundering risks for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: purchase and sale of monetary instruments activities .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1. Determine whether the bank maintains the required records (in a manual or an automated

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: system) for sales of bank checks or drafts including foreign drafts, cashier ’s checks,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: money orders, and traveler ’s checks for currency in amounts between $3,000 and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: $10,000, inclusive, to purchasers who have deposit accounts with the bank.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 2. Determine whether the bank ’s policies, procedures, and processes permit currency sales

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of monetary instruments to purchasers who do not have deposit accounts with the bank

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (nondepositors ):

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: If so, determine whether the bank maintains the required records for sales of monetary instruments to nondepositors.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: If not permitted, determine whether the bank allows sales on an exception basis.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Transaction Testing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 3. On the basis of a risk assessment, prior examination reports, and a review of the bank’ s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: audit findings, select a sample of monetary instruments sold for currency in amounts

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: between $3,000 and $10,000, inclusive, to determine whether the bank obtains, verifies,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and retains the required records to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 4. On the basis of examination procedures completed, including transaction testing, form a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: conclusion about the ability of policies, procedures, and processes to meet regulatory

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirements associated with the purchase and sale of monetary instruments.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 5. On the basis of  the previous conclusion and the risks associated with the bank’ s activity

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: in this area, proceed to expanded examination procedures, if necessary.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Funds Transfers Record Keeping — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  104 11/17/2014  Funds Transfers Recordkeeping — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the bank ’s compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: funds transfers .  This section covers the regulatory requirements as set forth in the BSA .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Refer to the expanded sections of this manual for discussions and procedures regarding

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: specific money laundering risks for funds transfer activities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Funds transfer systems enable the instantaneous transfer  of funds, including both domestic

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and cross -border transfers .  Consequently these systems can present an attractive method to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: disguise the source of funds derived from illegal activity .  The BSA was amended by the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Annunzio–Wylie Anti- Money Laundering Act of 1992 to authorize the U.S. Treasury and the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Federal Reserve Board to prescribe regulations for domestic and international funds transfers.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In 1995, the U.S. Treasury and the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System issued

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: a final rule on recordk eeping requirements concerning payment orders by banks ( 31 CFR

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1010.410.110 The rule requires each bank involved in funds transfers111 to collect and retain

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: certain information in connection with funds transfers of $3,000 or more.112 The information

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: required to be collected and retained depends on the bank’ s role in the particular funds

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transfer (originator’ s bank, intermediary bank, or beneficiary ’s bank).113 The requirements

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: may also vary depending on whether an originator or beneficiary is an established customer

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of a bank and whether a payment order is made in person or otherwise.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Also in 1995, the U.S. Treasury issued a final rule that requires all financial institutions to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: include certain information in transmittal orders for funds transfers of $3,000 or more (31

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: CFR 1010.410) .114 This requirement is commonly referred to as the “ Travel Rule. ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 110 31 CFR 1020.410(a)  is the recordkeeping rule for banks, and 31 CFR 1010.410(e) imposes similar

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirements for nonbank financial institutions that engage in funds transfers.  The procedures in this core

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: overview section address only the rules for banks in 31 CFR 1020.410(a) .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 111 Funds transfer is defined under 31 CFR 1010.100.  Funds transfers governed by the Electronic Fund Transfer

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Act of 1978, as well as any other funds transfers that are made through an automated clearing house, an

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: automated teller machine, or a point -of-sale system, are excluded from this definition and exempt from the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirements of 31 CFR 1020.410(a) , and 31 CFR 1010.410(e) and (f) .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 112 31 CFR 1020.410(e)(6) provides exceptions to the funds transfer requirements.  Funds transfers wher e both

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the originator and the beneficiary are the same person and the originator’s bank and the beneficiary’s bank are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the same bank are not subject to the recordkeeping requirements for funds transfers.  Additionally, exceptions

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: are provided from the reco rdkeeping requirements for funds transfers where the originator and beneficiary are: a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank; a wholly owned domestic subsidiary of a bank chartered in the United States; a broker or dealer in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: securities; a wholly owned domestic subsidiary of a broker or de aler in securities; the United States; a state or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: local government; or a federal, state or local government agency or instrumentality.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 113 These terms are defined under 31 CFR 1010.100 .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 114 The rule applies to both banks and nonbanks (31 CFR 1010.410(f).  Bec ause it is broader in scope, the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Travel Rule uses more expansive terms, such as “transmittal order” instead of “payment order” and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: “transmittor’s financial institution” instead of “originating bank.” The broader terms include the bank -specific

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: terms.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Funds Transfers Record Keeping — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  105 11/17/2014  Responsibilities of Originator ’s Banks

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Recordkeeping Requirements

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: For each payment order in the amount of $3,000 or more that a bank accepts as an

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: originator ’s bank, the bank must obtain and retain the following records ( 31 CFR

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Name and address of the originator.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Amount of the payment order.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Date of the payment order.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Any payment instructions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Identity of the beneficiary ’s institution.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • As many of the  following items as are received with the payment order:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Name and address of the beneficiary.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Account number of the beneficiary.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Any other specific identifier of the beneficiary.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Additional Record keeping Requirements for None stablished Customers

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: If the ori ginator is not an established customer of the bank, the originator’s bank must  collect

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and retain the information listed above .  In addition, the originator ’s bank must collect and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: retain other information, depending on whether the payment order is made in person.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Payment Orders Made in Person

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: If the payment order is made in person, the originator ’s bank must verify the identity of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: person placing the payment order before it accepts the order .  If it accepts the payment order,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the originator ’s financial institution must obtain and retain the following records:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Name and address of the person placing the order.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Type of identification reviewed.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Number of the identification document (e.g., driver ’s license).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The person’ s taxpayer identification number (TIN) ( e.g., Social Security number (SSN)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or employer identification number (EIN)) or, if none, the alien identification number or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: passport number and country of issuance, or a notation in the record of the lack thereof .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: If the originator ’s bank has knowledge that the person placing the payment order is not

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the originator, the originator ’s bank must obtain and record the originator ’s TIN (e.g.,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: SSN or EIN) or, if none, the alien identification number or passport number and country

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of issuance, or a notation of the lack thereof.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Funds Transfers Record Keeping — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  106 11/17/2014  Payment Orders Not Made in Person

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: If a payment order is not made in person, the originator ’s bank must obtain and retain the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: following records:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Name and address of the person placing the payment order.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The person’ s TIN (e.g., SSN or EIN) or, if none, the alien identification number or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: passport number and country of issuance, or a notation in the record of the lack thereof,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and a copy or record of the method of payment (e.g., check or credit card transaction) for the funds transfer .  If the  originator ’s bank has knowledge that the person placing the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: payment order is not the originator, the originator ’s bank must obtain and record the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: originator ’s TIN (e.g., SSN or EIN) or, if none, the alien identification number or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: passport number and count ry of issuance, or a notation of the lack thereof.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Retrievability

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Information retained must be retrievable by reference to the name of the originator .  When

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the originator is an established customer of the bank and has an account used for funds transfers, information retained must also be retrievable by account number ( 31 CFR

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1020.410(a)(4) .  Records must be maintained for five years.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Travel Rule Requirement

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: For funds transmittals of $3,000 or more, the transmittor ’s financial institution must include

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the following information in the transmittal order at the time that a transmittal order is sent to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: a receiving financial institution ( 1010.410(f)(1) ):

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Name of the transmittor, and, if the payment is ordered from an account, the account number of the transmittor .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Address of the transmittor.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Amount of the transmittal order.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Date of the transmittal order.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Identity of the recipient’ s financial institution.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • As many of the following items as are received with the transmittal order:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Name and address of the recipient.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Account number of the recipient.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Any other specific identifier of the recipient.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Either the name and address or the numerical identifier of the transmittor ’s financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institution.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: There are no recordkeeping requirements in the Travel Rule.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Funds Transfers Record Keeping — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  107 11/17/2014  Responsibilities of Intermediary Institutions

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Recordkeeping Requirements

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: For each payment order of $3,000 or more that a bank accepts as an intermediary bank, the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank must retain a record of the payment order.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Travel Rule Requirements

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: For funds transmittals of $3,000 or more, the intermediary financial institution must include

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the following information if received from the sender in a transmittal order at the time that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: order is sent to a receiving financial institution ( 1010.410(f)(2) :

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Name and account number of the trans mittor.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Address of the transmittor.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Amount of the transmittal order.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Date of the transmittal order.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Identity of the recipient’ s financial institution.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • As many of the following items as are received with the transmittal order:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Name and address of the recipi ent.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Account number of the recipient.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Any other specific identifier of the recipient.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Either the name and address or the numerical identifier of the transmittor ’s financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institution.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Intermediary financial institutions must pass on all of the informatio n received from a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transmittor ’s financial institution or the preceding financial institution, but they have no duty

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to obtain information not provided by the transmittor ’s financial institution or the preceding

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial institution.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Responsibilities of Be neficiary ’s Banks

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Recordkeeping Requirements

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: For each payment order of $3,000 or more that a bank accepts as a beneficiary ’s bank, the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank must retain a record of the payment order.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: If the beneficiary is not an established customer of the bank, the benefi ciary ’s institution

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: must retain the following information for each payment order of $3,000 or more.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Proceeds Delivered in Person

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: If proceeds are delivered in person to the beneficiary or its representative or agent, the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institution must verify the identity  of the person receiving the proceeds and retain a record of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the following:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Funds Transfers Record Keeping — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  108 11/17/2014  • Name and address.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The type of document reviewed.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The number of the identification document.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The person’ s TIN, or, if none, the alien identification number or passport number and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: country of issuance, or a notation in the record of the lack thereof.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • If the institution has knowledge that the person receiving the proceeds is not the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: beneficiary, the institution must obtain and retain a record of the beneficiary ’s name and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: address, as well as the beneficiary ’s identification.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Proceeds Not Delivered in Person

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: If proceeds are not delivered in person, the institution must retain a copy of the check or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: other instrument used to effect the payment, or the institution must record the information on the instrument .  The institution must also record the name and address of the person to whom

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: it was sent.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Retrievability

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Information retained must be retrievable by reference to the name of the beneficiary .  When

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the beneficiary is an established customer of the institution and has an account used for funds transfers, information retained must also be retrievable by account number ( 31 CFR

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: There are no Travel Rule requirements for beneficiary banks.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Abbreviations and Addresses

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Although the Travel Rule does not permit the use of coded names or pseudonyms, the rule does allow the use of abbreviated names, names reflecting different accounts of a corporation (e.g., XYZ Payroll Account), and trade and assumed names of a business (doing business as)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or the names of unincorporated divisions or departments of the business.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Customer Address

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The term “ address, ” as used in 1010.410(f) , is not defined.  Previously issued guidance from

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN had been interpreted as not allowing the use of mailing  addresses in a transmittal

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: order when a street address is known to the transmittor ’s financial institution .  However, in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the November 28, 2003, Federal Register  notice,115 FinCEN issued a regulatory

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: interpretation that states the Travel Rule should allow th e use of mailing addresses, including

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: post office boxes, in the transmittor address field of transmittal orders in certain circumstances.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The regulatory interpretation states that, for purposes of 1010.410(f) , the term “ address ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: means either the transmittor ’s street address or the transmittor ’s address maintained in the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial institution ’s automated CIF (such as a mailing address including a post office box)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Funds Transfers Record Keeping — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  109 11/17/2014  as long as the institution maintains the transmittor ’s address116 on file and the address

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: information is retrievable upon request by law enforcement.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 116 Consistent with 31 CFR 1021.210, an “address” for purposes of the Travel Rule is as follows: for an

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: individual, “address” is a residential or business street address, an Army Post Office Box or a Fleet Post Office

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Box, or the residential or business street address of next of kin or another contact person for persons who do not

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: have a residential or business address.  For a person other than an individual (such as a corporation, partnership,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or trust), “address” is a pr incipal place of business, local office, or other physical location.  However, while 31

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: CFR 1021.210 applies only to new customers opening accounts on or after October 1, 2003, and while the rule

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: exempt funds transfers from the definition of “account,” for  banks, the Travel Rule applies to all transmittals of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: funds of $3,000 or more, whether or not the transmittor is a customer for purposes of 31 CFR 1021.210.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Funds Transfers Rec ord Keeping — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  110 11/17/2014  Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Funds Transfers  Recordkeeping

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the bank ’s compliance with statutory and regulatory  requirements for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: funds transfers .  This section covers the regulatory requirements as set forth in the BSA .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Refer to the expanded sections of this manual for discussions and procedures regarding

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: specific money laundering risks for funds transfer activiti es.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1. Verify that the bank obtains and maintains appropriate records for compliance with 31 CFR 1020.410(a) .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 2. Verify that the bank transmits payment information as required by 31 CFR 1010.410(f)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (the “ Travel Rule” ).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 3. Verify that the bank files CTRs  when currency is received or dispersed in a funds transfer

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: that exceeds $10,000 ( 31 CFR 1010.311) .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 4. If the bank sends or receives funds transfers to or from institutions in other countries,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: especially those with strict privacy and secrecy laws, assess whet her the bank has

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: policies, procedures, and processes to determine whether amounts, the frequency of the transfer, and countries of origin or destination are consistent with the nature of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: business or occupation of the customer.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Transaction Testing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 5. On the basis of a risk assessment, prior examination reports, and a review of the bank’ s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: audit findings, select a sample of funds transfers processed as an originator ’s bank, an

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: intermediary bank, and a beneficiary ’s bank to ensure the institution collects, maintains,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or transmits the required information, depending on the institution’ s role in the transfer.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 6. On the basis of examination procedures completed, including transaction testing, form a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: conclusion about the ability of policies, procedures, and proc esses to meet regulatory

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirements associated with funds transfers.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 7. On the basis of  the previous conclusion and the risks associated with the bank’ s activity

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: in this area, proceed to expanded examination procedures, if necessary.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Foreign Correspondent Account Recordkeeping, Reporting, and Due Diligence — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  111 11/17/2014  Foreign Correspondent Account Recordkeeping , Reporting , and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Due Diligence —  Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the bank ’s compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: correspondent accounts for foreign shell banks, foreign correspondent account record

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: keeping, and due diligence programs to detect and report money laundering and suspicious activity .  Assess the bank’s compliance with the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Accountability, and Divestment Act  (CISADA) , if applicable.  Refer to the expanded sections

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of the manual for discussions and examination procedures regarding specific money

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: laundering risks associated with foreign correspondent accounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: One of the central goals of the USA PATRIOT  Act was to protect access to the U.S. financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: system by requiring certain records , reports, and due diligence programs for foreign

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: correspondent accounts .  In addition, the USA PATRIOT  Act prohibits accounts with foreign

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: shell banks .  Foreign correspondent accounts, as noted in past U.S. Senate investigative

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reports,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 117 are a gateway into the U.S. financial system .  This section of the manual covers

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the regulatory requirements established by sections 312, 313, and 319(b) of the USA

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: PATRIOT  Act and by the i mplementing regulations at 31 CFR 1010.100, 1010.610,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1010.630 and 1010.670.  Additional discussions and procedures regarding specific money laundering risks for foreign correspondent banking activities, such as bulk shipments of currency, pouch activity, U.S. dollar drafts, and payable through accounts, are included in the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: expanded sections.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Foreign Shell Bank Prohibition and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Foreign Correspondent Account Recordkeeping

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: For purposes of 31 CFR 1010.630 and 1010.670, a “ correspondent account ” is an account

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: established by a bank for a foreign bank to receive deposits from, or to make payments or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: other disbursements on behalf of the foreign bank, or to handle other financial transactions

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: related to the foreign bank .  An “ account ” means any formal banking or bus iness relationship

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: established to provide regular services, dealings, and other financial transactions .  It includes

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: a demand deposit, savings deposit, or other transaction or asset account and a credit account

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or other extension of credit ( 31 CFR 1010.605(c) .  Accounts maintained by foreign banks for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial institutions covered by the rule are not “ correspondent accounts ” subject to this

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: regulation.118

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 117 Correspondent Banking: A Gateway for Money Laundering .  Refer to Senate Hearing 107 -84.  The report

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: appears on page 273 of volume 1 of the hearing records entitled Role of U.S. Correspondent Banking in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: International Money Laundering, held on March 1, 2, and 6, 2001.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 118 71 Fed. Reg.  499.  FinCEN has issued interp retive guidance, Application of Correspondent Account Rules to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the Presentation of Negotiable Instruments Received by a Covered Financial Institution for Payment , FIN-

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 2008- G001 , January 30, 2008,  which states, “In the ordinary course of business, a covered financial institution

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: may receive negotiable instruments for payment from a foreign financial institution with which it maintains a correspondent relationship .  FinCEN do es not view the transaction -by-transaction presentation of a negotiable

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: instrument to a foreign paying institution —either directly or through a clearing facility — to be the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: establishment of a formal banking or business relationship by a covered financial institution for purposes of complying with the correspondent account rule.”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Foreign Correspondent Account Recordkeeping, Reporting, and Due Diligence — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  112 11/17/2014  Under 31 CFR 1010.630, a bank is prohibited from establishing, maintaining, administering,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or managing a  correspondent account in the United States for, or on behalf of, a foreign shell

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank.  A foreign shell bank is defined as a foreign bank without a physical presence in any country.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 119 An exception, however, permits a bank to maintain a correspondent account for a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: foreign shell bank that is a regulated affiliate.120 31 CFR 1010.630 also requires that a bank

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: take reasonable steps to ensure that any correspondent account established, maintained, administered, or managed in the United States for a foreign bank is  not being used by that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: foreign bank to provide banking services indirectly to foreign shell banks.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Certifications

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: A bank that maintains a correspondent account in the United States for a foreign bank must maintain records in the United States identifying the owners of each foreign bank.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 121 A bank

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: must also record the name and street address of a person who resides in the United States and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: who is authorized, and has agreed, to be an agent to accept service of legal process.122 Under

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1010.670, a bank must  produce these records within seven days upon receipt of a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: written request from a federal law enforcement officer.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The U.S. Treasury, working with the industry and federal banking and law enforcement

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: agencies, developed a “ certification process ” to assist banks in complying with the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: recordkeeping provisions .  This process includes certification and recertification forms .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: While banks are not required to use these forms, a bank is  “deemed to be in compliance”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: with the regulation if it obtains a completed certification form from the foreign bank and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: receives a recertification  on or  before the three -year anniversary of the execution of the initial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or previous certification.123

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 119 “Physical presence” means a place of business that:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Is maintained by a foreign bank.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Is located at a fixed address (other than solely an electronic address or a post office box) in a country in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: which the foreign financial institution is authorized to conduct banking activities, at which location the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: foreign financial institution:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Employs one or more persons on a full -time basis.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Maintains operating records related to its banking activities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Is subject to inspection by the banking authority that licensed the foreign financial institution to conduct

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banking activities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 120 A “regulated affiliate” is a shell bank that is affiliated with a depository institution, credit union, or foreign

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank that maintains a physical presence in the United States or in another jurisdiction.  The regulated affiliate

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: shell bank must also be subject to supervision by the banking authority that regulates the affiliated entity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 121 To minimize the recordkeeping  burdens, ownership information is not required for foreign financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institutions that file a form FR Y -7 (Annual Report of Foreign Banking Organizations ) with the Federal Reserve

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or for those foreign financial institutions that are publicly traded.  “Pub licly traded” refers to shares that are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: traded on an exchange or an organized over -the-counter market that is regulated by a foreign securities authority

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: as defined in section 3(a)(50) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 122 “Service of legal process” me ans that the agent is willing to accept legal documents, such as subpoenas, on

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: behalf of the foreign bank.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 123 Refer to Frequently Asked Questions, Foreign Bank Recertifications under 31 CFR 103.177 , FIN-2006-

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: G003, February 3, 2006.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Foreign Correspondent Account Recordkeeping, Reporting, and Due Diligence — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  113 11/17/2014  Account Closure

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The regulation also c ontains specific provisions as to when banks must obtain the required

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: information or close correspondent accounts .  Banks must obtain certifications (or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: recertifications) or otherwise obtain the required information within 30 calendar days after

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the date an account is established and at least once every three years thereafter .  If the bank is

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: unable to obtain the required information, it must close all correspondent accounts with the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: foreign bank within a commercially reasonable time.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Verification

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: A bank should review certifications for reasonableness and accuracy .  If a bank at any time

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: knows, suspects, or has reason to suspect that any information contained in a certification (or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: recertification), or that any other information it relied on is no longer cor rect, the bank must

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: request that the foreign bank verify or correct such information, or the bank must take other appropriate measures to ascertain its accuracy .  Therefore, banks should review certifications

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: for potential problems that may warrant further  review, such as use of post office boxes or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: forwarding addresses .  If the bank has not obtained the necessary or corrected information

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: within 90 days, it must close the account within a commercially reasonable time .  During this

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: time, the bank may not per mit the foreign bank to establish any new financial positions or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: execute any transactions through the account, other than those transactions necessary to close the account.  Also, a bank may not establish any other correspondent account for the foreign

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank until it obtains the required information.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: A bank must also retain the original of any document provided by a foreign bank, and retain the original or a copy of any document otherwise relied on for the purposes of the regulation, for at least five years after the date that the bank no longer maintains any correspondent

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: account for the foreign bank .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Subpoenas

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Under section 319(b) of the USA PATRIOT  Act, the Secretary of the Treasury or the U.S.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Attorney General may issue a subpoena or summons to any foreign bank that maintains a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: correspondent account in the United States to obtain records relating to that account, including records maintained abroad, or to obtain records relating to the deposit of funds into the foreign bank.  If the foreign bank fails to co mply with the subpoena or fails to initiate

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: proceedings to contest that subpoena, the Secretary of the Treasury or the U.S. Attorney General (after consultations with each other) may, by written notice, direct a bank to terminate its relationship with a fo reign correspondent bank.  If a bank fails to terminate the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: correspondent relationship within ten days of receipt of notice, it could be subject to a civil

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: money penalty of up to $10,000 per day until the correspondent relationship is terminated.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Requests for AML Records by Federal Regulator

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Also, upon request by its federal regulator, a bank must provide or make available records

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: related to AML compliance of the bank or one of its customers, within 120 hours from the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: time of the request  (31 USC 5318(k)(2) ).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Foreign Correspondent Account Recordkeeping, Reporting, and Due Diligence — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  114 11/17/2014  Special Due Diligence Program for Foreign Correspondent Accounts

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Section 312 of the USA PATRIOT  Act add ed subsection (i) to 31 USC 5318 of the  BSA .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: This subsection requires each U.S. financial institution that establishes, maintains,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: administers,  or man ages a correspondent account in the United States  for a foreign financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institution  to take  certain AML  measures  for such accounts .  In addition, section 312 of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: USA PATRIOT  Act specifies additional standards for correspondent accounts  maintained for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: certain foreign banks .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: General Due Diligence

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1010.610(a)  requires banks  to establish  a due diligence program that includes

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: appropriate, specific, risk -based, and, where necessary, enhanced policies, procedures, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: controls that are reasonably desig ned to enable the bank to detect and report, on an ongoing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: basis, any known or suspected money laundering activity conducted through or involving any correspondent account established, maintained, administered, or managed by the bank in the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: United States f or a foreign  financial institution

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 124 (foreign correspondent account ).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Due diligence policies, procedures, and controls must include  each of the following :

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Determining whether each such foreign correspondent account is subject to EDD ( refer to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: “Enhanced Due Diligence ” below).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Assessing the money laundering risks presented by each such foreign correspondent

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: account.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Applying risk- based procedures and controls to each such foreign correspondent account

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reasonably designed to detect and report known or suspected money laundering activity,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: including a periodic review of the correspondent account activity sufficient to determine consistency with information obtained about the type, purpose, and anticipated activity of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the account.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Risk assessment of foreign financi al institutions .  A bank’ s general due diligence program

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: must include policies, procedures, and processes to assess the risks posed by the bank’ s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: foreign financial institution customers .  A bank’ s resources are most appropriately directed at

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: those accounts  that pose a more significant money laundering risk.  The bank’ s due diligence

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: program should provide for the risk assessment of foreign correspondent accounts

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: considering all relevant factors, including, as appropriate:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The nature of the foreign financial  institution ’s business and the markets it serves.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The type, purpose, and anticipated activity of the foreign correspondent account.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 124 The term “foreign financial institution” as defined in 31 CFR 1010.605(f) generally includes:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A foreign bank.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A foreign branch or office of a U.S. bank, broker/dealer in securities, futures commission merchant,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: introducing broker, or mutual fund.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Any other person organized under foreign law that, if located in the United States, would be a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: broker/dealer in securities, futures commission merchant, introducing broker, or mutual fund.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Any person  organized under foreign law that is engaged in the business of, and is readily identifiable as,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: a currency dealer or exchanger or a money transmitter.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Foreign Correspondent Account Recordkeeping, Reporting, and Due Diligence — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  115 11/17/2014  • The nature and duration of the bank’ s relationship with the foreign financial institution

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (and, if relevant, with any affil iate of the foreign financial institution).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The AML and supervisory regime of the jurisdiction that issued the charter or license to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the foreign financial institution and, to the extent that information regarding such jurisdiction is reasonably available, of the jurisdiction in which any company that is an

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: owner of the foreign financial institution is incorporated or chartered.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Information known or reasonably available to the bank about the foreign financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institution ’s AML record, including public inform ation in standard industry guides,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: periodicals, and major publications.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Banks are not required to evaluate all of the above factors for every correspondent account.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Monitoring of foreign correspondent  accounts .  As part of ongoing due diligence, banks

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should periodically review their foreign correspondent accounts .  Monitoring does  not, in the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: ordinary situation, involve scrutiny of every transaction taking place within the account, but,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: instead,  should involve  a review of the account sufficient to ensure t hat the bank can

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: determine whether the nature and volume of account activity is generally consistent with information regarding the purpose of the account and expected account activity and to ensure

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: that the bank can adequately identify suspicious transact ions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: An effective due diligence program provide s for a range of due diligence measures, based

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: upon the bank’ s risk assessment of each foreign correspondent account .  The starting point

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: for an effective due diligence program, therefore, should be a stratif ication of the money

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: laundering risk of each foreign correspondent account based on the bank’ s review of relevant

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: risk factors (such as those identified above) to determine which accounts may require

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: increased measures .  The due diligence program should identify risk factors that would

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: warrant the institution conducting additional scrutiny or increased monitoring of a particular account .  As due diligence is an ongoing process, a bank should take measures to ensure

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: account profiles are current and monitor ing should be risk- based .  Banks should consider

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: whether risk profiles should be adjusted or suspicious activity reported when the activity is

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: inconsistent with the profile.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Enhanced Due Diligence

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1010.610(b)  requires banks  to establish  risk-based E DD policies , procedures , and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: controls  when establishing,  maintaining , administering, or managing  a correspondent account

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: in the United States  for certain foreign  banks  (as identified in 31 CFR 1010.610(c)  operating

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: under  any one or more of the following :

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • An offshore banking license.125

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A banking license issued by a foreign country that has been designated as non cooperative

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: with international AML principles or procedures by an intergovernmental group or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 125 The USA PATRIOT Act (31 USC 5318(i)(4)(A) and 31 CFR 1010.605(i) define an offshore banking license

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: as a license to conduct banking activities that, as a condition of the license, prohibits the licensed entity from

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: conducting banking activities with the citizens, or in the local currency of, the jurisdiction that issued the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: license.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Foreign Correspondent Account Recordkeeping, Reporting, and Due Diligence — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  116 11/17/2014  organization of which the United States is a member, and with which designation the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: United States representative to the group or organization concurs.126

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A banking l icense issued by a foreign country that has been designated by the Secretary

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of the Treasury as warranting special measures due to money laundering concerns.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: If such an account is established or maintained, 31 CFR 1010.610(b)  require s the bank to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: establish  EDD policies, procedures, and controls to ensure that the bank, at a minimum,  takes

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reasonable steps to:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Determine , for any such foreign bank whose shares are not publicly traded, the identity of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: each of the owners of the foreign bank, and the nature and extent of the ownership interest of each such owner.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Conduct enhanced scrutiny of such account  to guard against money laundering and to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: identify and report any suspicious transactions in accordance with applicable laws and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: regulations .  This enhanced scrutiny is to reflect the risk assessment of the account and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: shall include, as appropriate:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Obtaining and considering information relating to the foreign bank’s anti -money

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: laundering program to assess the risk of money laundering presented by the foreign bank’s correspondent account.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Monitoring transactions to, from, or through the correspondent account in a manner reasonably designed to detect money laundering and suspicious activity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Obtaining information from the foreign bank about the identity of any person with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: authority to direct transactions through any correspondent account that is a payable through account, and the sources and the beneficial owner of funds or other assets in
