name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: involve the proceeds of foreign corruption137 for which a senior foreign political figure138

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: is a nominal or beneficial owner ( 31 CFR 1010.620(c)(1) ).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Transaction Testing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 5. On the basis of  a risk assessment, prior examination reports, and a review of the bank’ s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: audit findings, select a sample of customer files to determine whether the bank has

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: ascertained the identity of the nominal and beneficial owners of, and the source of funds deposi ted into, private banking accounts for non -U.S. persons .  From the sample selected

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: determine the following:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Whether the bank’ s procedures comply with internal policies and statutory

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirements.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Whether the bank has followed its procedures governing risk assessment of private banking accounts for non -U.S. persons.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Whether the bank performs enhanced scrutiny of private banking accounts for which

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: senior foreign political figures are nominal or beneficial owners , consistent with its

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: policy , regulatory guidanc e, and statutory requirements.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 137 The term “proceeds of foreign corruption” means any assets or property that is acquired by, through, or on

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: behalf of a senior foreign political figure through misappropriation,  theft, or embezzlement of public funds, the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: unlawful conversion of property of a foreign government, or through acts of bribery or extortion, and shall

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: include any other property into which any such assets have been transformed or converted (31  CFR

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 138 The final rule defines a senior foreign political figure as: a current or former senior official in the executive,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: legislative, administrative, military, or judicial branches of a foreign government, whether or not they are or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: were elected of ficials; a senior official of a major foreign political party; and a senior executive of a foreign

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: government -owned commercial enterprise.  The definition also includes a corporation, business, or other entity

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: formed by or for the benefit of such an indivi dual.  Senior executives are individuals with substantial authority

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: over policy, operations, or the use of government -owned resources.  Also included in the definition of a senior

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: foreign political official are immediate family members of such individuals and persons who are widely and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: publicly known (or actually known) close associates of a senior foreign political figure.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Private Banking Due Diligence Program (Non -U.S. Persons) — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  132 11/17/2014  6. On the basis of examination procedures completed, including transaction testing, form a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: conclusion about the ability of policies, procedures, and processes to meet regulatory

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirements associated with private banking due diligence programs.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 7. On the basis of  the previous conclusion and the risks associated with the bank’ s activity

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: in this area, proceed to expanded examination procedures, if necessary.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Special Measures — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  133 11/17/2014  Special Measures — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the bank ’s compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: special measures issued under section 311 of the USA PATRIOT  Act.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Section 311 of the USA PATRIOT  Act added 31 USC 5318A to the BSA, which authorizes

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the Secretary of the Treasury to require domestic financial institutions and domestic financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: agencies to take certain special measures against foreign jurisdictions, foreign financial institutions, classes of international transactions, or types of accounts of primary money laundering concern.  Section 311 provides the Secretary of the Treasury with a range of options that can be adapted to target specific money laundering and terrorist financing concerns .  Section 311 is implemented through various orders and regulations that are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: incorporated into 31 CFR Chapter X .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 139 As set forth in section 311, certain special measures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: may be imposed by an order without prior public notice and comment, but such orders must

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: be of limited duration and must be issued together with a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Section 311 establishes a process for the Secretary of the Treasury to follow, and identifies

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: federal agencies to consult before the Secretary of the Treasury may  conclude that a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: jurisdiction, financial institution, class of transactions, or type of account is of primary money laundering concern .  The statute also provides similar procedures, including factors

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and consultation requirements, for selecting the specif ic special measures to be imposed

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: against a jurisdiction, financial institution, class of transactions, or type of account that is of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: primary money laundering concern.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: It is important to note that, while a jurisdiction, financial institution, class of tran sactions, or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: type of account may be designated of primary money laundering concern in an order issued

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: together with a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking, special measures of unlimited duration can

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: only be imposed by a final rule issued after notice and an oppor tunity for comment.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Types of Special Measures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The following five special measures can be imposed, either individually, jointly, or in any combination:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Recordkeeping and Reporting of Certain Financial Transactions

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Under the first special measure, banks may  be required to maintain records or to file reports ,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or both, concerning the aggregate amount of transactions or the specifics of each transaction

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: with respect to a jurisdiction, financial institution, class of transactions, or type of account that is of p rimary money laundering concern.  The statute contains minimum information

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirements for these records and reports and permits the Secretary of the Treasury to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: impose additional information requirements.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 139 Notices of proposed rulemaking and final rules accompanying the determination “of primary money

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: laundering concern,” and imposition o f a special measure(s) pursuant to section 311 of the USA PATRIOT Act

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: are on the FinCEN Web site .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Special Measures — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  134 11/17/2014  Information Relating to Beneficial Ownership

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Unde r the second special measure, banks may be required to take reasonable and practicable

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: steps, as determined by the Secretary of the Treasury, to obtain and retain information

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: concerning the beneficial ownership of any account opened or maintained in the United States by a foreign person (other than a foreign entity whose shares are subject to public reporting requirements or are listed and traded on a regulated exchange or trading market), or a representative of such foreign person, that involves a jurisdic tion, financial institution, class

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of transactions, or type of account that is of primary money laundering concern.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Information Relating to Certain Payable Through Accounts

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Under the third special measure, banks that open or maintain a payable through account  in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the United States  involving a jurisdiction, financial institution, class of transactions, or type

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of account that is of primary money laundering concern may be required (i) to identify each customer (and representative) who is permitted to use the a ccount or whose transactions are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: routed through the account and (ii) to obtain information about each customer (and representative) that is substantially comparable to that which the bank obtains in the ordinary

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: course of business with respect to its customers residing in the United States.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Information Relating to Certain Correspondent Accounts

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Under the fourth special measure, banks that open or maintain a correspondent account in the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: United States involving a jurisdiction, financial institution, class of  transactions, or type of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: account that is of primary money laundering concern may be required to: (i) identify each customer (and representative) who is permitted to use the account or whose transactions are routed through the account; and (ii) obtain information about each such customer (and representative) that is substantially comparable to that which a United States depository institution obtains in the ordinary course of business with respect to its customers residing in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the United States.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Prohibition s or Conditions on Opening or Maintaining Certain Correspondent

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or Payable Through Accounts

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Under the fifth, and strongest, special measure, banks may be prohibited from opening or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: maintaining in the United States any correspondent account or payable through account for, or on behalf of, a foreign financial institution if the account involves a jurisdiction, financial institution, class of transactions, or type of account that is of primary money laundering concern .  The imposition of this measure can prohi bit U.S. banks from establishing,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: maintaining, administering , or managing in the United States a correspondent or payable

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: through account for, or on behalf of, any financial institution from a specific foreign

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: jurisdiction .  This measure may also be applied to specific foreign financial institutions and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: their subsidiaries.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 140 Refer to expanded overview section, “Payable Through Accounts,” page 194, for additional guidance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 141 Refer to core ov erview section, “Foreign Correspondent Account Recordkeeping , Reporting  and Due

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Diligence,” pages 111, and expanded overview section, “Correspondent Accounts (Foreign),” page 177, for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: additional guidance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Special Measures — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  135 11/17/2014  The regulations that implement these prohibitions may require banks to review their account

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: records to determine whether they maintain no accounts directly for, or on behalf of, such

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: entities .  In addition to the direct prohibition, banks may also be:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Prohibited from knowingly providing indirect access to the specific entities through its

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: other banking relationships.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Required to notify correspondent accountholders that they must not pr ovide the specific

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: entity with access to the account maintained at the U.S. bank.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Required to take reasonable steps to identify any indirect use of its accounts by the specific entity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Special Measures Guidance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Orders and regulations implementing specific special measures taken under section 311 of the USA PATRIOT  Act are not static; they can be issued or rescinded over time as the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Secretary of the Treasury determines that a subject jurisdiction, institution, class of transactions, or type of account is no longer of primary money laundering concern.  In

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: addition, special measures imposed against one jurisdiction, institution, class of transactions, or type of account may vary from those imposed in other situations .  Examiners should also

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: note that an order or rule imposing a special measure may establish a standard of due

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: diligence that banks must apply to comply with the particular special measure.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Accordingly, this manual does not detail specific final special measures, because any such

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: listing could quickl y become dated .  Examiners reviewing compliance with this section

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should visit the FinCEN Web site

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: for current information on final special measures .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Examiners should only examine for those special measures that are f inal, and should not

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: review banks for special measures  that are proposed.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Special Measures — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  136 11/17/2014  Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Special Measures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the bank ’s compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: special measures issued under section 311 of the USA PATRIOT  Act.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1. Determine the extent of the bank ’s international banking activities and the foreign

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: jurisdictions in which the bank conducts tr ansactions and activities, with particular

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: emphasis on foreign correspondent banking and payable through accounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 2. As applicable, determine whether the bank has established policies, procedures, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: processes to respond to specific special measures impo sed by FinCEN that are applicable

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to its operations .  Evaluate the adequacy of the policies, procedures, and processes for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: detecting accounts or transactions with jurisdictions, financial institutions, or transactions

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: subject to final special measures.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 3. Determine, through discussions with management and review of the bank ’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: documentation, whether the bank has taken action in response to final special measures.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Transaction Testing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 4. Determine all final special measures issued by FinCEN under section 311 t hat are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: applicable to the bank ( refer to the FinCEN Web site ).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 5. For any of the first four types of special measures, determine whether the bank obtained, recorded, or reported the information required by each particular special measure.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 6. For the fifth special measure (prohibition), determine whether the bank complied with the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: prohibitions or restrictions required by each particular special measure, and complied

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: with any other actions required by the special m easures.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 7. As necessary, search the bank ’s MIS and other appropriate records for accounts or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions with jurisdictions, financial institutions, or transactions subject to final special measures.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 8. On the basis of examination procedures completed, i ncluding transaction testing, form a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: conclusion about the ability of policies, procedures, and processes to meet regulatory requirements associated with special measures.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Foreign Bank and Financial Accounts Reporting — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  137 11/17/2014  Foreign Bank and Financial Accounts

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Reporting — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the bank ’s compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements for the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reporting of foreign bank and financial accounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Each person142 (including a bank) subject to U.S. jurisdiction with a financial interest i n, or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: signature or other authority over, a bank, a securities, or any other financial account in a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: foreign country must electronically file a Report of Foreign Bank and Financial Accounts

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (FBAR) through the BSA E -Filing System if the aggregate value of these financial accounts

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: exceeds $10,000 at any time during the calendar year .143 The term “financial account”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: generally includes, among other things, accounts in which assets are held in a commingled

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: fund and the account owner holds an equity interest in the f und, (e.g., a mutual fund) , as well

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: as debit card and prepaid card accounts . A bank must file an FBAR on its own accounts that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: meet this definition; additionally, the bank may be obligated to file these forms for customer

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: accounts in which the bank has a financial interest or over which it has signature or other

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: authority.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: An FBAR must be filed on or before June 30 of each calendar year for foreign financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: accoun ts where the aggregate value exceeded  $10,000 at any time during the previous

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: calendar year.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN issued a final rule that became effective March 28, 2011 regarding reports of foreign financial accounts  .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 144 Subsequently, FinCEN announced further extensions of time for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: certain FBAR filings in light of ongoing questions regarding the filing requirement and its

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: application to individuals with signature authority over but no financial interest in certain types

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of accounts. On February 14, 2012, FinCEN issued N otice 2012-1 to extend the filing date for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: certain individuals with signature authority over but no financial interest in one or more foreign

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial accounts. The FBAR filing  deadline for U.S. persons with only signature authority

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: over (but not financia l interest in) a foreign financial accou nt was extended to June 30, 2015.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 142 As defined in 31 CFR 1010.100 (mm), the term “person” means an individual, a corporation, a partnership, a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: trust or estate, a joint stock company, an association, a syndicate, joint venture or other unincorporated

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: organization or group, an Indian Tribe (a s that term is defined in the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act), and all

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: entities cognizable as legal personalities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: IRS guidance further states that the term “United States person” includes U.S. citizens; U.S. residents; entities,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: including but not limited to, corporations, partnerships, or limited liability companies, created or organized in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the United States or under the laws of the United States; and trusts or estates formed under the laws of the United States. Refer to the IRS FBAR Reference Guid e.  See also

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA Electronic Filing Requirements For

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Report of Foreign Bank and Financial Accounts (FinCEN Form 114)  Release Date June 2014 (v1.3) Effective

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: October 2013 for the 2013 or earlier filing requirement .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 144 Refer to 76 Fed. Reg. 10234  (Febr uary 24, 2011) .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Foreign Bank and Financial Accounts Reporting — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  138 11/17/2014  Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Foreign Bank and Financial Accounts Reporting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the bank ’s compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements for the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reporting of foreign bank and financial accounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1. Determine whether the bank has a financial interest in, or signature or other authority

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: over, bank, securities, or other financial accounts in a foreign country, as well as  whether

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the bank is required to file a Report of Foreign Bank and Financial Accounts (FBAR)  for customer accounts, including trust accounts, in which the bank has a financial interest or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: over which it has signature or other authority.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 2. If applicable, review the bank’ s policies, procedures, and processes for filing annual

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reports.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Transaction Testing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 3. On the basis of a risk assessment, prior examination reports, and a review of the bank’ s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: audit findings, select a sample of accounts to determine whether the bank has appropriately completed, submitted, and retained copies of the FBAR forms.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 4. On the basis of examination procedures completed, including transaction testing, form a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: conclusion about the ability of policies, procedures, and pr ocesses to meet regulatory

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirements associated with FBARs.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: International Transportation of Currency or Monetary Instruments R eporting — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  139 11/17/2014  International Transportation of Currency or Monetary

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Instruments Reporting — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the ba nk’s compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements for the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reporting of international shipments of currency or monetary instruments.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Each person145 (including a bank) who physically transports, mails, or ships currency or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: monetary instruments in exce ss of $10,000 at one time out of or into the United States (and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: each person who causes such transportation, mailing, or shipment) must file a Report of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: International Transportation of Currency or Monetary Instruments (CMIR).146 A CMIR must

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: be filed with the appropriate Bureau of Customs and Border Protection officer or with the commissioner of Customs at the time of entry into or departure from the United States .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: When a person receives currency or monetary instruments in an amount exceeding $10,000 at one ti me that have been shipped from any place outside the United States, a CMIR must be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: filed with the appropriate Bureau of Customs and Border Protection officer or with the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: commissioner of Customs within 15 days of receipt of the instruments (unless a report has

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: already been filed) .  The report is to be completed by or on behalf of the person requesting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transfer of the currency or monetary instruments .  However, banks are not required to report

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: these items on a CMIR if they are mailed or shipped through the postal  service or by

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: common carrier .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 147 In addition, a commercial bank or trust company organized under the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: laws of any state or of the United States is not required to report overland shipments of currency or monetary instruments if they are shipped to or received from an established customer maintaining a deposit relationship with the bank and if the bank reasonably concludes the amounts do not exceed what is commensurate with the customary conduct of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the business, industry, or profession of the customer c oncerned.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Regardless  of whether an exemption from filing a CMIR applies, banks are not relieved of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: other monitoring and reporting obligations under the BSA .  Banks must report the receipt or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: disbursement of currency in excess of $10,000 on a Currency Trans action Report (CTR)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: subject to the exemptions at 31 CFR 1020.315.  Banks must also monitor for and report suspicious activity .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 145 As defined in 31 CFR 1010.100 (mm), the term “person” means an individual, a corporation, a partnership, a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: trust or estate, a joint stock company, an association, a syndicate, joint venture or other unincorporated

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: organization or group, a n Indian Tribe (as that term is defined in the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act), and all

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: entities cognizable as legal personalities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 146 The obligation to file the CMIR is solely on the person who transports, mails, ships or receives, or causes or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: attempts to transport, mail, ship, or receive.  No other person is under any obligation to file a CMIR.  Thus, if a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: customer walks into the bank and declares that he or she has received or transported currency in an aggregate

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: amount exceeding $10,000 from a place outsi de the United States and wishes to deposit the currency into his or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: her account, the bank is under no obligation to file a CMIR on the customer’s behalf (see FIN-1998- R002

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: formerly known as Treasury Administrative Ruling 88 -2).  Also refer to CMIR guidance for common carriers of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: currency, including armored car services , FIN-2014- G002, August 1, 2014.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 147 In contrast, a bank is required to file a CMIR to report shipments of currency or monetary instruments to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: foreign offices when those shipments are performed directly by bank personnel, such as currency shipments

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: handled by bank employees using bank -owned vehicles.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: International Transportation of Currency or Monetary Instruments R eporting — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  140 11/17/2014  Management should implement applicable policies, procedures, and processes for CMIR

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: filing .  Management should review the interna tional transportation of currency and monetary

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: instruments and determine whether a customer ’s activity is usual and customary for the type

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of business .  If not, a SAR  should be considered.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: International Transportation of Currency or Monetary Instruments Reporting — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  141 11/17/2014  Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: International Transportation of Currency or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Monetary Instruments Reporting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the bank ’s compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements for the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reporting of international shipments of currency or monetary instruments.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1. Determine whether the bank has (or has caused to be) physically transported, mailed, or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: shipped currency or other monetary instruments in excess of $10,000, at one time, out of the United States, or whether  the bank has received currency or other monetary

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: instruments in excess of $10,000, at one time, that has been physically transported ,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: mailed, or shipped into the United States.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 2. If applicable, review the bank’ s policies, procedures, and processes for filing a Report of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: International Transportation of Currency or Monetary Instruments (CMIR)  for each

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: shipment of currency or other monetary instruments in excess of $10,000 out of or into

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the United States (except for shipments sent through the postal service, common carrier,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or to which another exception from CMIR reporting applies).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Transaction Testing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 3. On the basis of a risk assessment, prior examination reports, and a review of the bank’ s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: audit findings, select a sample of transactions conducted after  the previous examination

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to determine whether the bank has appropriately completed, submitted, and retained

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: copies of the CMIR s .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 4. On the basis of examination procedures completed, including transaction testing, form a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: conclusion about the ability of policies, procedures, and processes to meet regulatory

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirements associated with CMIRs.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 5. On the basis of  the previous conclusion and the risks associated with the bank’ s activity

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: in this area, proceed to expanded examination procedures, if necessary.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Office of Foreign Assets Control — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  142 11/17/2014  Office of Foreign Assets Control —  Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the bank ’s risk -based Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance program to evaluate whether it is appropriate for the bank ’s OFAC risk, taking

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: into consideration its products, services, customers, entities, transactions, and geographic

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: locations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC is an office of the U.S. Treasury that administers and enforces economic and tr ade

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: sanctions based on U.S. foreign policy and national security goals against targeted

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: individuals and entities such as foreign countries, regimes, terrorists, international narcotics

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: traffickers, and those engaged in certain activities such as  the proli feration of weapons of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: mass destruction  or transnational organized crime .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC acts under Presidential wartime and national emergency powers, as well as various authorit ies granted by specific legislation, to impose controls on transactions and to freeze

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: assets under U.S. jurisdiction.  OFAC has been delegated responsibility by the Secretary of the Treasury for developing, promulgating, and administering U.S. sanctions progr ams.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Many of the se sanctions are based on United Nations and other international mandates ;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: therefore, they are multilateral in scope, and involve close cooperation with allied governments .  Other sanctions are specific to the national security interests of the United

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: States .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: On November 9, 2009, OFAC issued a final rule entitled “Economic Sanctions Enforcement Guidelines ” in order to provide guidance to persons subject to its regulations .  The document

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: explains the procedures that OFAC follows in determ ining the appropriate enforcement

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: response to apparent violations of its regulations .  Some enforcement responses may result in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the issuance of a civil penalty that, depending on the sanctions program affected, may be as much as $250,000 per violation or t wice the amount of a transaction, whichever is greater .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The Guidelines outline the various factors that OFAC takes into account when making enforcement determinations, including  the adequacy of a compliance program in place within

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: an institution to ensure  compliance with OFAC regulations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: All U.S. persons,150 including U.S. banks, bank holding companies, and nonbank

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: subsidiaries, must comply with OFAC ’s regulations.151 The federal banking agencies

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 148 Trading With the Enemy Act (TWEA), 50 USC App 1 -44; International Emergency Economic Powers Act

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (IEEPA), 50 USC 1701 et seq. ; Antiterrorism and Effective Death Penalty Act (AEDPA), 8 USC 1189, 18 USC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 2339B; United Nations Participation Ac t (UNPA), 22 USC 287c; Cuban Democracy Act (CDA), 22 USC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 6001 –10; The Cuban Liberty and Democratic Solidarity Act (Libertad Act), 22 USC 6021 –91; The Clean

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Diamonds Trade Act, Pub. L. No. 108- 19; Foreign Narcotics Kingpin Designation Act (Kingpin Act), 21 USC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1901 –1908, 8 USC 1182; Burmese Freedom and Democracy Act of 2003, Pub. L. No. 108– 61, 117 Stat. 864

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (2003); The Foreign Operations, Export Financing and Related Programs Appropriations Act, Sec 570 of Pub.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: L. No. 104- 208, 110 Stat. 3009- 116 (1997); The  Iraqi Sanctions Act, Pub. L. No. 101- 513, 104 Stat. 2047- 55

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (1990); The International Security and Development Cooperation Act, 22 USC 2349 aa8 –9; The Trade

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sanctions Reform and Export Enhancement Act of 2000, Title IX, Pub. L. No. 106- 387 (October 28, 2000).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 149 Refer to 73 Fed. Reg.  57593 (November 9, 2009) for additional information ( also available on the OFAC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Web site ).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 150 All U.S. persons must comply with OFAC regulations, including all U.S. citizens and permanent resident

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: aliens regardless of where they are located, all persons and entities within the United States, all U.S.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Office of Foreign Assets Control — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  143 11/17/2014  evaluate OFAC compliance programs  to ensure that all banks subject to their supervision

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: comply with the sanctions.152 Unlike the BSA, the laws and OFAC -issued regulations apply

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: not only to U.S. banks, their domestic branches, agencies, and international banking

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: facilities, but also to their  foreign branches, and often overseas offices and subsidiaries .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC encourages banks to take a risk- based approach to designing and implementing an

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC compliance program.  In general, the regulations that OFAC administers require

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banks to do the follow ing:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Block accounts and other property of specified countries, entities, and individuals.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Prohibit or reject unlicensed trade and financial transactions with specified countries, entities, and individuals.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Blocked Transactions

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: U.S. law requires that assets  and accounts of an OFAC -specified country, entity, or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: individual be blocked when such property is located in the United States, is held by U.S. individuals or entities, or comes into the possession or control of U.S. individuals or entities .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: For example,  if a funds transfer comes from offshore and is being routed through a U.S. bank

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to an offshore bank, and there is an OFAC -designated party to  the transaction, it must be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: blocked.  The definition of assets and property is broad and is specifically defined within each sanction program .  Assets and property includes anything of direct, indirect, present,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: future, or contingent value (including all types of bank transactions) .  Banks must block

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions that:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Are by or on behalf of a blocked individual or entity ;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Are to or go through a blocked entity ; or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Are in connection with a transaction in which a blocked individual or entity has an

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: interest.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: For example, if a U.S. bank receives instructions to make a funds transfer payment that falls into one of these categories, it must execute the payment order and place the funds into a blocked account.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 153 A payment order cannot be canceled or amended after it is received by a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: U.S. bank in the absence of an authorization from OFAC.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: incorporated entities and their foreign branc hes.  In the case of certain programs, such as those regarding Cuba

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and North Korea, foreign subsidiaries owned or controlled by U.S. companies also must comply.  Certain

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: programs also require foreign persons in possession of U.S. origin goods to comply.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 151 Additional information is provided in Foreign Assets Control Regulations for the Financial Community ,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: which is available on  the OFAC Web site .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 152 31 CFR Chapter V.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 153 A blocked account is a s egregated interest -bearing account (at a commercially reasonable rate), which holds

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the customer’s property until the target is delisted, the sanctions program is rescinded, or the customer obtains an OFAC license authorizing the release of the property.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Office of Foreign Assets Control — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  144 11/17/2014  Prohibited Transactions

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In some cases , an underlying transaction may be prohibited, but there is no blockable interest

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: in the transaction (i.e., the transaction should not be accepted, but there is no OFAC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirement to block the assets) .  In these cases, the transaction is simply rejected, ( i.e., not

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: processed ).  For example, the Sudanese Sanctions Regulations prohibit transactions in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: support of commercial activities in Sudan.  Therefore, a U.S. bank would have to reject a funds transfer between two companies, which are not Specially Designated Nationals or Blocked Persons (SDN), involving an export to a company in Sudan that also is not an SDN .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Because the Sudanese Sanctions Regulations would only require blocking transactions with the Government of Sudan or an SDN, there would be no blockable interest in the funds between the two companies .  However, because the transactions would constitute the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: exportation of services to  Sudan, which is prohibited, the U.S. bank cannot  process the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transaction and would simply reject the transaction.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: It is important to note that the OFAC regime specifying prohibitions against certain

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: countries, entities, and individuals is separate and distinct from the provision within the BSA ’s CIP  regulation ( 31 CFR 1020.220(a)(4))  that requires banks to compare ne w accounts

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: against government lists of known or suspected terrorists or terrorist organizations within a reasonable period of time after the account is opened.  OFAC lists have not been designated government lists for purposes of the CIP rule .  Refer to th e core overview section , “Customer

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Identification Program, ” page  47, for further guidance .  However, OFAC ’s requirements

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: stem from other statutes not limited to terrorism, and OFAC sanctions apply to transactions,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: in addition to account relationships.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC Licenses

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC has the authority, through a licensing process, to permit certain transactions that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: would otherwise be prohibited under its regulations .  OFAC can issue a license to engage in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: an otherwise prohibited transaction when it determines that the transaction does not undermine the U.S. policy objectives of the particular sanctions program, or is otherwise justified by U.S. national security or foreign policy objectives .  OFAC can also promulgate

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: general licenses, which authorize categories of transactions, such as allowing reasonable service charges on blocked accounts, without the need for case -by-case authorization from

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC .  These licenses can be found in the regulations for each sanctions program (31 CFR,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Chapter V (Regulations)) and may be acce ssed from the OFAC W eb site.  Before processing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions that may be covered under a general license, banks should verify that such

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions meet the relevant criteria of the general license.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Specific licenses are issued on a case- by-case basis .155 A specific license is a written

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: document issued by OFAC authorizing a particular transaction or set of transactions

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: generally limited to a specified time period .  To receive a specific license, the person or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 154 License  information for a particular sanction program is available on  the OFAC Web site  or by contacting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC’s Licensing area at ( 202) 622-2480.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 155 Application s for a specific license may be submitted either online from  the OFAC Web site , or in writing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to: Licensing Division, Office of Foreign Assets Control, 1500 Pennsylvan ia Avenue, NW, Washington, DC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Office of Foreign Assets Control — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  145 11/17/2014  entity who would like to undertake the transacti on must submit an application to OFAC .  If

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the transaction conforms to OFAC’s internal licensing policies and U.S. foreign policy

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: objectives , the license generally is  issued .  If a bank ’s customer claims to have a specific

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: license, the bank should verify that the transaction conforms to the terms and conditions of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the license (including the effective dates of the license), and may wish to obtain and retain a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: copy of the authorizing licens e for recordkeeping purposes .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC Reporting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Banks must report all blockings to OFAC within 10 business days of the occurrence and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: annually by September 30 concerning those assets blocked (as of June 30).156 Once assets or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: funds are blocked, they should be placed in a separate blocked account .  Prohibited

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions that are rejected must also be reported to OFAC within  10 business days of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: occurrence.157

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Banks must keep a full and accurate record of each rejected transaction for at least five years after the date of the transaction .  For blocked property  (including blocked transactions) ,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: records must be maintained for the period the property is blocked and for five years after the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: date the property is unblocked.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Additional information concerning OFAC regul ations, such as Sanctions Program and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Country Summaries brochures; the SDN and other lists , including both entities and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: individuals; recent OFAC actions; and “ Frequently Asked Questions,”  can be found on the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC W eb site.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC Compliance Program

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: While not required by specific regulation, but as a matter of sound banking practice and in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: order to mitigate the risk of noncompliance with OFAC requirements , banks should establish

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and maintain an effective, written OFAC compliance program that is commen surate with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: their OFAC risk profile (based on products, services, customers, and geographic locations) .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The program should identify higher -risk areas, provide for appropriate internal controls for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: screening and reporting, establish independent testing for  compliance, designate a bank

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: employee or employees as responsible for OFAC compliance, and create training programs

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: for appropriate personnel in all relevant areas of the bank .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC Risk Assessment

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: A fundamental element of a sound OFAC compliance program is the bank’ s assessment of its

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: specific product lines, customer base, and nature of transactions and identification of high er-

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: risk areas for potential OFAC sanctions risk.  The initial identification of high er-risk

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: customers for purposes of OFAC m ay be performed as part of the bank ’s CIP and CDD

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: procedures .  As OFAC sanctions can reach into virtually all areas of its operations, banks

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should consider all types of transactions, products, and services when conducting their risk

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 156 The annual report is to be filed on form TD F 90- 22.50.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 157 Reporting, procedures, and penalties regulations, 31 CFR Part 501.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 158 This information is available on  the OFAC Web site , or by contacting OFAC’s hot  line at ( 202) 622-2490 or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: toll-free at ( 800) 540-6322.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Office of Foreign Assets Control — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  146 11/17/2014  assessment and establi shing appropriate policies, procedures, and processes .  An effective

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: risk assessment should be a composite of multiple factors (as described in more detail

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: below), and depending upon the circumstances, certain factors may be weighed more heavily

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: than other s.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Another consideration for the risk assessment is account and transaction parties .  New

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: accounts should be compared with OFAC lists prior to being opened or shortly thereafter .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: However, the extent to which the bank includes account parties other than ac countholders

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (e.g., beneficiaries, guarantors, principals, beneficial owners, nominee shareholders,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: directors, signatories, and powers of attorney) in the initial OFAC review during the account opening process, and during subsequent database reviews of exi sting accounts, depends  on

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the bank’ s risk profile and available technology.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Based on the bank’ s OFAC risk profile for each area and available technology, the bank

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should establish policies, procedures, and processes for reviewing transactions and transact ion parties (e.g., issuing bank, payee, endorser, or jurisdiction) .  Currently, OFAC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: provides guidance on transactions parties on checks .  The guidance states if a bank knows or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: has reason to know that a transaction party on a check is an OFAC target, the bank’ s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: processing of the transaction would expose the bank to liability, especially personally handled transactions in a higher -risk area.  For example, if a bank knows or has a reason to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: know that a check transaction involves an OFAC -prohibited party or c ountry, OFAC would

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: expect timely identification and appropriate action.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In evaluating the level of risk, a bank should exercise judgment and take into account all indicators of risk.  Although not an exhaustive list, examples of products, services,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: custome rs, and geographic locations that may carry a higher level of OFAC risk include:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • International funds transfers.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Nonresident alien accounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Foreign customer accounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Cross -border ACH  transactions .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Commercial letters of credit and other trade finance products .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Transactional electronic banking.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Foreign correspondent bank accounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Payable through accounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Concentration accounts .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • International private banking.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Overseas branches or subsidiaries.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix M ( “Quantity of Risk — OFAC Procedures ”) provides guidance to examiners on

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: assessing OFAC risks facing a bank .  The risk assessment can be used to assist the examiner

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Office of Foreign Assets Control — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  147 11/17/2014  in determining the scope of the OFAC examination.  Additional information on compliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: risk is poste d by OFAC on its W eb site under “ Frequ ently Asked  Questions .”159

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Once the bank has identified its areas with higher  OFAC risk, it should develop appropriate

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: policies, procedures, and processes to address the associated risks .  Banks may tailor these

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
