content: policies, procedures, and processes to the sp ecific nature of a business line or product .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Furthermore, banks are encouraged to periodically reassess their OFAC risks.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Internal Controls

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: An effective OFAC compliance program should include internal controls for identifying

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: suspect accounts and transact ions, as well as reporting blocked and rejected transactions to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC .  Internal controls should include the following elements:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Identify ing and review ing suspect transactions .  The bank’ s policies, procedures, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: processes should address how the bank identif ies and review s transactions and accounts for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: possible OFAC violations, whether conducted manually, through interdiction software, or a combination of both.  For screening purposes, the bank should clearly define its criteria for comparing names pro vided on the OFAC list with the names in the bank’ s files or on

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions and for identifying transactions or accounts involving sanctioned countries .  The

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank’ s policies, procedures, and processes should also address how the bank  determine s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: whether an  initial OFAC hit is a valid match or a false hit.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 160 A high volume of false hits may

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: indicate a need to review the bank’ s interdiction program.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The screening criteria used by banks to identify name variations and misspellings should be based on the level of  OFAC risk associated with the particular product or type of transaction.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: For example, in a higher -risk area with a high -volume of transactions, the bank’ s interdiction

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: software should be able to identify  close name derivations for review .  The SDN list attempts

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to provide name derivations; however, the l ist may not include all derivations .  More

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: sophisticated interdiction software may be able to catch variations of an SDN ’s name not

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: included on the SDN list .  Banks with lower OFAC risk and those with low  volumes of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions may decide to manually filter for OFAC compliance .  Decisions to use

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: interdiction software and the degree of sensitivity of that software should be based on a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank’ s assessment of its risk and the volume of its transactions .  In de termining the frequency

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of OFAC checks and the filtering criteria used (e.g., name derivations), banks should consider the likelihood of incurring a violation and available technology .  In addition, banks

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should periodically reassess their OFAC filtering s ystem .  For example, if a bank identifies a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: name derivation of an OFAC target, then OFAC suggests that the bank add the name to its

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: filtering process.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: New accounts should be compared with the OFAC lists prior to being opened or shortly

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: thereafter (e.g., du ring nightly processing) .  Banks that perform OFAC checks after account

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: opening should have procedures in place to prevent transactions, other than initial deposits, from occurring until the OFAC check is completed .  Prohibited transactions conducted prior

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 159 This guidance is available on  the OFAC Web site .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 160 Due diligence steps for  determining a valid match are provided in Using OFAC’s Hot  line on the OFAC Web

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: site.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Office of Foreign Assets Control — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  148 11/17/2014  to completing an OFAC check may be subject to possible enforcement action .  In addition,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banks should have policies, procedures, and processes in place to check existing customers

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: when there are additions or changes to the OFAC list .  The frequency of the  review should be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: based on the bank ’s OFAC risk .  For example, banks with a lower  OFAC risk level may

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: periodically (e.g., weekly, monthly  or quarterly ) ) compare the customer base against the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC list .  Transactions such as funds transfers, letters of credit, and noncustomer

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions should be checked against OFAC lists prior to being executed.  When

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: developing OFAC policies, procedures, and processes , the bank should keep in mind that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC considers the continued operation of an account or the proc essing of transactions post -

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: designation, along with the adequacy of the bank’s OFAC compliance program, to be a factor in determining the appropriate enforcement response to an apparent violation of OFAC regulations .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 161 The bank should maintain documentation of its OFAC checks on new

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: accounts, the existing customer base and specific transactions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: If a bank uses a third party, such as an agent or service provider, to perform OFAC checks on its behalf, as with any other responsibility performed by a third party , the bank is ultimately

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: responsible for that third party ’s compliance with the OFAC requirements .  As a result, banks

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should have a written agreement in place and establish adequate controls and review

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: procedures for such relationships.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Updating OFAC list s.  A bank’ s OFAC compliance program should include policies,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: procedures, and processes for timely updating of the lists of sanctioned  countries  and blocked

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: entities, and individuals , and disseminating such information throughout the bank’ s domestic

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: operat ions and its offshore offices, branches and, in the case of Iran and Cuba, foreign

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: subsidiaries .  This would include ensuring that any manual updates of interdiction software

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: are completed in a timely manner.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Screening A utomated C learing H ouse (ACH)  transactions .  ACH transaction s may

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: involve persons or parties subject to the sanctions programs administered by OFAC .  Refer to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the expanded overview section, “Automated Clearing House Transactions ,” page  216, for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: additional guidance.  OFAC has clarified  its interpretation of the application of OFAC’s rules

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: for domestic and cross -border ACH transactions  and provided more detailed guidance on

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: international  ACH transactions .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: With respect to domestic ACH transactions, the Originating Depository Financial Institution

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (ODFI) is responsible for verifying that the Originator is not a blocked party and making a good faith effort to ascertain  that the Originator is not transmitting b locked funds .  The

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Receiving Depository Financial Institution (RDFI) similarly is responsible for verifying that the Receiver is not a blocked party .  In this way, the ODFI and the RDFI are relying on each

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: other for compliance with OFAC regulations .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: If an ODFI receives  domestic  ACH transactions that its customer has already batched, the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: ODFI is not responsible for unbatching those transactions to ensure that no transactions

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 161 Refer to 74 Fed. Reg.  57593 (November 9, 2009), Economic Sanctions Enforcement Guidelines .  Further

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: information is available on the OFAC Web site .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 162 Refer to Guidance to National Automated Clearing House Association (NACHA) on cross -border ACH

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Office of Foreign Assets Control — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  149 11/17/2014  violate OFAC’s regulations .  If an ODFI unbatches a file originally received from the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Originator in order to process “on- us” transactions, that ODFI is responsible for the OFAC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance for the on -us transactions because it is acting as both the ODFI and the RDFI for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: those transactions .  ODFIs acting in this capacity should already know  their customers for the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: purposes of OFAC and other regulatory requirements .  For the residual unbatched

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions in the file that are not “ on-us,” as well as those situations where banks deal with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: unbatched ACH records for reasons other than to strip out the on- us transactions, banks

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should determine the level of their OFAC risk and develop appropriate policies, procedures,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and processes to address the associated risks .  Such policies might involve screening each

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: unbatched ACH record .  Similarly, banks  that have relationships with third -party service

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: providers should assess those relationships and their related ACH transactions to ascertain the bank’s level of OFAC risk and to develop appropriate policies, procedures, and processes

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to mitigate that risk .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: With respect to cross -border screening, similar but somewhat more stringent OFAC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: obligations hold for International ACH transactions  (IAT ).  In the case of inbound IATs, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: regardless of whether the OFAC flag in the IAT is set , an RDFI is responsible for compliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: with OFAC sanctions programs .  For outbound IATs , however, the ODFI cannot rely on

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC screening by an RDFI outside of the United States .  In these situations, the ODFI must

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: exercise increased diligence to ensure  that illegal transactions are not processed.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Due diligence for an inbound or outbound IAT may include screening the parties to a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transaction, as well as reviewing the details of the payment field information for an indication of  a sanctions violation, investigat ing the resulting hits, if any, and ultimately

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: blocking or rejecting the transaction, as appropriate .  Refer to the expanded overview section,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: “Automated Clearing House Transactions,” page 216, for additional guidance .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Additional information on the types o f retail payment systems (ACH payment systems) is

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: available in the FFIEC  Information Technology Examination Handbook .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In guidance issued on March 10, 2009, OFAC authorized institutions in the United States when they are acting as an ODFI/Gateway Operator (GO) for inbound IAT debits to reject transactions that appear to involve blockable property or property interests.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 164 The guidance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: further state s that to the extent that an ODFI/GO screens inbound IAT debits for possible

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC violations prior to execution and in the course of such screening discovers a potential OFAC violation, the suspect transaction is to be removed from the batch for further investigation .  If the ODFI/GO determines that the transaction does appear to violate OFAC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: regulations, the ODFI/GO should refuse to process the transfer .  The procedure applies to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions that would normally be blocked as well as to transactions that would normally be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: rejected for OFAC purposes based on the information in the payment.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Reporting .  An OFAC compliance program should also include policies, procedures, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: processes for handling validly  blocked or rejected items under the various sanctions

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 163 Refer to t he FFIEC Information Technology Examination Handbook ’s Retail Payment Systems  booklet.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 164 Refer to  the NACHA W eb site .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Office of Foreign Assets Control — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  150 11/17/2014  programs .  When there is a question about the validity of an interdiction, banks can contact

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC by phone or e -hot line for guidance .  Most other items should be reported through

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: usual channels within ten days of the occurrence .  The policies, procedures, a nd processes

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should also address the management of blocked accounts .  Banks are responsible for tracking

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the amount of blocked funds, the ownership of those funds, and interest paid on those funds .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Total amounts blocked, including interest, must be report ed to OFAC by September 30 of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: each year (information as of June 30) .  When a bank acquires or merges with another bank,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: both banks should take into consideration the need to review and maintain such records and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: information.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Banks no longer need to file SAR s based solely on blocked narcotics - or terrorism -related

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions, as long as the bank files the required blocking report with OFAC .  However,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: because blocking reports require only limited information, if the bank is in possession of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: additional inform ation not included on the OFAC blocking report, a separate SAR  should be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: filed with FinCEN that would include such information.  In addition, the bank should file a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: SAR if the transaction itself would be considered suspicious in the absence of a valid OFAC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: match.165

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Maintaining license information .  OFAC recommends that banks consider maintaining

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: copies of customers ’ OFAC licenses on file .  This allow s the bank to verify whether a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: customer is initiating a legal transaction .  Banks should also be aware of the expiration date

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: on the OFAC license.  If it is unclear whether a particular transaction would be  authorized

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: under the terms of the license, the bank should contact OFAC .  Maintaining copies of OFAC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: licenses also is  useful when  another bank in the payment chain requests verification of a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: license’ s validity .  Copies of OFAC licenses should be maintained for five years, following

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the most recent transaction conducted in accordance with the license.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Independent Testing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Every bank should conduct an independent test of its OFAC compliance program that is performed by the internal audit department, outside auditors, consultants, or other qualified independent parties .  For large banks, the frequency and area of the independent test should

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: be based on the known or perceived risk of specific business areas .  For smaller banks, the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: audit should be consistent with the bank’ s OFAC risk profile or be based on a perceived risk.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The person(s) responsible for testing should conduct an objective, comprehensive evaluation of OFAC policies, procedures, and processes .  The audit scope should be comprehensive

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: enough to assess OFAC compliance risks and evaluate the adequacy of the OFAC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance program.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Responsible Individual

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: It is recommended that every bank designate a qualified individual(s) to be responsible for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the day -to-day compliance of the OFAC compliance program, including changes or updates

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to the various sanctions programs, and the reporting of blocked or rejected transactions  to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC and the oversight of blocked funds .  This individual should have an appropriate level

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of knowledge about OFAC regulations commensurate with the bank ’s OFAC risk profile.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 165 Refer to FinCEN Release Number 2004 -02, Unitary Filing of Suspicious Activity and Blocking Reports , 69

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Fed. Reg.  76847 (December 23, 2004).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Office of Foreign Assets Control — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  151 11/17/2014  Training

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The bank should provide adequate training for all appropriate employ ees on its OFAC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance program, procedures and processes .  The scope and frequency of the training

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should be consistent with the bank’ s OFAC risk profile and appropriate to employee

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: responsibilities .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Office of Foreign Assets Control — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  152 11/17/2014  Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Office of Foreign Assets Control

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the bank ’s risk -based Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance program to evaluate whether it is appropriate for the bank ’s OFAC risk, taking

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: into consideration its products, services, customers, entities, transactions, and geographic

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: locations .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1. Determine whether the board of directors and senior management of the bank have

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: developed policies, procedures, and processes based on their risk assessment to ensure

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance with OFAC laws and regulations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 2. Review  the bank’ s OFAC compliance program  in the context of the bank’s OFAC risk

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: assessment .  Consider the following:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The extent of, and method for, conducting OFAC searches of each relevant

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: department  or business line (e.g., ACH transactions, cross -border funds transfers,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: trade fi nance products, monetary instrument sales, check cashing, trusts, loans,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: deposits, and investments) as the process may vary from one department or business

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: line to another.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The ex tent of, and method for, conducting OFAC searches of account parties other

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: than accountholders, which may include beneficiaries, guarantors, principals,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: beneficial owners, nominee shareholders, directors, signatories, and powers of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: attorney.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The assignment  of responsibilities within the institution  for ensuring compliance with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Timeliness of obtaining and updating OFAC lists and  filtering criteria.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The appropriateness of the filtering criteria used by the bank to reasonably identify

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC matches (e.g.,  the extent to which the filtering  or search criteria includes

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: misspellings and name derivations).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The process used to investigate  potential matches, including escalation procedures for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: potential matches.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The process used to block and reject transactions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The process used to inform management of blocked or rejected transactions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The adequacy and timeliness of filing  to OFAC.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The process to manage blocked accounts (such accounts must be reported to OFAC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and earn  a commercially reasonable rate of interest  while the funds remain blocked).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The record -retention requirements ( e.g., five -year requirement to retain relevant

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC records; for blocked property, record retention for as long as blocked; once

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: unblocked, records must be maintained for five years).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Office of Foreign Assets Control — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  153 11/17/2014  3. Determine the adequacy of independent testing (audit) and follow -up procedures.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 4. Review the adequacy of the bank ’s OFAC training program based on the bank’ s OFAC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: risk assessment.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 5. Determine whether the bank has adequately addressed weaknesses or defici encies

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: identified by OFAC, auditors, or regulators.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Transaction Testing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 6. On the basis of a bank’ s risk assessment, prior examination reports, and a review of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank’ s audit findings, select the following samples to test the bank ’s OFAC compliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: progr am for adequacy, as follows:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Sample new accounts (e.g., deposit, loan, trust, safe deposit, investments, credit cards,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and foreign office accounts,) and evaluate the filtering process used to search the OFAC database (e.g., the timing of the search), and documentation maintained

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: evidencing the searches.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Sample appropriate transactions that may not be related to an account (e.g., funds

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transfers, monetary instrument sales , and check -cashing transactions), and evaluate

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the filtering criteria used to search the OFAC database, the timing of the search, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: documentation maintained evidencing the searches.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • If the bank uses an automated system to conduct searches, assess the timing of when

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: updates are made to the system, and when the most recent OFAC changes wer e made

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to the system.  Also, evaluate whether all of the bank’ s databases are run against the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: automated system, and the frequency upon which searches are made.  If there is any

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: doubt regarding the effectiveness of the OFAC filter, then run tests of the sys tem by

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: entering test account names that are the same as or similar to those recently added to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the OFAC list to determine whether the system successfully identifies a potential hit.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • If the bank does not use an automated system, evaluate the process used to check the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: existing customer base against the OFAC list and the frequency of such checks.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Review a sample of potential OFAC matches and evaluate the bank ’s resolution for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: blocking  and rejecting processes.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Review a sample of blocked and rejected reports file d to OFAC and evaluate their

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: completeness and timeliness.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • If the bank is required to maintain blocked accounts, select a sample and ensure that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the bank maintains adequate records of amounts blocked and the ownership of blocked funds, pay s a commercially r easonable rate of interest on all blocked

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: accounts, and  accurately report s required information on blocked property annually

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (by September 30) to OFAC .  Test the controls in place to verify that the account is

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: blocked.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Pull a sample of false hits (potent ial matches) to check their handling; the resolution

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of a false hit should take place outside of the business line.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Office of Foreign Assets Control — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  154 11/17/2014  7. Identify any potential matches that were not reported to OFAC, discuss with bank

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: management, advise bank management to immediately notify  OFAC of unreported

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions, and immediately notify supervisory personnel at your regulatory agency.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 8. Determine the origin of deficiencies (e.g., training, audit, risk assessment, internal controls, management oversight), and conclude on the adequac y of the bank ’s OFAC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance program.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 9. Discuss OFAC related examination findings with bank management.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 10. Include OFAC conclusions within the report of examination, as appropriate.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Compliance Program Structures — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  155 11/17/2014  EXPANDED EXAMINATION  OVERVIEW AND

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: PROCEDURES FOR CONSOLIDATED AND OTH ER

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: TYPES OF BSA/AML  COMPLIANCE PROGRAM

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: STRUCTURE S

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Compliance Program

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Structures  — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the structure and management of the organization’s BSA/AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance program and if applicable, the organization’s consolidated or partially

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: consolidated approach to BSA/AML compliance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Every bank must have a comprehensive BSA/AML compliance program that addresses BSA

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirements applicab le to all operations of the organization.166 Banking organizations have

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: discretion as to how the BSA/AML compliance program is structured and managed.  A banking organization may structure and manage the BSA/AML compliance program or some parts of the progra m within a legal entity ; with some degree of consolidation across entities

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: within an organization; or as part of a comprehensive enterprise risk management

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: framework.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Many large, complex banking organizations aggregate risk of all types (e.g., compliance,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: operational, credit, interest rate risk, etc.) on a firm -wide basis in order to maximize

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: efficiencies and better identify, monitor, and control all types of risks within or across affiliates, subsidiaries, lines of business, or jurisdictions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 167 In such orga nizations,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: management of BSA risk is generally the responsibility of a corporate compliance function

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: that supports and oversees the  BSA/AML compliance program .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Other banking  organizations may adopt a structure that is less centralized but still

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: consolidate s some or all aspects of BSA/AML compliance.  For example, risk assessment,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: internal controls (e.g., suspicious activity monitoring), independent testing, or training may

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: be managed centrally .  Such centralization can effectively  maximize efficiencies and enhance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: assessment of risks and implementation of controls across business lines, legal entities , and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: jurisdictions of operation.  For instance , a centralized BSA/AML risk assessment function

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: may enable a banking organization to determine  its overall risk exposure to a customer doing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 166 Neither FinCEN nor banking agency rules impose a specific BSA/AML compliance program obligation on

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Bank Holding Companies, Unitary Savings and Loan Holding Companies, and parents of Industrial Loan

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Companies.  Nevertheless, these entities, as a result of their primary business function (e.g., insurance company

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or broker -dealer), may be subject to a BSA/AML compliance program obligation under Treasury rules or rules

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of other agencies.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 167 For further detail, refer to Compliance Risk Management Programs and Ov ersight at Large Banking

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Organizations with Complex Compliance Profiles,  Federal Reserve Board  SR Letter 08 -8, October 16, 2008

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (FRB Guidance).  The FRB Guidance generally addresses overall compliance functions within large, complex

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: firms, and endorses for  all firms the principles set forth in the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: guidance, Compliance and the compliance function in banks  (April 2005).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Compliance Program Structures — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  156 11/17/2014  business with the organization in multiple business lines or jurisdictions.168 Regardless of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: how a consolidated BSA/AML compliance program is organized, it should reflect the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: organization’s business structure , size, and complexit y, and be designed to effectively

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: address risks , exposures, and applicable legal requirements across the organization.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: A consolidated approach should also include the establishment of corporate standards for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML compliance that reflect the expectations  of the organization’s board of directors,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: with senior management working to ensure that the BSA/AML compliance program implements these corporate standards .  Individual lines of  business policies would then

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: supplement the corporate standards and address s pecific risks within the line of business or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: department.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: A consolidated BSA/AML compliance  program typically includes  a central point where

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML risks throughout the organization are aggregated.  Refer to “Consolidated

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Compliance Risk Assessmen t,” page 24.  Under a consolidated approach, risk

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should be assessed both within and across all business lines, legal entities , and jurisdictions

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of operation.  Programs for global organizations should incorporate the AML laws and requirements of  the various jurisdictions in which they operate .  Internal audit should assess

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the level of compliance with the consolidated BSA/AML compliance program.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Examiners should be aware that some complex, diversified banking organizations may have various subsidiaries that hold different types of licenses and banking charters or may organize business activities and BSA/AML compliance program components across their legal entities .  For instance, a highly diversified banking organization may establish or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: maintain accounts  using multiple legal entities that are examined by multiple regulators .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: This action may be taken  in order to maximize efficiencies, enhance tax benefits, adhere to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: jurisdictional regulations, etc .  This methodology  may present a challenge to an e xaminer

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reviewing BSA/AML compliance in a legal entity within an  organization.  As appropriate,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: examiners should coordinate efforts with other regulatory agencies in order  to address these

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: challenges or ensure the examination scope appropriately covers the legal entity examined .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Structure of the BSA/AML Compliance Function

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: As discussed above, a banking organization has discretion as to how to structure and manage its BSA/AML compliance program.  For example, a small institution may choose to combine

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML compliance with other functions and utilize the same personnel in several roles .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In such circumstances, there should still be adequate senior -level attention to BSA/AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance, and sufficient dedicated resources .  As is the case in all structu res, the audit

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: function should remain independent.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: A larger, more complex firm may establish a corporate BSA/AML compliance function to coordinate some or all BSA/AML responsibilities .  For example, w hen there is delegation of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML compliance responsibi lities, and  BSA/AML compliance staff is located within

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: lines of business, expectations should be clearly set forth in order to ensure effective implementation of the BSA/AML compliance program.  In particular, allocation of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 168 For additional guidance, refer to the expanded overview section, “Foreign Branches and Offices of U.S.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Banks,” page  164, and the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision’s guidance Consolidated Know Your

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Customer (KYC) Risk Management . .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Compliance Program Structures — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  157 11/17/2014  responsibility should be clear w ith respect to the content and comprehensiveness of MIS

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reports, the depth and frequency of monitoring efforts, and the role of different parties within

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the banking organization (e.g., risk, business lines, operations)  in BSA/AML compliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: decision -making  processes .  Clearly communicating which functions have been delegated

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and which remain centralized helps to ensure consistent implementation of the BSA/AML compliance program among lines of business, affiliates, and jurisdictions .  In addition, a clear

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: line of responsibility may help to avoid conflicts of interest and ensure that objectivity is

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: maintained.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Regardless of the management structure or size of the institution, BSA/AML compliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: staff located within lines of business is not precluded from close  interaction with the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: management and staff of the various business lines .  BSA/AML compliance functions are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: often most effective when strong working relationships exist between compliance and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: business line staff.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In some compliance structures, the complian ce staff reports to the management of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: business  line.  This can occur in smaller institutions when the BSA/AML compliance staff

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reports to a senior bank officer; in larger institutions when the compliance staff reports to a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: line of business manager; or in a foreign banking organization’s  U.S. operations  when the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: staff reports to a single office or executive.  These situations can present risks of potential

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: conflicts of interest that could hinder effective BSA/AML compliance .  To ensure the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: strength of compliance controls, an appropriate level of BSA/AML compliance independence

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should be maintained, for example, by:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Providing BSA/AML compliance staff a reporting line to the corporate  compliance or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: other independent function;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Ensuring that  BSA/AML compliance staff  is actively involved in  all matters affec ting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: AML risk (e.g., new products, review or termination of customer relationships, filing determinations) ;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Establishing a process for escalating and objectively resolving disputes between

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML complia nce staff and business line management ; and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Establishing internal controls to ensure that compliance objectivity is maintained when

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML compliance staff is assigned additional bank responsibilities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Management and Oversight of the BSA/AML Compliance P rogram

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The board of directors and senior management of a bank have different responsibilities and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: roles in overseeing, and managing BSA/AML compliance risk.  The board of directors has primary responsibility for ensuring that the bank has a comprehensive a nd effective

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML compliance program and oversight framework that is reasonably designed to ensure compliance with BSA/AML regulation .  Senior management is responsible for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: implementing the board -approved BSA/AML compliance program.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Compliance Program Structures — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  158 11/17/2014  Boards of directors.169 The board of directors is responsible for approving the BSA/AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance program and for overseeing the structure and management of the bank’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML compliance function.  The board is responsible for setting an appropriate culture of BSA/AML complian ce, establishing clear policies regarding the management of key

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML risks, and ensuring that these policies are adhered to in practice.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The board should ensure that senior management is fully capable, qualified, and properly motivated to manage the BS A/AML compliance risks arising from the organization’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: business activities in a manner that is consistent with the board’s expectations .  The board

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should ensure that the BSA/AML compliance function has an appropriately prominent status within the organiza tion.  Senior management within the BSA/AML compliance function and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: senior compliance personnel within the individual business lines should have the appropriate authority, independence, and access to personnel and information within the organization, and a ppropriate resources to conduct their activities effectively .  The board should ensure

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: that its views about the importance of BSA/AML compliance are understood and communicated across all levels of the banking organization.  The board also should ensure that senior management has established appropriate incentives to integrate BSA/AML compliance objectives into management goals and compensation structure across the organization, and that corrective actions , including disciplinary measures , if appropriate, are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: taken when serious BSA/AML compliance failures are identified.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Senior management.  Senior management is responsible for communicating and reinforcing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the BSA/AML compliance culture established by the board , and implement ing and enforc ing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the board- approved BSA/AML compliance program .  If the banking organization has a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: separate BSA/AML compliance function, senior management of the function should establish, support, and oversee the organization’s BSA/AML compliance program .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML compliance staff sho uld report to the board, or a committee thereof, on the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: effectiveness of the BSA/AML compliance program and significant BSA/AML compliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: matters.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Senior management of a foreign banking organization’s U.S. operations should provide

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: sufficient information relating to the U.S. operations’ BSA/AML compliance to the governance or control functions in its home country, and should ensure that responsible senior management in the home country ha s an appropriate understanding of the BSA/AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: risk and control environment governing U.S. operations .  U.S. management should assess the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: effectiveness of established BSA/AML control mechanisms for U.S. operations on an ongoing basis and report and escalate areas of concern as needed .  As appropriate, corrective

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: action then should be developed , implemented  and validated .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Consolidated BSA/AML Compliance Programs

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Banking organizations  that centrally manage the operations and functions of their subsidiary

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banks, other subsidiaries, and business lines should ensure that comprehensive risk management policies, procedures, and processes are in place across the organization to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 169 Foreign banking organizations should ensure that, with respect to their U.S. operations, the responsibilities of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the board described in this section are fulfilled in an appropriate manner through their oversight structur e and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML risk management framework.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Compliance Program Structures — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  159 11/17/2014  address the entire organization’s spectrum of risk.  An adequate consolidated BSA/AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance program provides the framework for all subsidiaries, business lines, and foreign branches to meet their specific regulatory requirements (e.g., country or industry requirements) .  Accordingly, banking organizations that centrally manage  a consolidated

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML compliance program should, among other things provide appropriate structure ;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and advise the business lines, subsidiaries, and foreign branches on the development of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: appropriate guidelines .  For additional guidance, refer to the expanded overview section ,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: “Foreign Branches and Offices of U.S. Banks ,” page  164.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: An organization applying a consolidated BSA/AML compliance program may choose to manage only specific compliance controls (e.g., suspicious activity monitoring systems, audit ) on a consolidated basis, with other compliance controls managed solely within

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: affiliates, subsidiaries, and business lines .  Whe n this approach is taken, examiners must

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: identify which portions of the BSA/AML compliance program are part of the consolidated BSA/AML compliance program .  This information is critical when scoping and planning a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML examination.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: When evaluating a consolidated BSA/AML compliance program for adequacy, the examiner should determine reporting lines and how each affiliate, subsidia ry, business line, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: jurisdiction fits into the overall compliance structure .  This should include an assessment of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: how clearly roles and responsibilities are communicated across the bank or banking organization.  The examiner also should assess  how effectively the bank or banking

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: organization monitors BSA/AML compliance throughout the organization, including how well the consolidated and nonconsolidated BSA/AML compliance program captures relevant

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: data from subsidiaries.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The evaluation of a consolidated BSA/AML compliance program should take into

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: consideration available information about the adequacy of the individual subsidiaries’ BSA/AML compliance program .  Regardless of the decision to implement a consolidated

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML compliance program in whole or in part, the program should ensure that all affiliates, including those operating within foreign jurisdictions, meet their applicable regulatory requirements .  For example, an audit program implemented solely on a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: consolidated basis that does not conduct appropriate transaction testing at all subsidiaries subject to the BSA would not be sufficient to meet regulatory requirements for independent

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: testing for those subsidiaries.  If dissemination of certain information is limited and therefore

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transparency acros s the organization is restricted, audit should be aware and ensure AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: controls are commensurate with those risks.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Suspicious Activity Reporting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Bank holding companies (BHC ) or any nonbank subsidiary thereof, or a foreign bank  that is

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: subject to the BHC Act or any nonbank subsidiary of such a foreign bank operating in the United States , are required to file SARs .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 170   A BHC’s nonbank subsidiaries operating only

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: outside the United States are not required to file SARs .  Certain sav ings and loan holding

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: companies, and their nondepository subsidiaries, are required to file SARs pursuant to Treasury regulations (e.g., insurance companies (31 CFR 1025.320) and broker/dealers (31

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Compliance Program Structures — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  160 11/17/2014  CFR 1023.320).  In addition, savings and loan holding companies, if not required, are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: strongly encouraged to file SARs in appropriate circumstances.  On January 20, 2006, the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Financial Crimes Enforcement Network, Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, and the Office of Thrift Supervision  issued guidance authorizing banking organizations to share

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: SARs with head offices and controlling companies, whether located in the United States or abroad .  Refer to the core overview sec tion, “Suspicious Activity Reporting ,” page  60, for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: additional information .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Compliance Program Structures — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  161 11/17/2014  Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Compliance Program  Structure s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the structure and management of the banking organization’s BSA/AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance program, and, if applicable, the banking organization’s consolidated or partially consolidated approach to BSA/AML compliance .  A BSA/AML compliance program may be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: structured in a variety of ways , and an examiner s hould perform procedures based on the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: structure of the organization.  Completion of these procedures may require communication

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: with other regulators.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1. Review the structure and management of the  BSA/AML compliance program .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Communicate with peers at other  federal and state banking agencies, as necessary, to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: confirm their understanding of the organization’s BSA/AML compliance program .  This

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: approach promotes consistent supervision and lessens regulatory burden for the banking

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: organization.  Determine the ex tent to which the structure of the  BSA/AML compliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: program affects the organization being examined, by considering:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The existence of consolidated or partially consolidated operations or functions responsible for day -to-day BSA/AML operations, including, but not limited to, the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: centralization of suspicious activity monitoring and reporting, currency transaction

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reporting, currency exemption review and reporting, or  recordkeeping activities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The consolidation of operational units, such as financial intelli gence units, dedicated

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to and responsible for monitoring transactions across activities, business lines, or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: legal entities .  (Assess the variety and extent of information that data or transaction

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: sources (e.g., banks, broker/dealers, trust companies, Edge Act and agreement corporations, insurance companies, or foreign branches) are entering into the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: monitoring and reporting systems ).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The extent to which the banking organization ( or a corporate -level unit, such as audit

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or compliance) performs regular indepe ndent testing of BSA/AML activities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The sufficiency of audit in jurisdictions with restrictive privacy laws that may limit

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the dissemination of information.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Whether and to what extent a corporate- level unit sponsors BSA/AML training.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 2. Review testing  for BSA/AML compliance throughout the banking organization, as

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: applicable,  and identif y program deficiencies.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 3. Review board minutes to determine the adequacy of MIS and of reports provided to the board of directors .  Ensure that the board of directors has received appropriate

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: notification of SARs filed.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 4. Review policies, procedures, processes, and risk assessments formulated and implemented by the organization’s  board of directors, a board committee thereof, or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: senior management .  As part of this revi ew, assess effectiveness of the organization’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: ability to perform the following responsibilities:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Compliance Program Structures — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  162 11/17/2014  • Manage the BSA/AML compliance program and provide adequate oversight .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
