content: payments (the MT 202 COV) that contains mandatory fields for originator and beneficiary information .  Effective November 21, 2009, the MT 202 COV is required for any bank- to-

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank payment for which there is an associated MT 103.  The MT 202 COV provide s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Funds Transfers — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  210 11/17/2014  intermediary banks with additional originator and beneficiary information to perform

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: sanctions screening and suspicious activity monitoring.  The introduction of the MT 202

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: COV does not alter a U.S. bank’s OFAC or BSA/AML obligations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The MT 202 format remains available for bank -to-bank funds transfers that have no

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: associated MT 103 message.  For additional detail about transparency in cover payments,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: refer to Transparency and Compliance for U.S. Banking Organizations Conducting Cross -

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Border Funds T ransfers (December 18 , 2009), which can be found at each federal banking

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: agencies’ W eb site.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Informal Value Transfer Systems

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: An informal value transfer system (IVTS) (e.g., hawalas) is  a term used to describe a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: currency or value transfer system that operates  informally to transfer money as a business.204

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In countries lacking a stable financial sector or with large areas not served by formal banks,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: IVTS may be the only method for conducting financial transactions .  Persons living in the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: United States may also use IVTS to transfer funds to their home countries.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: IVTS may legally operate in the United States as a Money Services Business, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: specifically as a type of money transmitter, so long as they abide by applica ble state and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: federal laws.  This includes registering with FinCEN and complying with BSA/AML provisions applicable to all money transmitters .  A more sophisticated form of IVTS

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: operating in the United States often interacts with other financial institutio ns in storing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: currency, clearing checks, remitting and receiving funds, and obtaining other routine

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial services, rather than acting independently of the formal financial system.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Payable Upon Proper I dentification  Transactions

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: One type of funds trans fer transaction that carries particular risk is the payable upon proper

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: identification (PUPID) service .  PUPID transactions are funds transfers for which there is no

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: specific account to deposit the funds into and the beneficiary of the funds is not a bank

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: customer .  For example, an individual may transfer funds to a relative or an individual who

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: does not have an account relationship with the bank that receives the funds transfer .  In this

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: case, the beneficiary bank may place the incoming funds into a suspense account and ultimately release the funds when the individual provides proof of identity .  In some cases,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banks permit noncustomers to initiate PUPID transactions .  These transactions are considered

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: extremely high risk and require strong controls.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 204 Sources of information on IVTS include:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • FinCEN Advisory FIN -2010- A011, Informal Value Transfer Systems , September 2010

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • FinCEN Advisory 33, Informal Value Transfer Systems , March 2003.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • U.S. Treasury Informal Value Transfer Systems Report to the Congress in Accordance with Section 359

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of the Patriot Act, November 2002.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Financial Action Task Force on Money Laundering (FATF) , Interpretative Note to Special

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Recommendation VI: Alternative Remittance , June 2003.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • FATF, Combating the Abuse of Alternative Remittance Systems, International Best Practices , October

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Funds Transfers — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  211 11/17/2014  Risk Factors

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Funds transfers may present a heightened degree of risk, depending on such factors as the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: number and dollar volume of transactions, geographic location of originators and beneficiaries, and whether the originator or beneficiary is a bank customer .  The size and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: complexity of a bank’s operation and the origin and destination of the funds being transferred determine which type of funds transfer system the bank uses .  The vast majority of funds

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transfer instructions are conducted electronically; howeve r, examiners need to be mindful

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: that physical instructions may be transmitted by other informal methods, as described earlier.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Cover payments effected through SWIFT pose additional risks for an intermediary bank that does not receive either a MT 103 or an adequately completed MT 202 COV that identifies the originator and beneficiary of the funds transfer .  Without this data, the intermediary bank

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: is unable to monitor or filter  payment information .  This lack of transparency limits the U.S.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: intermediary bank ’s ability to appropriately assess and manage the risk associated with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: correspondent and clearing operations, monitor for suspicious activity, and screen for OFAC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: IVTS pose a heightened concern because they are able to circumvent the formal sys tem.  The

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: lack of recordkeeping requirements coupled with the lack of identification of the IVTS

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: participants may attract money launderers and terrorists .  IVTS also pose heightened

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML concerns because they can evade internal controls and monitoring oversight established in the formal banking environment .  Principals that operate IVTS frequently use

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banks to settle accounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The risks of PUPID transactions to the beneficiary bank are similar to other activities in which the bank does business with nonc ustomers .  However, the risks are heightened in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: PUPID transactio ns if the bank allows a noncustomer to access the funds transfer system by

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: providing minimal or no identifying information .  Banks that allow noncustomers to transfer

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: funds using the PUPID ser vice pose significant risk to both the originating and beneficiary

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banks .  In these situations, both banks have minimal or no identifying information on the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: originator or the beneficiary.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Risk Mitigation

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Funds transfers can be used in the placement, layeri ng, and integration stages of money

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: laundering .  Funds transfers purchased with currency are an example of the placement stage.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Detecting unusual activity in the layering and integration stages is more difficult for a bank

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: because transactions may appear legitimate .  In many cases, a bank may not be involved in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the placement of the funds or in the final integration, only the layering of transactions .  Banks

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should consider all three stages of money laundering when evaluating or assessing funds

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transfer ris ks.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Banks need to have sound policies, procedures, and processes to manage the BSA/AML risks

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of its funds transfer activities .  Such policies may encompass more than regulatory

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: recordkeeping minimums and be expanded to cover OFAC  obligations .  Funds transfer

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: policies, procedures, and processes should address all foreign correspondent banking activities, including transactions in which U.S. branches and agencies of foreign banks are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: intermediaries for their head offices.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Funds Transfers — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  212 11/17/2014  Obtaining CDD information is an  important risk mitigation step in providing funds transfer

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: services .  Because of the nature of funds transfers, adequate and effective CDD policies,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: procedures, and processes are critical in detecting unusual and suspicious activities .  An

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: effective risk -based suspicious activity monitoring and reporting system is equally important .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Whether this monitoring and reporting system is automated or manual, it should be sufficient

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to detect suspicious trends and patterns typically associated with money laundering.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Institutions should have processes for managing correspondent banking relationships in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: accordance with section 312 of the USA PATRIOT  Act and corresponding regulations ( 31

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: CFR 1010.610) .  Correspondent bank due diligence should take into account the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: correspondent’s practices with regard to funds transfers effected through the U.S. bank.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: U.S. banks can mitigate risk associated with cover payments by managing correspondent

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banking relationships, by observing The Clearing House Payments Co., LLC and the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Wolfsberg  Group’s  best practices (discussed below) and the SWIFT standards when sending

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: messages, and by conducting appropriate transaction screening and monitoring.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In May 2009, the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision issued a paper on cross -border

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: cover payment messages (BIS Cover Payments Paper).205 The BIS Cover Payments P aper

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: supported increased transparency and encouraged all banks involved in international

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: payments transactions to adhere to the message standards developed by T he Clearing House

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Payments Co., LLC and the Wolfsberg Group in 2007.  These are:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Financial institutions should not omit, delete , or alter information in payment messages or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: orders for the purpose of avoiding detection of that information by any other financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institution in the payment process ;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Financial institutions should not use any particular payment message for the purpose of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: avoiding detection of information by any other financial institution in the payment

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: process ;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Subject to all applicable laws, financial institutions should cooperate as fully as

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: practicable with other financial institutions in the payment process when requested to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: provide information about the parties involved; and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Financial institutions should strongly encourage their correspondent banks to observe

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: these principles.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In addition, effective monitoring processes for cover payments include:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Monitoring funds transfers processed through automated systems in order to identify

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: suspicious activity .  This monitoring may be conducted after the transfers are proce ssed,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: on an automated basis, and may use  a risk -based approach .  The MT 202 COV provides

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: intermediary banks with useful information, which can be filtered using risk factors

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 205 Refer to the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision ’s Due diligence and transparency regarding cover

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: payment messages related to cross -border wire transfers .  In addition, during August 2009, the committee,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: along with the Clearinghouse Payments Co. LLC, released Q&A s in order to enhance understanding of the MT

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 202 COV.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Funds Transfers — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  213 11/17/2014  developed by the intermediary bank.  The monitoring process may be similar to that for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: MT 103 payments.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Given the volume of messages and data for large U.S. intermediary banks, a manual

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: review of every payment order may not be feasible or effective.  However, intermediary

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banks should have, as part of their monitoring processes, a risk- based method to identify

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: incomplete fields or fields with meaningless data .  U.S. banks engaged in processing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: cover payments should have policies to address such circumstances, including those that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: involve systems other than SWIFT.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Originating and beneficiary banks should establish effective and appropriate policies, procedures, and processes for PUPID activity including:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Specifying the type of identification that is acceptable.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Maintaining documentation of individuals consistent with the bank’s recordkeepi ng

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: policies.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Defining which bank employees may conduct PUPID transactions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Establishing limits on the amount of funds that may be transferred to or from the bank for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: noncustomers (including type of funds accepted (i.e., currency or official check) by

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: origi nating bank).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Monitoring and reporting suspicious activities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Providing enhanced scrutiny for transfers to or from certain jurisdictions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Identifying disbursement method (i.e., by currency or official check) for proceeds from a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: beneficiary bank.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Funds Transfers — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  214 11/17/2014  Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Funds Transfers

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the adequacy of the bank ’s systems to manage the risks associated with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: funds transfers, and management ’s ability to implement effective monitoring and reporting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: systems .  This section expands the core review of the statutory and regulatory requirements

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of funds transfers to provide a broader assessment of AML risks associated with this activity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1. Review the policies, procedures, and processes related to funds trans fers.  Evaluate the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: adequacy of the policies, procedures, and processes given the bank’ s funds transfer

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: activities and the risks they present.  Assess whether the controls are adequate to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reasonably protect the bank from money laundering and terrorist fina ncing.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 2. Review MIS and internal risk rating factors, and determine whether the bank effectively

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: identifies and monitors funds transfer activities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 3. Evaluate the bank ’s risks related to funds transfer activities by analyzing the frequency

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and dollar volume of funds transfers , jurisdictions, and the bank’s role in the funds

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transfer process ( e.g., whether it is the originator’s bank, intermediary bank, or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: beneficiary’s bank) .  These factors should be evaluated  in relation to the bank’ s size, its

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: location, and the nature of its customer  and correspondent  account relationships.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 4. Determine whether an audit trail of funds transfer activities exists .  Determine whether an

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: adequate separation of duties or other compensating controls are in place to ensure proper

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: authorization for sending and receiving funds transfers and for correcting postings to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: accounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 5. Determine whether the bank ’s system for monitoring funds transfers and for reporting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: suspicious activities is adequate given the bank’ s size, complexity, locat ion, and types of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: customer relationships .  Determine whether suspicious activity monitoring and reporting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: systems include:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Funds transfers purchased with currency.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Transactions in which the bank is acting as an intermediary.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • All SWIFT message formats, including MT 103, MT 202, and MT 202 COV.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Transactions in which the bank is originating or receiving funds transfers from

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: foreign financial institutions, particularly to or from jurisdictions with strict privacy

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and secrecy laws or those identified as higher  risk.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Frequent currency deposits or funds transfers and then subsequent transfers,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: particularly to a larger institution or out of the country.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 6. Review the bank’s procedures for cross -border funds transfers:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Determine whether the bank’s processes for foreign correspondent bank due diligence, as required under section 312 of the USA PATRIOT  Act and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: corresponding regulations include the review and evaluation of the transparency practices of the bank’s correspondents who are involved in cross -border funds

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Funds Transfers — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  215 11/17/2014  transfe rs through the bank (for example, whether correspondents are appropriately

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: utilizing the MT 202 COV message format).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • As applicable and if not already performed, review the bank’s procedures to ensure

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance with the Travel Rule, including appropriate use of the MT 202 COV

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: format.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Assess the bank’s policies for cooperating with its correspondents when they request

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the bank to provide information about parties involved in funds transfers.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Assess the adequacy of the bank’s procedures for addressing isolate d as well as,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: repeated instances where payment information received from a correspondent is

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: missing, manifestly meaningless or incomplete, or suspicious.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 7. Determine the bank ’s procedures for payable upon proper identification (PUPID)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Benefici ary bank — determine how the bank disburses the proceeds (i.e., by currency

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or official check).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Originating bank — determine whether the bank allows PUPID funds transfers for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: noncustomers .  If so, determine the type of funds accepted (i.e., by currency or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: official check).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 8. If appropriate, refer to the core examination procedures, “Office of Foreign Assets

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Control,” page 152, for guidance .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Transaction Testing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 9. On the basis of the bank ’s risk assessment of funds transfer activities, as well as prior

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: examination and audit reports, select a sample of higher -risk funds transfer activities,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: which may include the following:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Funds transfers purchased with currency.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Transactions in which the bank is acting as an intermediary , such as cover payments .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Transactions in which the bank is originating or receiving funds transfers from

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: foreign financial institutions, particularly to or from jurisdictions with strict privacy

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and secrecy laws or those i dentified as higher  risk.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • PUPID transactions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 10. From the sample selected, analyze funds transfers to determine whether the amounts,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: frequency, and jurisdictions of origin or destination are consistent with the nature of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: business or occupation of the cust omer.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 11. In addition, for funds transfers processed using the MT 202 and MT 202 COV message

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: formats, review the sample of messages to determine whether the bank has used the appropriate message formats and has included complete originator and beneficiary

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: information (e.g., no missing or meaningless information).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Funds Transfers — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  216 11/17/2014  12. On the basis of examination procedures completed, including transaction testing, form a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: conclusion about the adequacy of policies, procedures, and processes associated with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: funds transfer activity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Automated Clearing House Transactions — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  217 11/17/2014  Automated Clearing House Transactions — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the adequacy of the bank’s systems to manage the risks associated with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: automated clearing house (ACH) and international ACH transactions  (IAT) and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: management’s ability to implement effective monitoring and reporting systems.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The use of the ACH has grown markedly over the last several years  due  to the increased

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: volume of electronic check conversion206 and one -time ACH debits, reflecting the lower cost

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of ACH processing relative to check processing.207 Check conversion transactions, as well as

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: one-time ACH debits , are primarily low -dollar value, consumer transactions for the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: purchases of goods and services or the payment of consumer bills .  ACH is primarily  used

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: for domestic payments, but the Federal Reserve Banks’ FedGlobal system208 can currently

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: accommodate cross -border payments to several  countries around the world.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In September 2006, the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency issued guidanc e titled

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Automated Clearinghouse Activities —  Risk Management Guidance .  The document provides

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: guidance on managing the risks of ACH activity .  Banks may be exposed to a variety of risks

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: when originating, receiving, or processing ACH transactions, or outsourcing these activities

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to a third party.209

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: ACH Payment Systems

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Traditionally, the ACH system has been used for the direct deposit of payroll and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: government benefit payments and for the direct payment of mortgages and loans .  As noted

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: earlier, the ACH has b een expanding to include one -time debits and check conversion.  ACH

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions are payment instructions to either credit or debit a deposit account .  Examples of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: credit payment transactions include payroll direct deposit, Social Security, dividends, and interest payments .  Examples of debit transactions include mortgage, loan, insurance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: premium, and a variety of other consumer payments initiated through merchant s or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: business es.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In general, an ACH transaction is a batch -processed, value -dated, electronic f unds transfer

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: between an originating and a receiving bank.  An ACH credit transaction is originated by the accountholder sending funds (payer), while an ACH debit transaction is originated by the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 206 In the electronic check conversion process, merchants that receive a check for payment do not collect the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: check through the check collection system, either electronically or in paper form.  Instead, merchants use the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: information on the check to initiate a type of electronic funds transfer known as an ACH debit to the check

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: writer’s account.  The check is used to obtain the bank routing number, account number, check serial number, and dollar amount for  the transaction, and the check itself is not sent through the check collection system in any

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: form as a payment instrument.  Merchants use electronic check conversion because it can be a more efficient

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: way for them to obtain payment than collecting the che ck.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 207 Refer to the NACHA Web site .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 208 The Federal Reserve Banks operate FedACH, a central clearing facility for transmitting and receiving ACH

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: payments, and FedGlobal, which sends cross -border ACH credits  payments to more than 35 countries around

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the world, plus debit payments to Canada only.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 209 Refer to OCC Bulletin 2006 -39, “ Automated Clearing House Activities: Risk Man agement Guidance ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (September 1, 2006).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Automated Clearing House Transactions — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  218 11/17/2014  accountholder receiving funds (payee) .  Within the ACH syste m, these participants and users

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: are known by the following terms:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Originator .  An organization or person that initiates an ACH transaction to an account

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: either as a debit or credit.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Originating Depository Financial Institution (ODFI) .  The Originator’s depository

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial institution that forwards the ACH transaction into the national ACH network

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: through an ACH Operator.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • ACH Operator.  An ACH Operator processes  all ACH transactions that flow between

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: different depository financial institutions .  An ACH Operator serves as a central clearing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: facility that receives entries from the ODFIs and distributes the entries to the appropriate

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Receiving Depository Financial Institution .  There are currently two ACH Operators:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FedACH and Electronic Payments Network (E PN).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Receiving Depository Financial Institution (RDFI) .  The Receiver’s depository

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institution that receives the ACH transaction from the ACH Operators and credits or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: debits funds from their receivers’ accounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Receiver.  An organization or person that authorizes the Originator to initiate an ACH

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transaction, either as a debit or credit to an account.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Gateway.  A financial institution, ACH Operator, or ODFI that acts as an entry or exit

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: point to or from the United States .  A formal declaration of status as  a Gateway is not

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: required .  ACH operators and ODFIs acting in the role of Gateway s have specific

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: warranties and obligations related to certain international entries .  A financial institution

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: acting as a Gateway generally may process inbound and outbound debit and credit

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions .  ACH Operators acting as Gateway s may process outbound debit and credit

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: entries, but can limit inbound entries to credit entries only and reversals.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: International ACH Payments

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: NACHA —The Electronic Payments Association ( NACHA)  issued International ACH

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Transaction (IAT) operating rules and formats that became effective on September 18,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 2009.210 NACHA has since issued a number of modifications and refinements to their IAT

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: operating rules. The IAT is a Standard Entry Class code for ACH payments that enables

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial institutions to identify and monitor international ACH payments, and perform screening to ensure compliance with OFAC  requirements .  The rules require Gateway s to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: classify payments that are transmitted to or received from a financial agency

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 211 outside the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: territorial jurisdiction of the U nited S tates as IATs .  The classification depend s on where the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial agency that handles the payment transaction (movement of funds) is located and not

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the location of any other party to the transaction (e.g., the Originator or Receiver).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Under NACHA operating rules, all U.S. financial institutions that participate in the ACH Network must be able to utilize the IAT format.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 210 For additional information on the IAT, refer to the NACHA Web site .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 211 “Financial agency” means an entity that is authorized by applicable law to accept deposits or is in the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: business of issuing money orders or transferring funds.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Automated Clearing House Transactions — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  219 11/17/2014  Definition of IAT

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: An IAT is an ACH entry that is part of a payment transaction involving a financial agency’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: office that is not located in the territorial jurisdiction of the United States .  An office of a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial agency is involved in the payment transacti on if one or more of the following

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: conditions are met:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Holds an account that is credited or debited as part of a payment transaction; or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Receives funds directly from a person or makes payment directly to a person as part of a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: payment transaction; or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Serves  as an intermediary in the settlement of any part of a payment transaction.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: IAT Defined Terms

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: An “inbound entry” originates in another country and is transmitted to the United States .  For

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: example, an inbound entry could be a customer’s on- line purchase f rom an overseas vendor.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: An inbound entry could also be funding for a company payroll .  Each subsequent IAT used

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: for direct deposit would be an inbound IAT entry.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: An “outbound entry” originates in the United States and is transmitted to another country .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: For example, IAT pension payments going from a U.S. ODFI to a U.S. RDFI in which the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: funds are then transferred to an account in another country would be outbound IAT entries.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Payment Transaction Guidance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: A payment t ransaction is:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • An instruction of a sender  to a bank to pay, or to obtain payment of, or to cause another

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank to pay or to obtain payment of, a fixed or determinate amount of money that is to be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: paid to, or obtained from, a Receiver, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Any and all settlements, accounting entries, or disburseme nts that are necessary or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: appropriate to carry out the instruction.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Identification of IAT Parties

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The NACHA operating rules define parties as part of an IAT entry:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Foreign Correspondent Bank:  A participating depository financial institution (DFI) that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: holds deposits owned by other financial institutions and provides payment and other services to those financial institutions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Foreign Gateway: A Gateway that acts as an entry point to or exit point from a foreign country.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Automated Clearing House Transactions — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  220 11/17/2014  Information Available Under the IAT Format

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Data available to banks  under the IAT format  may assist banks in their OFAC, anti -money

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: laundering, and monitoring efforts.212  Originator and receiver information  available to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banks under the IAT format include:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Originator name and address .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Receiver name and address .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Originator and Receiver account numbers .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • ODFI name (inbound IAT, foreign DFI), identification number, and branch country code .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • RDFI name (outbound IAT, foreign DFI), identification number, and branch country

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: code .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Country code .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Currency code .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Foreign Exchange indicator.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Effective March 14, 2014, a Gateway must identify within an inbound IAT entry:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The ultimate foreign beneficiary of the funds transfer when the proceeds from a debit

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: inbound IAT entry are “for further credit to” an ultimate foreign beneficiary that is other

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: than the Originator of the debit IAT entry, or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The foreign party funding a credit inbound IAT entry when that party is not the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Originator of the credit IAT entry.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Refer to  www.nacha.org/c/IATIndustryInformation.cfm for more information on additional

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: data available to banks under the new IAT format.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Third -Party Service Providers

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: A third -party service provider (TPSP) is an entity other than an Originator , ODFI, or RDFI

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: that performs any functions on behalf of the Originator , the ODFI, or the RDFI with respect

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to the processing of ACH entries .  For example, a bank may hire a TPSP to conduct ACH

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: activities on behalf of the bank.213  NACHA operating rules  define TPSPs and relevant

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: subsets of TPSPs that include “Third- Party Senders” and “Sending Points.”214  A third -party

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 212 For convenience, this information is sometimes referred to as “Travel Rule” information, but as a technical

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: matter the funds transfer recordkeeping and travel rules at 31 CFR 1010.410(f)) do not apply to ACH

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions and NACHA operating rules have not changed.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 213 Third -party service provider is a generic term for any business that provides services to a bank.  A third -

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: party payment processor is a specific type of service provider that processes payments such as checks, ACH files, or credit and debit card messages o r files.  Refer to expanded overview section, “Third -Party Payment

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Processors,” page 234, for additional guidance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 214 When independent TPSPs contract with independent sales organizations or other third -party payment

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: processors, there may be two or more laye rs between the ODFI and the Originator.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Automated Clearing House Transactions — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  221 11/17/2014  sender  is a type of service provider that acts on behalf of an Originator (i.e., an intermediary

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: between the Originator and the ODFI).  For  example, a third -party sender may be a customer

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of the bank processing ACH transactions on behalf of an Originator.  In a third- party sender

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: arrangement, there is no contractual agreement between the ODFI and the Originator .  A

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: sending point is defined as  an entity that transmits entries to an ACH Ope rator on behalf of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: an ODFI.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The functions of these TPSPs can include, but are not limited to, the creation of ACH files on

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: behalf of the Originator or ODFI, or acting as a sending point of an ODFI (or receivi ng point

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: on behalf of an RDFI).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Risk Factors

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The ACH system was designed to transfer a high volume of low -dollar domestic transactions,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: which pose  lower  BSA/AML risks .  Nevertheless, the ability to send high -dollar and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: international transactions through the ACH may expose banks to higher BSA/AML risks .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Banks without a robust BSA/AML monitoring system may be exposed to additional risk

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: particularly when accounts are opened over the Internet without face -to-face contact.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: ACH transaction s that are originated through a TPSP (that is, whe n the Originator is not a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: direct customer of the ODFI) may increase BSA/AML risks, therefore, making it difficult for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: an ODFI to underwrite and review Originator transactions for compliance with BSA/AML rules.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 215 Risks are heightened when neither the TPSP nor the ODFI performs due diligence

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: on the companies for whom they are originating payments.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Certain ACH transactions, such as those originated through the Internet or the telephone,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: may be susceptible to man ipulation and fraudulent use .  Certain practices associated with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: how the banking industry processes ACH transactions may expose banks to BSA/AML risks .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: These practices include:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • An ODFI authorizing a TPSP to send ACH files directly to an ACH Operator , in essence

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bypassing the ODFI.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • ODFIs and RDFIs relying on each other to perform adequate due diligence on their

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: customers.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Batch processing that obscures the identities of originators.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Lack of sharing of information on or about originators and receivers inhibits a bank’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: ability to appropriately assess and manage the risk associated with correspondent and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: ACH processing operations, monitor for suspicious activity, and screen for OFAC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 215 A bank’s underwriting policy should define what information each application should contain.  The depth of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the review of an originator’s application should match the level of risk posed by the originator.  The

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: underwriting policy should require a background check of each originator to support the validity of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: business.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Automated Clearing House Transactions — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  222 11/17/2014  Risk Mitigation

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The BSA requires banks to have BSA/AML compliance  programs and appropriate policies,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: procedures, and processes in place to monitor and identify unusual activity, including ACH

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions .  Obtaining CDD information  in all operations  is an important mitigant of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML risk in ACH transactions .  Because of the nature of ACH transactions and the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reliance that ODFIs and RDFIs place on each other for OFAC reviews and other necessary due diligence information, it is essential that all parties have a strong CDD program for regular ACH customers .  For relation ships with TPSPs, CDD on the TPSP can be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: supplemented with due diligence on the principals associated with the TPSP and, as necessary, on the originators .  Adequate and effective CDD policies, procedures, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: processes are critical in detecting a pattern o f unusual and suspicious activities because the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: individual ACH transactions are typically not reviewed.  Equally important is an effective risk-based suspicious activity monitoring and reporting system .  In cases where a bank is

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: heavily reliant upon the TP SP, a bank may want to review the TPSP’s suspicious activity

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: monitoring and reporting program, either through its own or an independent inspection.  The ODFI may establish an agreement with the TPSP, which delineate s general TPSP guidelines,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: such as compli ance with ACH operating requirements and responsibilities and meeting other

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: applicable state and federal regulations .  Banks may need to consider controls to restrict or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: refuse ACH services to potential originators and receivers engaged in questionable or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: deceptive business practices.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: ACH transactions can be used in the layering and integration stages of money laundering .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Detecting unusual activity in the layering and integration stages can be a difficult task, because ACH may be used to legitimize frequen t and recurring transactions .  Banks should

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: consider the layering and integration stages of money laundering when evaluating or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: assessing the ACH transaction risks of a particular customer.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The ODFI should be aware of IAT activity and evaluate the activity  using a risk -based

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: approach in order to ensure that suspicious activity is identified and monitored.  The ODFI, if

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: frequently involved in IATs , may develop a separate process , which may be automated, for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reviewing IATs that minimizes disruption to general ACH processing, reconcilement, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: settlement.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The potentially higher risk inherent in IATs should be considered in the bank’s ACH policies, procedures, and processes .  The bank should consider its current and potential roles

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and responsibilities when developing internal controls to monitor and mitigate the risk

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: associated with IATs and to comply with the bank’s suspicious activity reporting obligations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In processing IATs, banks should consider the following:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Customers and transactions types and volume .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Third -party payment processor relationships .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Responsibilities, obligations, and risks of becoming a Gateway .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • CIP, CDD, and EDD standards and practices .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Suspicious activity monitoring and reporting .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Automated Clearing House Transactions — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  223 11/17/2014  • Appropriate MIS , including the potential necessity for sys tems upgrades or changes .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Processing procedures (e.g., identifying and handling IATs, resolving OFAC hits, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: handling noncompliant and rejected messages) .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Training programs for appropriate bank personnel (e.g., ACH personnel, operations, compliance audit , customer service, etc.) .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Legal agreements, including those with customers, third -party processors, and vendors,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and whether those agreements need to be upgraded or modified.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OFAC Screening

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: ACH transaction s may involve persons or parties that are subject to the  sanctions programs

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: administered by  OFAC .  (Refer to core overview section, “Office of Foreign Assets Control,”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: page  142, for additional guidance.)   OFAC has clarified its interpretation of the application of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: its rules for domestic and cross -border A CH transactions and provided more detailed

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: guidance on cross -border ACH.216

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: With respect to domestic ACH transactions, the ODFI is responsible for verifying that the Originator is not a blocked party and making a good faith effort to ascertain that the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Origi nator is not transmitting blocked funds .  The RDFI similarly is responsible for verifying

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: that the Receiver is not a blocked party .  In this way, the ODFI and the RDFI are relying on

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: each other for compliance with OFAC regulations .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: If an ODFI receives domestic  ACH transactions that its customer has already batched, the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: ODFI is not responsible for unbatching those transactions to ensure that no transactions violate OFAC’s regulations .  If an ODFI unbatches a file originally received from the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Originator in order to process “on- us” transactions, that ODFI is responsible for the OFAC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: compliance for the on -us transactions because it is acting as both the ODFI and the RDFI for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: those transactions .  ODFIs acting in this capacity should already know their custome rs for the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: purpose  of compliance with OFAC and other regulatory requirements .  For the residual

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: unbatched transactions in the file that are not "on- us," as well as those situations where banks

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: deal with unbatched ACH records for reasons other than to strip out the on- us transactions,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banks should determine the level of their OFAC risk and develop appropriate policies, procedures, and processes to address the associated risks .  Such policies might involve

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: screening each unbatched ACH record .  Similarly, bank s that have relationships with TPSP

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should assess the nature of those relationships and their related ACH transactions to ascertain the bank’s level of OFAC risk and to develop appropriate policies, procedures, and processes

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to mitigate that risk.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: With res pect to cross -border screening, similar but somewhat more stringent OFAC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: screening  obligations hold for IATs .  In the case of inbound IATs, and regardless of whether

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the OFAC flag in the IAT is set, a n RDFI is responsible for compliance with OFAC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: sanctions .  For outbound IATs , the ODFI should not rely on OFAC screening by a n RDFI

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: outside of the United States .  In these situations, the ODFI must exercise increased diligence

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to ensure  that illegal transactions are not processed.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 216 Refer to Interpretive Note 041214- FACRL -GN-02.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Automated Clearing House Transactions — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  224 11/17/2014  Due diligence for an inbound or outbound IAT may include screening the parties to a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transaction, as well as reviewing the details of the payment field information for an indication of  a sanctions violation, investigating the resulting hits, if any, and ultimately

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
