content: authority and control over such accounts in order to verify the customer ’s identity (the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: customer being  the business entity) .  Required account opening information may include

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: articles of incorporation, a corporate resolution by the directors authorizing the opening of the account, or the appointment of a person to act as a signatory for the entity on the a ccount .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Particular attention should be paid to articles of association that allow for nominee

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: shareholders, board members, and bearer shares.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: If the bank, through its trust or private banking departments, is facilitating the establishment

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of a business en tity for a new or existing customer, the money laundering risk to the bank is

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: typically mitigated .  Because the bank is aware of the parties ( e.g., grantors, beneficiaries,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and shareholders) involved in the business entity, initial due diligence and verification is

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: easier to obtain .  Furthermore, in such cases, the bank frequently has ongoing relationships

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: with the customers initiating the establishment of a business entity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Risk assessments may include a review of the domestic or international jurisd iction where

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the business entity was established, the type of account (or accounts) and expected versus actual transaction activities, the types of products used, and whether the business entity was created in -house or externally .  If ownership is held in bearer share form, banks should assess

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the risks these relationships pose and determine the appropriate controls .  For example, in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: most cases banks should choose to maintain (or have an independent third party  maintain )

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bearer shares for customers .  In rar e cases involving lower -risk, well -known, established

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: customers, banks may find that periodically recertifying beneficial ownership is effective.  The bank’ s risk assessment of a business entity customer becomes more important in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: complex corporate formatio ns.  For example, a foreign IBC may establish a layered series of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: business entities, with each entity naming its parent as its beneficiary.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Ongoing account monitoring is critical to ensure that the accounts are reviewed for unusual and suspicious activity .  The bank should be aware of higher -risk transactions in these

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Business Entities (Domestic and Foreign) — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  319 11/17/2014  accounts, such as activity that has no business or apparent lawful purpose, funds transfer

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: activity to and from higher -risk jurisdictions, currency intensive transactions, and frequent

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: changes  in the ownership or control of the nonpublic business entity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Business Entities (Domestic and Foreign) — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  320 11/17/2014  Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Business Entities (Domestic and Foreign)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the adequacy of the bank ’s systems to manage the risks associated with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions involving domestic and foreign business  entities, and management ’s ability to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: implement effective due diligence, monitoring, and reporting systems.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1. Review the bank ’s policies, procedures, and pr ocesses related to business  entities .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Evaluate the adequacy of the policies, procedures, and processes given the bank’ s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions with business  entities and the risks they present .  Assess whether the controls

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: are adequate to reasonably protect the ban k from money laundering and terrorist

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financing.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 2. Review the policies and processes for opening and monitoring accounts with business

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: entities .  Determine whether the policies adequately assess the risk between different

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: account types.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 3. Determine how t he bank identifies and, as necessary, completes additional due diligence

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: on business  entities .  Assess the level of due diligence the bank performs when

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: conducting its risk assessment.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 4. From  a review of MIS and internal risk rating factors, determine whether the bank

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: effectively identifies and monitors higher -risk business  entity accounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 5. Determine whether the bank ’s system for monitoring business  entities for suspicious

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: activities , and for reporting of suspicious activities, is adequate given the act ivities

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: associated with business  entities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 6. If appropriate, refer to the core examination procedures , “Office of Fo reign Assets

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Control,” page 152, for guidance .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Transaction Testing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 7. On the basis of the bank ’s risk assessment of its accounts with business  entities, as well

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: as prior examination and audit reports, select a sample of these accounts .  Include the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: following risk factors:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • An entity organized in a higher -risk jurisdiction.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Account activity that is substantially currency based.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • An entity w hose account activity consists primarily of circular -patterned funds

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transfers.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A business  entity whose ownership is in bearer shares , especially bearer shares  that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: are not under bank or trusted third- party control.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • An entity that uses a wide range of bank  services, particularly trust and correspondent

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: services.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Business Entities (Domestic and Foreign) — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  321 11/17/2014  • An entity owned or controlled by other nonpublic business  entities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Business  entities for which the bank has filed SARs.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 8. From the sample selected, obtain a relationship report for each selected a ccount .  It is

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: critical that the full relationship, rather than only an individual account, be reviewed.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 9. Review the due diligence information on the business  entity .  Assess the adequacy of that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: information.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 10. Review account statements and, as necessary, specific transaction details .  Compare

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: expected transactions with actual activity .  Determine whether actual activity is consistent

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: with the nature and stated purpose of the account and whether transactions appear

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: unusual or suspicious .  Areas that may  pose a higher  risk, such as funds transfers, private

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banking, trust, and monetary instruments, should be a primary focus of the transaction

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: review.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 11. On the basis of  examination procedures completed, including transaction testing, form a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: conclusion about the adequacy of policies, procedures, and processes associated with business  entity relationships.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Cash -Intensive Businesses — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  322 11/17/2014  Cash- Intensive Businesses — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the adequacy of the bank ’s systems to manage the risks associated with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: cash-intensive businesses and entities, and management ’s ability to implement effective due

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: diligence, monitoring, and reporting systems.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Cash -intensive businesses and entities cover various industry secto rs.  Most of these

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: businesses are conducting legitimate business; however, some aspects of these businesses

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: may be susceptible to money laundering or terrorist financing .  Common examples include,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: but are not limited to, the following:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Convenience stores.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Restaurants.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Retail stores.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Liquor stores.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Cigarette distributors.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Privately owned  automated teller machines (ATM ).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Vending machine operators.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Parking garages.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Risk Factors

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Some businesses and entities may be misused by money launderers to legitimize their  illicit

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: proceeds .  For example, a criminal may own a cash -intensive business, such as a restaurant,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and use it to launder currency from illicit criminal activities .  The restaurant ’s currency

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: deposits with its bank do not, on the surface, appear unusual because the business is legitimately a cash -generating entity .  However, the volume of currency in a restaurant used

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to launder money is  most likely be higher in comparison with similar restaurants in the area .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The nature of cash -intensive businesses and t he difficulty in identifying unusual activity may

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: cause these businesses to be considered higher  risk.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Risk Mitigation

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: When establishing and maintaining relationships with cash- intensive businesses, banks

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: should establish policies, procedures, and processe s to identify higher -risk relationships;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: assess AML risks; complete due diligence at account opening and periodically throughout the relationship; and include such relationships in appropriate monitoring for unusual or suspicious activity .  At the time of account opening, the bank should have an understanding

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of the customer ’s business operations; the intended use of the account; including anticipated

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transaction volume, products, and services used; and the geographic locations involved in the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: relationship.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: When conducting a risk assessment of cash- intensive businesses, banks should direct their

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: resources to those accounts that pose the greatest risk of money laundering or terrorist

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financing .  The following factors may be used to identify the risks:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Cash -Intensive Businesses — Overview

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  323 11/17/2014  • Purpose  of the account.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Volume, frequency, and nature of currency transactions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Customer history (e.g., length of relationship, CTR filings,300 and SAR filings).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Primary business activity, products, and services offered.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Business  or business structure.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Geographic l ocations and jurisdictions of operations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Availability of information and cooperation of the business in providing information.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: For those customers deemed to be particularly higher  risk, bank management may consider

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: implementing sound practices, such as periodic on -site visits, interviews with the business ’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: management, or closer reviews of transactional activity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 300 As discussed in the core overvi ew section, “Currency Transaction Reporting Exemptions ,” page 86 , certain

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: entities are ineligible for currency transaction reporting exemptions as a non- listed business.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Cash -Intensive Businesses — Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  324 11/17/2014  Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Cash -Intensive Businesses

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Objective.  Assess the adequacy of the bank ’s systems to manage the risks associated with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: cash-intensive businesses and entities, and management ’s ability to implement effective due

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: diligence, monitoring, and reporting systems.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1. Review the policies, procedures, and processes related to cash -intensive businesses .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Evaluate the adequacy of policies, procedures, and processes given the bank ’s cash -

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: intensive business activities in relation to the bank ’s cash -intensive business cus tomers

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and the risks that they represent .  Assess whether the  controls are adequate to reasonably

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: protect the bank from money laundering and terrorist financing.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 2. From  a review of MIS and internal risk rating factors, determine whether the bank

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: effectively identifies and monitors cash- intensive businesses and entities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 3. Determine whether the bank ’s system for monitoring cash- intensive businesses for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: suspicious activities, and for reporting of suspicious activities, is adequate given the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank’ s size, com plexity, location, and types of customer relationships.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 4. If appropriate, refer to the core examination procedures , “Office of Fo reign Assets

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Control,” page 152, for guidance .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Transaction Testing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 5. On the basis of the bank ’s risk assessment of its cash -intensive business and entity

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: relationships, as well as prior examination and audit reports, select a sample of cash -

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: intensive businesses .  As an a lternat ive, i dentify branches in the bank’s highest -risk areas

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or branches that ship/receive the most cash and request the largest sources and users of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: cash at those locations.  From the sample selected, perform the following examination

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: procedures:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Review account opening documentation including CIP information, if applicable, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: a sample of transaction act ivity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Determine whether actual account activity is consistent with anticipated account activity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Look for trends in the nature, size, or scope of the transactions, paying particular attention to currency transactions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Determine whether ongoing monitoring is sufficient to identify potentially suspicious activity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 6. On the basis of examination procedures completed, including transaction testing, form a conclusion about the adequacy of policies, procedures, and processes associated with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: cash-intensive businesse s and entities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix A: BSA Laws and Regulations

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  A–1 11/17/2014  Appendix A: BSA Laws and Regulations

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Statutes

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 12 USC 1829b, 12 USC 1951–1959, and 31 USC 5311, et seq.  — “ The Bank Secrecy Act ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 12 USC 1818(s) — “ Compliance with Monetary Record keeping and Report Requirements ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Requires that the appropriate f ederal banking agencies shall prescribe regulations requiring

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: insured depository institutions to establish and maintain procedures reasonably designed to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: assure and monitor the compliance of such depository institutions with the requirements of the BSA .  In addition, this section requires that each examination of an insured depository

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institution by the appropriate f ederal banking agency shall include a review of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: procedures, and that the r eport of examination shall describe any problem with the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: procedures maintained by the insured depository institution.  Finally, if the appropriate federal banking agency determines that an insured depository institution has either 1) failed

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to establish an d maintain procedures  that are reasonably designed to assure and monitor the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institution’s compliance with the BSA ; or 2) failed to correct any problem with the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: procedures that a report of examination or other written supervisory communication identifies a s requiring communication to the institution’s board of directors or senior

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: management as a matter that must be corrected,  the agency shall issue an order requiring

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: such depository institution to cease and desist from the violation of the statute and the regulations prescribed thereunder .  Sections 1818(b)(3) and (b)(4) of Title 12 of the USC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: extend section 1818(s) beyond insured depository institutions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 12 USC 1786(q) — “ Compliance with Monetary Recordkeeping and Report Requirements ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Requires that the NCUA  Board prescribe regulations requiring insured credit unions to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: establish and maintain procedures reasonably designed to assure and monitor the compliance of such credit unions with the requirements of the BSA .  In addition, this section requires the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: NCUA Board to examine and enforce BSA requirements.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Regulations

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: U.S. Treasury/FinCEN

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR Parts 1000- 1099 — “ Financial Recordkeeping and Reporting of Currency and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Foreign Transactions ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth FinCEN regulations that promulgate the BSA .  Select provisions are described

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: below.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1010.100 — “ Meaning of Terms ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the definitions used throughout 31 CFR Part 103.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1025.320 — “ Reports by Insurance Companies of Suspicious Transactions ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the requirements for insurance companies to report suspicious  transaction s of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: $5,000 or more .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1020.320 — “ Reports by Banks of Suspicious Transactions ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the requirements for banks to report suspicious transactions involving or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: aggregating  $5,000 or more.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix A: BSA Laws and Regulations

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  A–2 11/17/2014  31 CFR 1010.311 — “ Reports of  Transactions in Currency ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the requirements for financial institutions to report currency transactions in excess

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of $10,000.  Includes 31 CFR 103.22(d) — “ Transactions of Exempt Persons,”  which sets

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: forth the requirements for financial institutions to exempt transactions of certain persons

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: from currency transaction reporting requirements.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1010.340 — “ Reports of Transportation of Currency or Monetary Instruments ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the requirements for filing a Report of International Transportation of Currency or Monetary Instruments (CMIR) .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1010.350 — “ Reports of Foreign Financial Accounts ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the requirement that each person having a financial interest in, or signature or other

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: authority over, a financial account in a foreign country must file a report with the IRS

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: annually.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1010.306 — “ Filing of Reports ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the f iling and recordkeeping requirements for CTRs , CMIRs,  and Report of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Foreign Bank and Financial Accounts ( FBAR ).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1010.312 — “ Identification Required ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the requirement that financial institutions verify the identity of persons conducting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: currency transactions in excess of $10,000.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1010.415 — “ Purchases of Bank Checks and Drafts, Cashier ’s Checks, Money

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Orders and  Traveler ’s Checks ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the requirements that financial institutions maintain records relating to purchases

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of monetary instruments with currency in amounts between $3,000 and $10,000, inclusive .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1010.420 — “ Records to Be Made and Retained by  Persons Having Financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Interests in Foreign Financial Accounts ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the requirement that persons having a financial interest in, or signature or other

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: authority over, financial account in a foreign country maintain records relating to foreign

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial bank accounts reported on an FBAR.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1020.410 — “ Records to Be Made and Retained by Financial Institutions ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth recordkeeping and retrieval requirements for financial institutions, including funds

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transfer recordkeeping and transmittal requirements.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1020.410 — “ Additional Records to Be Made and Retained by Banks ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth additional  recordkeeping requirements for banks.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1010.430 — “ Nature of Records and Retention Period”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth acceptable forms of records required t o be kept and establishes a five -year record -

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: retention requirement .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1022.380 — “ Registration of Money Services Businesses ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the r equirements  for money services businesses to register with the U.S.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Treasury/FinCEN.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix A: BSA Laws and Regulations

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  A–3 11/17/2014  31 CFR 1010.820 — “ Civil Penalty ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth potential civil penalties for willful or negligent violations of 31 CFR Part 103 .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1010.840 — “ Criminal Penalty ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth potential criminal penalties for willful violations of 31 CFR Part 103 .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1010.314 — “ Structured Transactions ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Prohibits the structuring of transactions to avoid currency  transaction  reporting requirement .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1010.520 — “ Information Sharing Between Federal Law Enforcement Agencies and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Financial Institutions ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Establishes procedures for information sharing between f ederal law enforcement authorities

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and financial institutions to deter terrorist activity  and money laundering .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1010.540 — “ Voluntary Information Sharing Among Financial Institutions ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Establishes procedures for voluntary information sharing among financial institutions to deter

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: terrorist activity  and money laundering .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1020.100 — “ Anti-Money Laundering Program Requirements for Financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Institutions Regulated by a Federal Functional Regulator or a Self -Regulatory Organization,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and Casinos ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Establishes, in part, the standard that a financial institution regulated only by a federal

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: functional regulator satisfies statutory requirements to establish an AML program if the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial institution complies with the regulations of its f ederal functional regulator

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: governing such programs .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1020.100 — “ Customer Identification Programs for Banks, Savings Associations,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Credit Unions, and Certain Non- Federally Regulated Banks ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the requirement for  banks, savings associations, cr edit unions, and certain non-

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: federally regulated banks to implement a written Customer Identification Program.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1025.100 — “ Anti-Money Laundering Programs for Insurance Companies ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the requirement for insurance companies that issue or under write “covered

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: products” to develop and implement a written AML program that is reasonably designed to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: prevent the insurance company from being used to facilitate money laundering or financing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of terrorist activity .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1010.610 — “ Due Diligence Programs for Correspondent Accounts for Foreign

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Financial Institutions ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the requirement for certain financial institutions to  establish and apply a due

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: diligence program that includes appropriate, specific, risk- based, and, whe re necessary,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: enhanced policies , procedures , and controls  that are reasonably designed to enable the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial institution  to detect and report known or suspected money laundering activity

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: conducted through or involving any correspondent account established, m aintained,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: administered, or managed by the financial institution in the United States for a foreign financial institution.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1010.630 — “ Prohibition on Correspondent Accounts for Foreign Shell Banks;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Records Concerning Owners of Foreign Banks and Agents for Service of Legal Process ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix A: BSA Laws and Regulations

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  A–4 11/17/2014  Prohibits a covered financial institution from establishing , maintaining, administering, or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: managing  a correspondent account in the United States for or on behalf of  a foreign shell

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank, and requires the financial institution to maintain records identifying the owners of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: foreign financial institutions  and regarding a person resident in the United States who is

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: authorized to and has agreed to be an agent to receive service of legal process .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1010.620 — “ Due Diligence P rograms for Private Banking Accounts ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the requirement for certain f inancial institutions to  establish and maintain a due

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: diligence program that includes policies, procedures, and controls that are reasonably designed to detect and report any known or suspected money laundering or suspicious activity conducted through or involving any private banking account that is established,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: maintained, administered, or managed in the United States for a non- U.S. person.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 31 CFR 1010.670 — “ Summons or Subpoena of Foreign Bank Records; Termination of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Correspondent Relationship”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Requires a financial institution to provide foreign financial institution records upon the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: request of an appropriate law enforcement official and to terminate a correspondent

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: relationship with a foreign financial institution  upon receipt of written notice from the U.S.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Secretary of the Treasury or the U.S. Attorney General .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: “Certification Regarding Correspondent Accounts for Foreign Banks ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Voluntary certification form  to be obtained by a bank that establishes, maintains , administers,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or manages  a correspondent account in the United States for or on behalf of  a foreign  bank.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Form  is available on FinCEN W eb site

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: “Recertification Regarding Correspondent Accounts for Foreign Banks ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Voluntary  re-certification form to be obtained by  a bank that establishes, maintains,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: administers, or manages a correspondent account in the United States for or on behalf of  a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: foreign bank.  Form  is available on  the FinCEN W eb site.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Regulation H — 12 CFR 208.62 — “ Suspicious Activity Reports ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the requirements for state member banks for filing a SAR with the appropriate

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: federal law enforcement agencies and the U.S. Treasury.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Regulation H — 12 CFR 208.63 — “ Procedures for Monitoring Bank Secrecy Act

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Compliance ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the requirements for state member banks to establish and maintain procedures to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: ensure and monitor their compliance with the BSA.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Regulation K — 12 CFR 211.5(k) — “ Reports by Edge and Agreement Corporations of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Crimes and Suspected Crimes ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the requirements for an Edge and agreement corporation, or any branch or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: subsidiary thereof, to file a SA R with the appropriate federal law enforcement agencies and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the U.S. Treasury.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Regulation K — 12 CFR 211.5(m) — “ Procedures for Monitoring Bank Secrecy Act

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Compliance ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix A: BSA Laws and Regulations

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  A–5 11/17/2014  Sets for th the requirements for an Edge and agreement corporation to establish and maintain

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: procedures reasonably designed to ensure and monitor compliance with the BSA and related

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: regulations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Regulation K — 12 CFR 211.24(f) — “ Reports of Crimes and Suspected Crimes ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the requirements for an uninsured branch, an agency, or a repre sentative office of a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: foreign financial institution operating in the United States to file a SAR with the appropriate

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: federal law enforcement agencies and the U.S. Treasury.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Regulation K — 12 CFR 211.24(j) — “ Procedures for Monitoring Bank Secrecy Act

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Compliance”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the requirements for an uninsured branch, an agency, or a representative office of a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: foreign financial institution operating in the United States to establish and maintain procedures reasonably designed to ensure and monitor compliance w ith the BSA and related

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: regulations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Regulation Y  — 12 CFR 225.4(f)  — “ Suspicious Activity Report ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the requirements for a bank holding company or any nonbank subsidiary thereof,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or a foreign bank  that is subject to the Bank Holding Company Act or any nonbank

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: subsidiary of such a foreign bank operating in the United States , to file a SAR with the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: appropriate federal law enforcement agencies and the U.S. Treasury.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 12 CFR 326 Subpart B — “Procedures for Monitori ng Bank Secrecy Act Compliance”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth requirements for state nonmember banks to establish and maintain procedures to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: ensure and monitor their compliance with the BSA.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 12 CFR 353 — “ Suspicious Activity Reports ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Establishes requirements for state nonmem ber banks to file a SAR when they detect a known

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or suspected violation of federal law, a suspicious transaction relating to a money laundering

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: activity, or a violation of the BSA.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: National Credit Union Administration

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 12 CFR 748 — “ Security Program, Report  of Crime and Catastrophic Act and Bank Secrecy

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Act Compliance ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Requires federally insured credit unions to maintain security programs and comply with the BSA.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 12 CFR 748.1 — “ Filing of Reports ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Requires federally insured credit unions to file compliance and Suspicious Activity Reports .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 12 CFR 748.2 — “ Procedures for Monitoring Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) Compliance ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Ensures that all federal ly insured credit unions establish and maintain procedures rea sonably

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: designed to assure and monitor compliance with the recordkeeping and reporting requirements in the BSA.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix A: BSA Laws and Regulations

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  A–6 11/17/2014  Office of the Comptroller of the Currency

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Effective July 21, 2011, the Office of Thrift Supervision was integrated into the Office of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Comptr oller of the Currency.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 12 CFR 21.11 — “ Suspicious Activity Report ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Ensures that national banks file a Suspicious Activity Report when they detect a known or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: suspected violation of f ederal  law or a suspicious transaction related  to a money laundering

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: activi ty or a violation of the BSA .  This section applies to all national banks as well as any

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: federal  branches and agencies of foreign financial banks  licensed or chartered by the OCC.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 12 CFR 163.180 — “Suspicious Activity Reports and Other Reports and Statements”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Sets forth the rules for savings associations or service corporations for filing a SAR with the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: appropriate federal law enforcement agencies and the U.S. Treasury.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 12 CFR 21.21 — “ Procedures for Monitoring Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) Compliance ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Requires al l national banks and savings associations to establish and maintain procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reasonably designed to assure  and monitor their compliance with the requirements of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: subchapter II of chapter 53 of title 31, United States Code, and the implementing regulations

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: promulgated thereunder by the U.S. Department of the Treasury at 31 CFR Chapter X

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (formerly 31 CFR part 103) .  Effective June 16, 2014, the OCC amended 12 CFR 21.21 to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: make it applicable to both national banks and savings associations and rescinded 12 CFR

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 163.177 (refer to 79 Fed. Reg.  95, May 16, 2014) ,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix B: BSA/AML Directives

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  B–1 11/17/2014  Appendix B: BSA/AML Directives

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Supervision and Regulation Letters, commonly known as SR Letters, address significant

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: policy and procedural matters related to the Federal Reserve System ’s supervisory

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: responsibilities .  Issued by the Board of Governors ’ Division of Banking Supervision and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Regulation, SR Letters are an important means of disseminating information to banking supervision staff at the Board of Governors and the Reserve Banks and, in some instances, to supervised banking organizations .  The applicable BSA/AML SR Letters are available on

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Federal Reserve W eb site

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Financial Institution Letters (FIL) are addressed to the chief executive officers of the financial institutions on the FIL s distribution list — generally, FDIC -supervised banks .  FILs

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: may announce new regulations and policies, new FDIC publications, and a variety of other

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: matters of principal interest to those responsible for operating a bank or savings  association .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The applicable FILs are available on the FDIC W eb site

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: National Credit Union Administration

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: NCUA publishes Letters to Credit Unions (LCU) and Regulatory Alerts (RA) addressed to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: credit union boards of directors .  LCUs and RAs are used to share information, announce

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: new policies, and provide guidance for credit unions and credit union examination staf f.  The

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: NCUA’ s Examiner ’s Guide provides overall guidance for the risk- focused examination and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: supervision of federally insured credit unions .  NCUA’ s risk -focused program evaluates the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: degree to which credit union management identifies, measures, monitors , and controls (i.e.,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: manages) existing and potential risks in their operations, including risk associated with AML programs .  Applicable sections of the Examiner ’s Guide are available on the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: NCUA W eb

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: site.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OCC Alerts are issuances published with special urgency to notify bankers and examiners of matters of pressing concern, often suspicious or illegal banking practices .  OCC Bulletins and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Advisory Letters contain information of continuing importance to bankers and examiners .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Bulletins and Advisory Letters remain in effect until revised or rescinded .  Specific

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML OCC Alerts, Bulletins, and Advisory Letters are available on the OCC W eb site

content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  C–2 11/17/2014  U.S. Government

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Interagency U.S. Money Laundering Threat Assessment  (MLTA) (December 2005)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The MLTA is a government -wide analysis of money laundering in the United States .  The

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: MLTA offers a detailed analysis of money laundering methods, ranging f rom well-

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: established techniques for integrating dirty money into the financial system to modern

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: innovations that exploit global payment networks as well as the Internet .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: International Narcotics Control  Reports  (INCSR) (Annually)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The International Narcotics Control Strategy Report offers a comprehensive assessment of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the efforts of foreign governments to reduce illicit narcotics production, trafficking and use, in keeping with their international obligations under UN treaties. The Report also describes the efforts of the 65 Major Money Laundering Countries to implement strong anti -money

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: laundering and counterterrorist financing regimes. The Report is updated in March of each year.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: National Strategy for Counterterrorism

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The National Strategy for Counterterrorism articulates the U.S. Government’s approach to countering terrorism and identifies the range of tools critical to this Strategy’s success . The

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Strategy builds on groundwork laid by previous strategies and many aspects of the U. S. Government’s enduring approach to countering terrorism .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Financial Crimes Enforcement Network

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The FinCEN  Web site

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: includes , among a range of other material and information,  the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: following:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • BSA Statutory Material, BSA Regulations, and Federal Register  Notices — Links to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: legislation and regulations, as well as to proposed regulations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • BSA E -Filing System — Links to the BSA E -Filing System, FinCEN’s secure network to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: facilitate electronic filing  of Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) reports  (either individually or in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: batches ) and corresponding filing instructions .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • BSA Guidance — Fi nCEN issues interpretations of BSA regulations as well as  guidance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to financial institutions on complying with the same.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Reports — FinCEN periodically initiates and develops reports and publications covering

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: AML issues, including the SAR Activity Review.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Advisories — FinCEN issues  advisories  to financial institutions concerning money

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: laundering or terrorist financing threats and vulnerabilities , for the purpose of enabling

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial institutions to guard against such threats .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Enforcement actions — FinCEN is sues releases involving the assessment of civil money

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: penalties against financial institutions for systemic noncompliance with the BSA.

content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  C–3 11/17/2014  Basel Committee on Banking Supervision (BCBS)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The Basel Committee on Banking Supervision provides a forum for regular c ooperation on

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banking supervisory matters. Its objective is to enhance understanding of key supervisory

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: issues and improve the quality of banking supervision worldwide.  It circulates to supervisors

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: throughout the world both published and unpublished paper s providing guidance on banking

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: supervisory matters.

content: NACHA — The Electronic Payments Association (NACHA)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: NACHA is the administrator of the Automated Clearing House (ACH) Network. The ACH

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Network is a payment system that allows for direct consumer, business and government payments. The ACH Network is governed by the NACHA Operating Rules, which provides

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the le gal foundation for the exchange of ACH and IAT payments.

content: The Wolfsberg Group

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The Wolfsberg Group is an association of eleven global banks, whose objective is  to develop

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial services industry standards and guidance related to Anti -Money Laundering and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Counter Terrorist Financing policies.  The standards and guidance are intended to provide

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: general assistance to industry participants and regulatory bodies to shape their own policies

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and guidance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix D: Statutory Definition of Financial Institution

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  D–1 11/17/2014  Appendix D: Statutory Definition of Financial Institution

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: As defined in the BSA 31 USC 5312(a)(2),  the term “ financial institution ” includes the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: following:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • An insured bank (as defined in section 3(h) of the FDI Act (12 USC 1813(h))).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A commercial bank or trust company.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A private banker.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • An agency or branch of a foreign bank in the United Sta tes.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Any credit union.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A thrift institution.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A broker or dealer registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission under the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (15 USC 78a et seq.).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A broker or dealer in securities or commodities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • An investment banker or investment company.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A currency exchange.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • An issuer, redeemer, or cashier of traveler ’s checks, checks, money orders, or similar

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: instruments.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • An operator of a credit card system.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • An insurance company.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A dealer in precious metals, stones, or jewels.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A pawnbr oker.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A loan or finance company.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A travel agency.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A licensed sender of money or any other person who engages as a business in the transmission of funds, including any person who engages as a business in an informal money transfer system or any network of people who engage as a business in facilitating the transfer of money domestically or internationally outside of the conventional financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institutions system.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A telegraph company.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A business engaged in vehicle sales, including automobile, airplane, and boat sales.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Persons involved in real estate closings and settlements.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The U.S.  Postal Service.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix D: Statutory Definition of Financial Institution

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  D–2 11/17/2014  • An agency of the United States government or of a state or local government carrying out

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: a duty or power of a business described in this paragraph.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A casino, gamb ling casino, or gaming establishment with an annual gaming revenue of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: more than $1 million  that —

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Is licensed as a casino, gambling casino, or gaming establishment under the laws of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: any state or any political subdivision of any state ; or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Is an Indian gaming operation conducted under or pursuant to the Indian Gaming

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Regulatory Act other than an operation that is limited to class I gaming (as defined in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: section 4(6) of such act).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Any business or agency that  engages in any activity which the Secretary of the Treasury

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: determines, by regulation, to be an activity that is similar to, related to, or a substitute for any activity in which any business described in this paragraph is authorized to engage.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Any other business designated by the Secretar y whose c urrency  transactions have a high

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: degree of usefulness in criminal, tax, or regulatory matters.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Any futures commission merchant, commodity trading advisor, or commodity pool

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: operator registered, or required to register, under the Commodity Exchange  Act (7 USC

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 1, et seq. ).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix E: International Organizations

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  E–1 11/17/2014  Appendix E: International Organizations

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Money laundering and terrorist financing can have a wi despread international impact .
