name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Money launderers have been found to transfer funds and maintain assets on a global level,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: which makes tracing funds through various countries a complex and challenging process .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Most countries support the fight against money  laundering and terrorist funding; however,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: because of the challenges in creating consistent laws or regulations between countries, international groups have developed model recommendations for governments and financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institutions .  Two key international  bodies in this area follow :

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The Financial Action Task Force on Money Laundering (FATF)  is an

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: intergovernmental body established to set standards and promote implementation of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: legal, regulatory and operational measures to combat money laundering , terrorist

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financing  and other threats to the international financial system.  The FATF has

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: developed a series of recommendations on various money laundering and terrorist

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financing issues .  First  published in 1990, the FATF Recommendations are frequently

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: revised to  ensure they remain up to date and relevant.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The Basel Committee on Banking Supervision  is a committee of central banks and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank supervisors and regulators from numerous jurisdictions  that meets at the Bank for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: International Settlements (BIS) in Basel, Sw itzerland, to discuss issues related to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: prudential banking supervision.  The Basel Committee formulates broad standards and guidelines and makes recommendations regarding sound practices, including those on customer due diligence.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In addition, other global  organizations are becoming increasingly involved in combating

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: money laundering .  The International Monetary Fund (IMF) and the World Bank have

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: integrated  AML and counter -terrorist financing issues into their financial sector assessments,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: surveillance, and  diagnostic activities .  Furthermore, various FATF -style regional bodies

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: exist .  These groups participate as observers in FATF meetings; assess their members against

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the FATF standards; and, like FATF members, frequently provide input to the IMF  and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: World Bank assessment program.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 301 Another well -known FATF initiative is related to high risk and noncooperative countr ies.  FATF identifies

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and issues public statements on jurisdictions that are subject to countermeasures, and jurisdictions with AML

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: deficiencies that have not made progress in addressing the deficiencies or have not committed to an action plan

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to address t he deficiencies.  The public statements can be found at the FATF Web site .  FinCEN  issues

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: corresponding guidance to banks operating in the United States of the money laundering and terrorist financing risks associated with jurisdictions identified by the FATF .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix F: Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing “Red Flags”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  F–1 11/17/2014  Appendix F : Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing “ Red

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Flags ”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The following are examples of potentially suspic ious activities, or “ red flags ” for both money

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: laundering and terrorist financing .  Although these lists are not all- inclusive, they may help

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banks and examiners recognize possible money laundering and terrorist financing schemes .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN issues advisories containing examples of “red flags” to inform and assist banks in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reporting instances of suspected money laundering, terrorist financing, and fraud.  In order to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: assist law enforcement in its efforts to target these activities, FinC EN requests that banks

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: check the appropriate box(es) in the Suspicious Activity Information section and include certain key terms in the narrative section of the SAR.  The advisories and guidance can be found on FinCEN W eb site.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 302  Management ’s primary focu s should be on reporting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: suspicious activities, rather than on determining whether the transactions are in fact linked to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: money laundering, terrorist financing, or a particular crime.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The following examples are red flags that, when encountered, may warrant  additional

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: scrutiny .  The mere presence of a red flag is not by itself evidence of criminal activity .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Closer scrutiny should help to determine whether the activity is suspicious or one for which there does not appear to be a reasonable business or legal purpose.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Potentially Suspicious Activity That May Indicate Money Laundering

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Customers Who Provide Insufficient or Suspicious Information

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A customer uses unusual or suspicious identification documents that cannot be readily

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: verified.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A customer provides an individual tax payer  identification number  after having previously

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: used a Social Security number .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A customer uses different tax payer  identification numbers with variations of his or her

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: name.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A business is reluctant, when establishing a new account, to provide complete

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: information about the nature and purpose of its business, anticipated account activity,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: prior banking relationships, the names of its officers and directors, or information on its

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: business location.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A customer ’s home or business telephone is disconnected.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The customer ’s background differs from that which would be expected on the basis of  his

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or her business activities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A customer makes frequent or large transactions and has no record of past or present

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: employment experience.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A customer is a tru st, shell company, or Private Investment Company that is reluctant to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: provide information on controlling parties and underlying beneficiaries .  Beneficial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 302 Refer to SAR Advisory Key Terms .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix F: Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing “Red Flags”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  F–2 11/17/2014  owners may hire nominee incorporation services to establish shell companies and open

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank accounts for those shell companies while shielding the owner ’s identity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Efforts to Avoid Reporting or Recordkeeping Requirement

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A customer or group tries to persuade a bank employee not to file required reports or maintain required records.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A customer is reluctant t o provide information needed to file a mandatory report, to have

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the report filed , or to proceed with a transaction after being informed that the report must

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: be filed .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A customer is reluctant to furnish identification when purchasing negotiable instruments

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: in recordable amounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A business or customer asks to be exempted from reporting or recordkeeping

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirements.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A person customarily uses the automated teller machine to make several bank deposits

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: below a specified threshold.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A customer deposits funds into several accounts, usually in amounts of less than $3,000,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: which are subsequently consolidated into a master account and transferred outside of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: country, particularly to or through a location of specific concern (e.g., countries

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: designated by national authorities and Financial Action Task Force on Money

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Laundering (FATF) as noncooperative countries and territories).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A customer accesses a safe deposit box after completing a transaction involving a large

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: withdrawal of currency, or accesses a safe depos it box before making currency deposits

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: structured at or just under $10,000, to evade CTR  filing requirements.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Funds Transfers

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Many funds transfers are sent in large, round dollar, hundred dollar, or thousand dollar

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: amounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Funds transfer activity occurs t o or from a financial secrecy haven, or to or from a higher -

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: risk geographic location without an apparent business reason or when the activity is

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: inconsistent with the customer ’s business or history.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Funds transfer activity occurs to or from a financial ins titution located in a higher risk

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: jurisdiction distant from the customer’s operations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Many small, incoming transfers of funds are received, or deposits are made using checks

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and money orders .  Almost immediately, all or most of the transfers or deposits are wired

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: to another city or country in a manner inconsistent with the customer ’s business or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: history.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Large, incoming funds transfers are received on behalf of a foreign client, with little or no explicit reason.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Funds transfer activity is unexplained, re petitive, or shows unusual patterns.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix F: Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing “Red Flags”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  F–3 11/17/2014  • Payments or receipts with no apparent links to legitimate contracts, goods, or services are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: received.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Funds transfers are sent or received from the same person to or from different accounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Funds transfers contain limi ted content and lack related party information.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Automated Clearing House Transactions

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Large -value, automated clearing house ( ACH)  transactions are frequently initiated

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: through third- party service providers (TPSP) by originators that are not bank customers

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and for which the bank has no or insufficient due diligence.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • TPSPs have a history of violating ACH network rules or generating illegal transactions, or processing manipulated or fraudulent transactions on behalf of their customers.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Multiple layers of TPSPs  that appear to be unnecessarily involved in transactions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Unusually high level of transactions initiated over the Internet or by telephone.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • NACHA — The Electronic Payments  Association ( NACHA)  information requests

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: indicate potential concerns with the bank’s usage of the ACH system.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Activity Inconsistent with the Customer ’s Business

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The currency transaction patterns of a business show a sudden change inconsistent with normal activities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A large volume of cashier ’s checks, money orders, or funds transfers i s deposited into, or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: purchased through, an account when the nature of the accountholder ’s business would not

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: appear to justify such activity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A retail business has dramatically different patterns of currency deposits from similar businesses in the same gen eral location.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Unusual transfers of funds occur among related accounts or among accounts that involve the same or related principals.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The owner of both a retail business and a check- cashing service does not ask for currency

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: when depositing checks, possibly  indicating the availability of another source of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: currency.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Goods or services purchased by the business do not match the customer ’s stated line of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: business.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Payments for goods or services ar e made by checks, money orders, or bank drafts not

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: drawn from the account of the entity that made the purchase.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Lending Activit y

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Loans secured by  pledge d assets held by third parties  unrelated to the borrower .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Loan secured by deposits or other readily marketable assets, such as securities,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: particularly when owned by appa rently unrelated third parties .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix F: Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing “Red Flags”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  F–4 11/17/2014  • Borrower defaults on a cash -secured loan or any loan that is secured by assets that  are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: readily convertible into c urrency .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Loans are made for, or are paid on behalf of, a third party with no reasonable explanation.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • To secure a loan, the customer purchases a certificate of deposit using an unknown

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: source of funds, particularly when funds are provided via currency or multiple monetary

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: instruments.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Loans that lack a legitimate business purpose, provide the bank with significant fees for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: assuming little or no risk, or tend to obscure the movement of funds (e.g., loans made to a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: borrower and immediately sold to an entity  related to the borrower).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Changes in Bank- to-Bank Transactions

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The size and frequency of currency deposits incre ases rapidly with no corresponding

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: increase in noncurrency deposits.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A bank is unable to track the true accountholder of correspondent or concentration

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: account transactions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The turnover in large -denomination bills is significant and appears uncharacteristic, given

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the bank’ s location.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Changes in currency -shipment patterns between correspondent banks are significant.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Cross -Border Financial  Institution Transactions

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • U.S. bank increases sales or exchanges of large denomination U.S. bank notes to Mexican financial institution(s).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Large volumes of small denomination U .S. banknotes being sent from  Mexican casas  de

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: cambio to their U.S. accounts via armored transport or sold directly to U.S. banks .  These

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: sales or exchanges may involve jurisdictions outside of Mexico.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Casas de cambio direct the remittance of funds via multiple funds transfers to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: jurisdictions outside of Mexico that bear no apparent business relationship with the casa s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: de cambio .  Funds transfer recipients may include individuals, businesses, and other

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: entities in free trade zones.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Casas de cambio deposit numerous third- party items, including sequentially numbered

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: monetary instruments, to their accounts at U.S. banks.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Casas de cambio direct the remittance of funds transfers from their accounts at Mexican financial institutions to accounts at U.S. banks .  These funds transfers follow the deposit

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of currency and third -party items by the casas de cambio into their Mexican financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institution.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Bulk Currency Shipments

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • An increase in the sale of large denomination U.S. bank notes to foreign financial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institutions by U.S. banks.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix F: Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing “Red Flags”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  F–5 11/17/2014  • Large volumes of small denomination U.S. bank notes being sent from foreign nonbank

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial institutions to their accounts in the United States via armored transport, or sold

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: directly to U.S. banks.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Multiple wire transfers initiated by foreign nonbank financial institutions that direct U.S.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banks to remit funds to other jurisdictions that bear no apparent business relationship with that foreign nonbank financial institution.  R ecipients may include individuals,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: businesses, and other entities in free trade zones and other locations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The exchange of small denomination U.S. bank notes for large denomination U.S. bank notes that may be sent to foreign countries.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Deposits by foreign nonbank financial institutions to their accounts at U.S. banks that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: include third- party items , including sequentially numbered monetary instruments.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Deposits of currency and third- party items by foreign nonbank financial institutions to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: their accounts at f oreign financial institutions and thereafter direct wire transfers to the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: foreign nonbank financial institution’s accounts at U.S. banks.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Trade Finance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Items shipped that are inconsistent with the nature of the customer’s business

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (e.g., a steel company t hat starts dealing in paper products, or an information technology

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: company that starts dealing in bulk pharmaceuticals).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Customers conducting business in higher -risk jurisdictions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Customers shipping items through higher -risk jurisdictions , including trans it through

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: noncooperative countries.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Customers involved in potentially higher -risk activities , including activities  that may be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: subject to export/import restrictions (e.g., equipment for military or police organizations

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of foreign governments, weapons, amm unition, chemical mixtures, classified defense

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: articles, sensitive technical data, nuclear materials, precious gems, or certain natural

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: resources such as metals, ore, and crude oil).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Obvious over - or under -pricing of goods and services.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Obvious misrepresentation of quantity or type of goods imported or exported.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Transaction structure appears unnecessarily complex and designed to obscure the true

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: nature of the transaction.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Customer requests payment of proceeds to an unrelated third party.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Shipment locations or description of goods not consistent with letter of credit.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Significantly amended letters of credit without reasonable justification or changes to the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: beneficiary or location of payment .  Any changes in the names of parties should prompt

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: additional OFAC review.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix F: Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing “Red Flags”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  F–6 11/17/2014  Privately  Owned Automated Teller Machines

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Automated teller machine ( ATM ) activity levels are high in comparison with other

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: privately  owned or bank- owned ATMs in comparable geographic and demographic

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: locations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Sources of currency for the ATM cannot  be identified or confirmed through withdrawals

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: from account, armored car contracts, lending arrangements, or other appropriate

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: documentation.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Insurance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A customer purchases products with termination features without concern for the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: product ’s investment pe rformance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A customer purchases insurance products using a single, large premium payment,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: particularly when payment is made through unusual methods such as currency or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: currency equivalents.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A customer purchases  a product that appears outside the customer ’s normal range of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial wealth or estate planning needs.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A customer borrows against the cash surrender value of permanent life insurance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: policies, particularly when payments are made to apparently unrelated third parties.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Policies are purchased that all ow for the transfer of beneficial ownership interests without

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the knowledge and consent of the insurance issuer .  This would include secondhand

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: endowment and bearer insurance policies.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A customer is known to purchase several insurance products and uses the  proceeds from

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: an early policy surrender to purchase other financial assets.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A customer uses multiple currency equivalents (e.g., cashier’s checks and money orders)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: from different banks and money services businesses to make insurance policy or annuity

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: paym ents.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Shell Company Activity

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A bank is unable to obtain sufficient information or information is unavailable to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: positively identify originators or beneficiaries of accounts or other banking activity

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (using Internet, commercial database searches, or direct inquiries to a respondent bank).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Payments to or from the company have no stated purpose, do not reference goods or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: services, or identify only a contract or invoice number.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Goods or services, if identified, do not match profile of company provided by respondent

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank or character of the financial activity; a company references remarkably dissimilar

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: goods and services in related funds transfers; explanation given by foreign respondent

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank is inconsistent with observed funds transfer activity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Transacting busi nesses share the same address, provide only a registered agent ’s address,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or have other address inconsistencies.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix F: Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing “Red Flags”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  F–7 11/17/2014  • Unusually large number and variety of beneficiaries are receiving funds transfers from

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: one company.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Frequent involvement of multiple jurisdictions or beneficiaries located in higher -risk

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: offshore financial centers.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A foreign correspondent bank exceeds the expected volume in its client profile for funds

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transfers, or an individual company exhibits a high volume and pattern of funds transfers

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: that is inconsistent with its normal business activity .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Multiple high -value payments or transfers between shell companies with no apparent

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: legitimate business purpose.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Purpose of the shell company is unknown or unclear.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Embassy and Foreign Consulate Accounts

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Official embassy business is conducted through personal accounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Account activity is not consistent with the purpose of the account, such as pouch activity

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or payable upon proper identification transactions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Accounts are funded through substantial currency transactions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Accounts directly fund personal expenses of foreign nationals without appropriate controls, including, but not limited to, expenses for college students.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Employees

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Employee exhibits a lavish lifestyle that cannot be supported by his or her sa lary.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Employee fails to conform to recognized policies, procedures, and processes, particularly

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: in private banking.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Employee is reluctant to take a vacation

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Employee overrides a hold placed on an account identified as suspicious so that transactions can occur in the account.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Other Unusual or Suspicious Customer Activity

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Customer frequently exchanges small -dollar denominations for large -dollar

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: denominations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Customer frequently deposits currency wrapped in currency straps or currency wrapped

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: in rubber bands that is disorganized and does not balance when counted.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Customer purchases a number of cashier’s checks, money orders, or traveler’s checks for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: large amounts under a specified threshold.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Customer purchases a number of open- end prepaid  cards for large amo unts.  Purchases of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: prepaid  cards are not commensurate with normal business activities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Customer receives large and frequent deposits from online payments systems yet has no

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: apparent online or auction business.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix F: Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing “Red Flags”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  F–8 11/17/2014  • Monetary instruments deposited by mail are numbered sequentially or have unusual

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: symbols or stamps on them.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Suspicious movements of funds occur from one bank to another, and then funds are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: moved back to the first bank.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Deposits are structured through multiple branches of the same bank or by groups of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: people who enter a single branch at the same time.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Currency is deposited or withdrawn in amounts just below identification or reporting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: thresholds.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Customer visits  a safe deposit box or use s a safe custody account on an unusually

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: frequent basis.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Safe deposit boxes or safe custody accounts opened by individuals who do not reside or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: work in the institution’s service area , despite the availability of such services at an

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institution closer to them.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Customer repeatedly uses a bank or branch location that is g eographically distant from

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the customer’s home or office without sufficient business purpose.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Customer  exhibit s unusual traffic patterns in the safe deposit box area or unusual use of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: safe custody accounts .  For example, several individuals arrive togethe r, enter frequently,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or carry bags or other containers that could conceal large amounts of currency, monetary

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: instruments, or small valuable items.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Customer rents multiple safe deposit boxes to store large amounts of currency, monetary

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: instruments, or high- value assets awaiting conversion to currency, for placement into the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banking system .  Similarly, a customer establishes multiple safe custody accounts to park

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: large amounts of securities awaiting sale and conversion into currency, monetary

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: instruments, outgoing funds transfers, or a combination thereof, for placement into the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banking system.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Unusual use of trust funds in business transactions or other financial activity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Customer uses a personal account for business purposes.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Customer ha s established multiple accounts in various corporate or individual names that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: lack sufficient business purpose for the account complexities or appear to be an effort to hide the beneficial ownership from the bank.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Customer makes multiple and frequent c urrency  deposits to var ious accounts t hat are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: purportedly unrelated.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Customer conducts large deposits and withdrawals during a short time period after

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: opening and then subsequently closes the account or the account becomes dormant .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Conversely, an account with little activity ma y suddenly experience large deposit and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: withdrawal activity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Customer makes high- value transactions not commensurate with the customer’s known

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: incomes.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix F: Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing “Red Flags”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  F–9 11/17/2014  Potentially Suspicious Activity That May Indicate Terrorist Financing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The following examples of potentially suspicious activity that may indicate terrorist

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financing are primarily based on  guidance “Guidance for Financial Institutions in Detecting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Terrorist Financing” provided by the FATF.303 FATF is an intergovernmental body whose

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: purpose is the development and promotion of policies, both at national and international

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: levels, to combat money laundering and terrorist financing.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Activity Inconsistent W ith the Customer ’s Business

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Funds are generated by a business owned by persons  of the same origin or by a business

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: that involves persons of the same origin from higher -risk countries (e.g., countries

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: designated by natio nal authorities and FATF as noncooperative countries and territories).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • The stated occupation of the customer is not  commensurate with the type or level of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: activity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Persons involved in currency transactions share an address or phone number, particularly

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: when the address is also a business location or does not seem to correspond to the stated

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: occupation (e.g., student, unemployed, or self -employed).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Regarding nonprofit or charitable organizations, financial transactions occur for which

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: there appears to be no logical economic purpose or in which there appears to be no link

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: between the stated activity of the organization and the other parties in the transaction.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A safe deposit box opened on behalf of a commercial entity when the business activity of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the customer is unknown or such activity does not appear to justify the use of a safe

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: deposit box.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Funds Transfers

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A large num ber of incoming or outgoing funds transfers take place through a business

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: account, and there appears to be no logical business or other economic purpose for the transfers, particularly when this activity involves higher -risk locations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Funds transfers are ordered in small amounts in an apparent effort to avoid triggering

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: identification or reporting requirements.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Funds transfers do not include information on the originator, or the person on whose

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: behalf the transaction is conducted, when the inclusion of suc h information would be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: expected.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Multiple personal and business accounts or the accounts of nonprofit organizations or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: charities are used to collect and funnel funds to a small number of foreign beneficiaries.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Foreign exchange transactions are performed on behalf of a customer by a third party,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: followed by funds transfers to locations having no apparent business connection with the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: customer or to higher -risk countries.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 303 Refer to Guidance for Financial Institutions in Detecting Terrorist Financing , April 24, 2002.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix F: Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing “Red Flags”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  F–10 11/17/2014  Other Transactions That Appear Unusual or Suspicious

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Transactions involving foreign curre ncy exchanges are followed within a short time by

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: funds transfers to higher -risk locations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Multiple accounts are used to collect and funnel funds to a small number of foreign

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: beneficiaries, both persons and businesses, particularly in higher -risk locations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A customer obtains a credit instrument or engages in commercial financial transactions

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: involving the movement of funds to or from higher -risk locations when there appear to be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: no logical business reasons for dealing with those locations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Banks from high er-risk locations open accounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Funds are sent or received via international transfers from or to higher -risk locations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Insurance policy loans or policy surrender values that are subject to a substantial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: surrender charge.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix G: Structuring

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  G–1 11/17/2014  Appendix G : Structuring

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Structuring transactions to evade BSA reporting and certain recordkeeping requirements can

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: result in civil and criminal penalties under the BSA .  Under the BSA (31 USC 5324), no

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: person shall, for the purpose of evading the CTR  or a geographic targeting order reporting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirement, or certain BSA recordkeeping requirements:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Cause or attempt to cause a bank to fail to file a CTR or a report required under a geographic targeting order or to maintain a record required under BSA regulations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Cause or attempt to cause a bank to file a CTR or report required under a geographic targeting order, or to maintain a BSA record that conta in a material omission or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: misstatement of fact.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Structure, as defined above, or attempt to structure or assist in structuring, any transaction with one or more banks.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The definition of structuring, as set forth in 31 CFR 1010.100 (xx)  (which was implemente d

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: before a USA PATRIOT  Act provision extended the prohibition on structuring to geographic

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: targeting orders and BSA recordkeeping requirements) , states, “ a person structures a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transaction if that person, acting alone, or in conjunction with, or on behalf of, other persons, conducts or attempts to conduct one or more transactions in currency in any amount, at one or more financial institutions, on one or more days, in any manner, for the purpose of evading the [CTR filing requirements]. ” “In any manner ” includes, but is not limited to,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: breaking down a single currency sum exceeding $10,000 into smaller amounts that may be conducted as a series of transactions at or less than $10,000.  The transactions need not exceed the $10,000 CTR filing threshold at any one  bank on any single day in order to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: constitute structuring.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Money launderers and criminals have developed many ways to structure large amounts of currency to evade the CTR filing requirements .  Unless currency is smuggled out of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: United States or commin gled with the deposits of an otherwise legitimate business, any

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: money laundering scheme that begins with a need to convert the currency proceeds of criminal activity into more legitimate -looking forms of financial instruments, accounts, or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: investments, is  likely  to involve some form of structuring .  Structuring remains one of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: most commonly reported suspected crimes on SARs.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Bank employees should be aware of and alert to structuring schemes .  For example, a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: customer may structure currency deposit or withdrawal transactions, so that each is less than the $10,000 CTR filing threshold; use currency to purchase official bank checks, money orders, or traveler ’s checks with currency in amounts less than $10,000 (and possibly in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: amounts less than the $3,000 recordkeeping threshold for the currency purchase of monetary instruments to avoid having to produce identification in the process); or exchange small bank

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: notes for large ones in amounts less than $10,000.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: However, two transactions slightly under the $10, 000 threshold conducted days or weeks

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: apart may not necessarily be structuring .  For example, if a customer deposits $9,900 in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: currency on Monday and deposits $9,900 in currency on Wednesday, it should not be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: assumed that structuring has occurred .  Instead , further review and research may be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix G: Structuring

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  G–2 11/17/2014  necessary to determine the nature of the transactions, prior account history, and other

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: relevant customer information to assess whether the activity is suspicious .  Even if

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: structuring has not occurred, the bank should review the transactions for suspicious activity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In addition, structuring may occur before a customer brings the funds to a bank.  In these

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: instances, a bank may be able to identify the aftermath of structuring .  Deposits of monetary

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: instruments that may h ave been purchased elsewhere might be structured to evade the CTR

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: filing requirements or the recordkeeping requirements for the currency purchase of monetary instruments .  These instruments are often numbered sequentially in groups totaling less than

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: $10,000 or $3,000; bear the same handwriting (for the most part) and often the same small mark, stamp, or initials; or appear to have been purchased at numerous places on the same or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: different days.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix H: Request Letter Items (Core and Expanded)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  H–1 11/17/2014  Appendix H: Request Letter Items

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (Core and Expanded)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Core Examination Procedures

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: As part of the examination planning process, the examiner should prepare a request letter .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The list below includes materials that e xaminers may  request or request access to for a bank

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML examination .  This list should be tailored for the specific bank’ s risk profile and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the planned examination scope .  Additional materials may be requested as needed.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Compliance Program

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Nam e and title of the designated BSA compliance officer and, if different, the name and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: title of the person responsible for monitoring BSA/AML compliance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Organization charts showing direct and indirect reporting lines.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Copies of r ésumés and qualifications of  person(s) new to the bank serving in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML compliance program oversight capacities.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Make available copies of the most recent written BSA/AML compliance program

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: approved by board of directors (or the statutory equivalent of such a program for foreign

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: financial institutions operating in the United States), including CIP  requirements, with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: date of approval noted in the minutes.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Make available copies of the policy and procedures relating to all reporting and recordkeeping requirements, including suspicious a ctivity reporting.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Correspondence addressed between the bank, its personnel or agents, and its federal and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: state banking agencies, the U.S. Treasury (Office of the Secretary and U.S. Department

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of the Treasury, IRS, FinCEN,  an d OFAC) or law enforcement au thorities since the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: previous BSA/AML examination.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Independent Testing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Make available copies of the results of any internally or externally sourced independent audits or tests performed since the previous examination for BSA/AML, including the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: scope or en gagement letter, management ’s responses, and access to the workpapers.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Make available access to the auditor ’s risk assessment, audit plan (schedule), and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: program used for the audits or tests.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Training

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Training documentation (e.g., materials used for training since the previous BSA/AML examination).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • BSA/AML training schedule with dates, attendees, and topics .  A list of persons in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: positions for which the bank typically requires BSA/AML training but who did not participate in the training.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix H: Request Letter Items (Core and Expanded)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  H–2 11/17/2014  Risk Assessme nt

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Make available copies of management ’s BSA/AML risk assessment of products, services,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: customers, and geographic locations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • List of bank identified higher -risk accounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Customer Identification Program

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • List of accounts without taxpayer identification numb ers (TIN).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • File of correspondence requesting TINs for bank customers.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A copy of any account opening forms (e.g., for loans, deposits or other accounts) used to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: document CIP/Customer Due Diligence information.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Written description of the bank’ s rationale for  CIP exemptions  for existing customers

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: who open new accounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • List of new accounts covering all product lines (including accounts opened by third

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: parties) and segregating existing customer accounts from new customers, for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: ___________.  ( Examiner to insert a period of time appropriate for the size  and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: complexity of the bank .)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • List of any accounts opened for a customer that provides an application for a TIN.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • List of any accounts opened in which verification has not been completed or any accounts

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: opened with e xceptions to the CIP.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • List of customers or potential customers for whom the bank took adverse action,304 on the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: basis of  its CIP.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • List of all documentary and nondocumentary methods the bank uses to verify a customer ’s identity.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Make available customer notices and a description of their timing and delivery, by product.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • List of the financial institutions on which the bank is relying, if the bank is using the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: “reliance provision.”  The list should note if the relied -upon financial institutions are

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: subject to a ru le implementing the BSA/AML compliance program requirements of 31

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: USC 5318(h) and are regulated by a federal functional regulator.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Provide the following:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Copies of any contracts signed between the parties.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Copies of the CIP or procedures used by the other party.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: – Any certifications made by the other party.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Copies of contracts with financial institutions and with third parties that perform all or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: any part of the bank ’s CIP.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 304 As defined by 12 CFR 202.2(c).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix H: Request Letter Items (Core and Expanded)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  H–3 11/17/2014  Suspicious Activity Reporting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Access to SARs  filed with FinCEN during the review period and the supporting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: documentation.  Include c opies of any filed SARs that were related to section 314(a)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requests for information or to section 314(b) information sharing requests.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Any analyses or documentation of  any activity for which a SAR was considered but not

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: filed, or for which the bank is actively considering filing a SAR.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Description of expanded monitoring procedures applied to higher -risk accounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Determination of whether the bank uses a manual or an aut omated account monitoring

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: system, or a combination of the two.  If an automated system is used, determine whether

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the system is proprietary or vendor supplied.  If the system was provided by an outside

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: vendor, request (i) a list that includes the vendor, ( ii) application names, and (iii)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: installation dates of any automated account monitoring system provided by an outside

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: vendor .  Request a list of the algorithms or rules used by the systems and copies of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: independent validation of the software against these rules.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Make available copies of reports used for identification of and monitoring for suspicious
