content: noncompliance with certain Bank Secrecy Act/Anti -Money Laundering (BSA/AML)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirements,311 particularly in light of the specific BSA/AML compliance provisions in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: section 8(s) of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (FDIA) and section 206(q) of the Federal

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Credit Union Act (FCUA).312

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML Compliance Program Requirement.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Under section 8(s) of the FDIA and section 206(q) of the FCUA, each of the Agencies is

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: directed to prescribe regulations requiring each insured depository institution to establish and maintain procedures reasonably designed to assure and monitor the institution’s compliance with the requirements of the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA Compliance Program) .  Sections 8(s)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and 206(q) also require that each Agency’s examinations of an insured depository institution review the BSA Compliance Program and that its reports of examination describe any problem with the BSA Compliance Program .  Finally, sections 8(s) and 206(q) state that if an

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: insured depository institution has failed to est ablish and maintain a BSA Compliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Program or has failed to correct any problem with the BSA Compliance Program previously reported to the institution by the appropriate Agency, the appropriate Agency shall issue a cease and desist order against the inst itution .  As required by sections 8(s) and 206(q), each

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of the Agencies has issued regulations that require any institution it supervises or insures to establish and maintain a BSA Compliance Program.  Each of these regulations imposes substantially the sa me requirements.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 313 Specifically, under each Agency’s regulations, a BSA

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Compliance Program must have, at a minimum, the following elements:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 309 This statement is intended to set forth general policy guidance.  It is not intended to compel or preclude an

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: enforcement or ot her supervisory action as necessary in a specific factual situation.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 310 Collectively the “Agencies” or individually the “Agency.”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 311 This statement does not address the assessment of civil money penalties for violations of the BSA or its

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: implementing regulat ions.  FinCEN has authority to assess such penalties under the BSA.  Likewise, the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Agencies also have such authority under their general enforcement statutes.  12 USC 1818(i)(2), 1786(k)(2).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 313 12 CFR 21.21 (OCC); 208.63 (B oard of Governors); 326.8(c) (FDIC); 748.2 (NCUA).  The provisions of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: section 8(s) are also made applicable to certain banking organizations other than insured depository institutions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 12 USC 1818(b)(3), (b)(4).  The OCC’s regulations also apply to federa l branches and agencies of foreign

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banks.  12 USC 3102(b); 12 CFR 28.13.  The Federal Reserve’s regulations also apply to Edge and agreement

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: corporations, and branches, agencies, and other offices of foreign banking organizations.  12 CFR 211.5,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 211.24.  B SA Compliance Programs that comply with these Agency regulations are also deemed to comply with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Treasury regulations issued pursuant to the BSA, which separately requires that financial institutions establish

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: AML programs.  Refer to 31 CFR 1020.210; 31 USC  5318(h).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix R: Enforcement Guidance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  R–2 11/17/2014  • A system of internal controls to assure ongoing compliance with the BSA ;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Independent testing for BSA/AML compliance ;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A designated individual or individuals responsible for coordinating and monitoring

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML compliance ; and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Training for appropriate personnel.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In addition, a BSA Compliance Program must include a CIP  with risk -based procedures that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: enable the institution to form a reasonable belief that it knows the true identity of its

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: customers.314

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Communication of Supervisory Concerns about BSA Compliance Programs .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: When an Agency identifies supervisory concerns relating to a banking organization’s or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: credit union’s BSA Compliance Program in the course of an examination or otherwise, the Agency may communicate those concerns by various means .  The particular method of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: communication used typically depends on the seriousness of the concerns .  These methods

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: include:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Informal  discussions by examiners with an institution’s management during the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: examination process ;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Formal discussions by examiners with the board of directors as part of or following the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: examination process ;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Supervisory letters and other written communications from examiners or the agency to an

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institution’s management ;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A finding contained in the report of examination or in other formal communications from

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: an Agency to an institution’s board of directors indicating  deficiencies or weaknesses in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the BSA Compliance P rogram ; or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • A finding contained in the report of examination or in other formal communications from

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the Agency to an institution’s board of directors of a violation of the regulatory requirement to implement and maintain a reasonably designed BSA Compliance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Program.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: As explained below, in order to be a “problem” with the BSA Compliance Program that will result in a cease and desist order under sections 8(s) or 206(q) if not corrected by the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institution, deficiencies in the BSA Compliance Program must be identified in a report of examination or other written document as requiring communication to an institution’s board

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: of directors or senior management as matters that must be corrected .  However, other issues

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or suggestions for improvement may be communicated through other means.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Governors); 12 CFR 326.8(b)(2) (FDIC); 12 CFR 748.2(b)(2) (NCUA); 12 CFR 31 CFR 1020.220 (FinCEN).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix R: Enforcement Guidance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  R–3 11/17/2014  Enforcement Actions for BSA Compliance Program Failures.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In accordance with sections 8(s)(3) and 206(q)(3), the appropriate Agency will issue a cease

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and desist order against a banking organization or a credit union for noncompliance with BSA Compliance Program requirements in the following circumstances, based on a careful

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: review of all the relevant facts and circumstances.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Failure to establish and maintain a reasonably designed BSA Compliance Program .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The appropriate Agency will issue a cease and desist order based on a violation of the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirement in sections 8(s) and 206(q) to establish and maintain a reasonably designed BSA

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Program where the institution:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Fails to have a written BSA Compliance Program, including a CIP  that adequ ately covers

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the required program elements (i.e., internal controls, independent testing, designated compliance personnel, and training) ; or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Fails to implement a BSA Compliance Program that adequately covers the required

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Program elements (institution -issue d policy statements alone are not sufficient; the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: program as implemented must be consistent with the banking organization’s written

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: policies, procedures, and processes) ; or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Has defects in its BSA Compliance Program in one or more program elements that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: indicate that either the written Compliance Program or its implementation is not

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: effective, for example, where the deficiencies are coupled with other aggravating factors,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: such as (i) highly suspicious activity creating a significant potential for unreported m oney

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: laundering or terrorist financing, (ii) patterns of structuring to evade reporting requirements, (iii) significant insider complicity, or (iv) systemic failures to file CTR s,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: SAR s, or other required BSA reports.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: For example, an institution that has procedures to provide BSA/AML training to appropriate personnel, independent testing, and a designated BSA/AML compliance officer, would nonetheless be subject to a cease and desist order if its system of internal controls (such as customer due diligence, procedures for monitoring suspicious activity, or an appropriate risk assessment) fails with respect to a higher  risk area or to multiple lines of business that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: significantly impact the institution’s overall BSA compliance .  Similarly, a cease and desist

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: order would be warranted if, for example, an institution has deficiencies in the required independent testing element of the Program and those deficiencies are coupled with evidence of highly suspicious activity creating a significant potential for unrepor ted money laundering

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: or terrorist financing in the institution .  However, other types of deficiencies in an

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: institution’s BSA Compliance Program or in implementation of one or more of the required Program elements will not necessarily result in the issuanc e of a cease and desist order,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: unless the deficiencies are so severe as to render the Program ineffective when viewed as a whole .  For example, an institution that has deficiencies in its procedures for providing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA/AML training to appropriate personnel, but has effective controls, independent testing, and a designated BSA/AML compliance officer, may ordinarily be subject to examiner criticism and/or supervisory action other than the issuance of a cease and desist order, unless

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 315 These examples do not in any way limit the ability of an Agency to bring an enforcement action where the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: failure to have or to implement a BSA Compliance Program is demonstrated by other deficiencies.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix R: Enforcement Guidance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  R–4 11/17/2014  the training program deficie ncies, viewed in light of all relevant circumstances, are so severe

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: as to result in a finding that the organization’s Program, taken as a whole, is not effective.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: In determining whether an organization has failed to implement a BSA Compliance Program,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: an A gency will also consider the application of the organization’s Program across its

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: business lines and activities .  In the case of institutions with multiple lines of business,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: deficiencies affecting only some lines of business or activities would need to be  evaluated to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: determine if the deficiencies are so severe or significant in scope as to result in a conclusion

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: that the institution has not implemented an effective overall program.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Failure to correct a previously reported problem with the BSA Compliance P rogram .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: A history of deficiencies in an institution’s BSA Compliance Program in a variety of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: different areas, or in the same general areas, may result in a cease and desist order on that basis .  An Agency will, in accordance with sections 8(s) and 206(q), and based on a careful

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: review of the relevant facts and circumstances, issue a cease and desist order whenever an institution fails to correct a problem with BSA/AML compliance identified during the supervisory process .  In order to be considered a “probl em” within the meaning of sections

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 8(s)(3)(B) and 206(q)(3)(B), however, a deficiency reported to the institution ordinarily would involve a serious defect in one or more of the required components of the institution’s BSA Compliance Program or implementation thereof that a report of examination or other

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: written supervisory communication identifies as requiring communication to the institution’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: board of directors or senior management as a matter that must be corrected .  For example,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: failure to take any act ion in response to an express criticism in an examination report

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: regarding a failure to appoint a qualified compliance officer could be viewed as an

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: uncorrected problem that would result in a cease and desist order.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: An Agency will ordinarily not issue a ce ase and desist order under sections 8(s) or 206(q) for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: failure to correct a BSA Compliance Program problem unless the deficiencies subsequently

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: found by the Agency are substantially the same as those previously reported to the institution .  For example, if  an Agency notes in one examination report that an institution’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: training program was inadequate because it was out of date (for instance if it did not reflect changes in the law), and at the next examination the training program is adequately updated, but flaws are discovered in the internal controls for the BSA/AML Program, the Agency may

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: determine not to issue a cease and desist order under sections 8(s) or 206(q) for failure to correct previously reported problems and will consider the full range of pot ential supervisory

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: responses .  Similarly, if an institution is cited in an examination report described above for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: failure to designate a qualified BSA compliance officer, and the institution by the next examination has appointed an otherwise qualified pers on to assume that responsibility, but

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the examiners recommend additional training for the person, an Agency may determine not to issue a cease and desist order under sections 8(s) or 206(q) based solely on that deficiency .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Statements in a written examination report or other supervisory communication identifying less serious issues or suggesting areas for improvement that the examination report does not identify as requiring communication to the board of directors or senior management as matters that must b e corrected would not be considered “problems” for purposes of sections

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The Agencies recognize that certain types of problems with an institution’s BSA Compliance Program may not be fully correctable before the next examination, for exampl e, remedial

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix R: Enforcement Guidance

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  R–5 11/17/2014  action involving adoption or conversion of computer systems .  In these types of situations, a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: cease and desist order is not required provided the Agency determines that the institution has

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: made acceptable substantial progress toward correcting the problem at the time of the examination immediately following the examination where the problem was first identified

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and reported to the institution.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Other e nforcement actions for BSA Compliance Program d eficiencies .  As noted above,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: in addition to the situations described in this Statement where an Agency will issue a cease

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and desist order for a violation of the BSA Compliance Program regulation or for failure to correct a previously reported Program “problem,” an Agency may also issue a cease and desist order or enter into a formal written agreement, or take informal enforcement action

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: against an institution for other types of BSA/AML Program concerns .  In these situations,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: depending upon the particular facts involved, an Agency may pursue enforcement actions based on unsafe and unsound practices or violations of law, including the BSA .  The form of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the enforcement action in a particular case will depend on the severity of the noncompliance, weaknesses, or deficiencies, the capability and cooperation of  the institution’s management,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and the Agency’s confidence that the institution will take appropriate and timely corrective

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: action.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA Reporting and Recordkeeping Requirements

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Suspicious activity r eporting r equirements .  Under regulations of the Agencies  and the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Treasury Department, organizations subject to the Agencies’ supervision are required to file

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: a SAR  when they detect certain known or suspected criminal violations or suspicious

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transactions.316 Suspicious activity reporting forms the cornerstone of the BSA reporting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: system, and is critical to the United States’ ability to utilize financial information to combat money laundering, terrorist financing, and other financial crimes .  The regulations require

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banking organizations and credit unions to file S ARs with respect to the following general

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: types of activity:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Known or suspected criminal violations involving insider activity in any amount;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Known or suspected criminal violations aggregating $5,000 or more when a suspect can

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: be identified;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Known or suspected criminal violations aggregating $25,000 or more regardless of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: potential suspects; or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Suspicious transactions of $5,000 or more that involve potential money laundering or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA violations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The SAR must be filed within 30 days of detecting facts tha t may constitute a basis for filing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: a SAR (or within 60 days if there is no subject).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The Agencies will cite a violation of the SAR regulations, and will take appropriate supervisory action, if the organization’s failure to file a SAR (or SARs) evidences a  systemic

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: breakdown in its policies, procedures, or processes to identify and research suspicious

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 225.4(f) (Board of Governors); 12 CFR 353 (FDIC); 12 CFR 748.1(c) (NCUA); 31 CFR 1020.320 (Treasury).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  R–6 11/17/2014  activity, involves a pattern or practice of noncompliance with the filing requirement, or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: represents a significant or egregious situation.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Other BSA r eporting  and r ecordkeeping r equirements .  Banking organizations and credit

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: unions also are subject to other BSA reporting and recordkeeping requirements set forth in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: regulations issued by the Treasury Department.317 These requirements are reviewed in detail

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: in the F FIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual ; they include, inter  alia, requirements

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: applicable to cash and monetary instrument transactions and funds transfers, Currency Transaction Report (CTR) filing and exemption rules, and due diligence, certification, and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: other r equirements for foreign correspondent and private banking accounts.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Enforcement a ctions for n onprogram BSA/AML r equirements .  In appropriate

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: circumstances, an Agency may take formal or informal enforcement actions to address

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: violations of BSA/AML requireme nts other than the BSA Compliance Program

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: requirements .  These other requirements include, for example, the SAR and CTR regulatory

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: obligations described above.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix T: BSA E -Filing System

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  T–1 11/17/2014  Appendix T : BSA E -Filing System

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The information in this Appendix is based on FinCEN’s BSA E -Filing System Supervisory

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: User Manual (Version 2.8, June 2014) and BSA E -Filing User Manual (Version 3.9, June

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: 2014).  The information is subject to change as FinCE N updates its manuals.  Banks have

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: access to the most recent version through FinCEN’s E -Filing System if questions arise.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Please direct all inquiries to the FinCEN Resource Center by calling the toll- free number

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (800) 767- 2825 or (703) 905- 3591 or by e -mailing your inquiry to FRC@fincen.gov .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The BSA E -Filing System provides for:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Electronic filing of BSA forms (both individual (discrete) and in batches); receive

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: acknowledgements; and track t he submission status of filin gs;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Receiv ing Alerts from FinCEN ; and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Send ing Secure Messages to FinCEN and the ability to receive replies to those messages.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The management of these functions within the context of each bank is controlled by one or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: more Supervisory Users, who are designated by the bank.  The Supervisory Users may be assigned and/or confirmed by senior management (Chief Compliance Officer or equi valent).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The Supervisory User should be the person or persons with primary responsibility for the bank’s use of the BSA E -Filing System.  Supervisory Users should be in a position to have

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: insight into all of the BSA filing activities across the entire ban k.  They should be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: knowledgeable about the individuals responsible for preparing and submitting BSA filings

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: and the processes by which filings are submitted.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Supervisory Users have privileges to:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Request User IDs for new users within their bank;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Assign BSA E -Filing roles to enrolled users;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Delete user’s access to the BSA E -Filing System;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Manage the bank -specific information contained in the system (such as address, EIN,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: primary federal regulator); and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Track all filings submitted by all users within the ir bank.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The following are the basic types of user filings permitted through the BSA E -Filing System:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Discrete Filer of BSA Forms.  These users file single BSA forms to FinCEN.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Batch Filer of BSA Forms.  These users file multiple BSA forms in one electro nic batch

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: in accordance with the requirements outlined in FinCEN’s BSA E -Filing Electronic

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Filing Requirements.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Through the assignment of predefined roles, Supervisory Users will control how their bank’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: users can interact with the BSA E -Filing System.  A BSA E -Filing System user may be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: assigned a single or multiple filer roles.  The process of assigning roles will be required each

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix T: BSA E -Filing System

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  T–2 11/17/2014  time a new user is enrolled and will be required as users switch positions within the bank or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: take on additional responsibiliti es.  User’s roles should be removed from the BSA E -Filing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: System if they either transfer positions or leave the bank.  If a Supervisory User switches positions or leaves the bank, the Supervisory User will need to transfer Supervisory User

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: responsibilities  to another individual or individuals.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The BSA E -Filing roles are defined as follows:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Filer Roles  Capabilities

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: DISCRETE FILER ROLES

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN CTR Filer  Allows users to access, complete, and submit the discrete CTR .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN Designation of Exempt

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Person(s)  (DOEP) Filer  Allows users to access, comple te, and submit discrete DOEP

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: report .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN SAR Filer  Allows users to access, complete, and submit the discrete SAR .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN FBAR Filer  Allows users to access, complete, a nd submit the discrete FBAR .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BATCH FILER ROLES

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN CTR Batch Filer  Allows submission of CTR batch files

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN SAR Batch Filer  Allows submission of SAR batch files.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN DEP Batch Filer  Allows submission of DEP batch files.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN FBAR Batch Filer  Allows submission of FBAR batch files.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: OTHER ROLES

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Secure Messenger  Allows users to send secure messages to FinCEN and receive

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: secure replies. BSA report  acknowledgements are distributed via

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Secure

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Messaging, so this role should be assigned in conjunction with the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: user’s assigned filing role(s).  Every user must be a Secure

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Messenger  in order to obtain a PIN, which is used to electronically

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: sign a BSA report prior to submission.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Alerts Receiver  Allows users to  receive broadcast messages distributed by

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Secure Data Transfer Mode (SDTM) Batch Filer  Allows users to monitor and review SDTM submissions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: A single user role assigned for “FinCEN CTR Filer,” will only allow the user access to discrete CTRs; access to other features or reports  in the BSA E -Filing System would not be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: permitted.  When a BSA E -Filing user is assigned a filing role (e.g., FinCEN CTR Filer or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN Batch Filer), they should also be given access to Secur e Messenger because the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA r eport  acknowledgements are distributed via Secure Messaging.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Report Submission

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Upon the successful s ubmission of a discrete BSA report , a confirmation page will be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: presented, which will confirm the:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Tracking ID (A unique receipt number assigned to the fi le by the BSA E -Filing System).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Note: the Tracking ID number is different from the BSA Identification Number (BSA -

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: ID) utilized in the FinCEN Quer y System;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Date and time of the submission ;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix T: BSA E -Filing System

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  T–3 11/17/2014  • Submission type ;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Owner (submitter) Name ; and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Owner (submitter) e -mail address .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Banks may print the confirmation page for bank records and/or save the confirmation page as

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: an HTML or PDF file.  The following is an example of a confirmation page for a discrete

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: filing.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Upon a successful batch submission, a confirmation page will be presented confirming:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Tracking ID (a unique receipt number assigned to the file by the BSA E -Filing System).

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Note: the Tracking ID number is different from the BSA -ID, util ized in the FinCEN

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Query System;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Receive Date/Time (the date and time that the file was submitted on BSA E -Filing) ;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Submission type;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Number of forms reported ;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Owner (submitter) Name ;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Owner (submitter) e -mail address ; and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Filing Name .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix T: BSA E -Filing System

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  T–4 11/17/2014

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Banks may  print the confirmation page for bank records and/or save the confirmation page as

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: an HTML or PDF file.  The following is an example of a confirmation page for a batch filing.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Tracking the Status of Filings

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The Track Status feature allows a user to determine the status of a particular BSA filing in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the routing process to FinCEN.  The Track Status screen shows tracking information at a batch level for batch filings and at an individual level for discrete filings.  As of July 1, 2011,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the filing history will appear along with the filing ’s status for the past 1825 days (i.e. 5 years )

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: in the Track Status screen.  It may require up to ten minutes after submission for a filing’s

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: information to appear on the Track Status screen, and longer for large files.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA E -Filing users will only be able to track the filings they have personally submitted.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: However, Supervisory Users are able to track all the filings submitted by all of their bank’s authorized users.  Supervisory Users cannot see the content of submissi ons.  They can only

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: see the status of submissions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The tracking statuses for the successful routing  of discrete and batch BSA filings (CTRs,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: SARs, DEPs, FBARs) to FinCEN include:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Received.   The filing has been received by BSA E -Filing System, but has not  yet been

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: validated.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Accepted.   The BSA E -Filing System has completed the validation process and accepted the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: filing.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Transmitted.  The filing has been transmitted by the BSA E -Filing System to FinCEN.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Acknowledged.  FinCEN has sent an acknowledgement to BSA E -Filing System and the BSA

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: E-Filing System has sent that acknowledgement to the user.  Acknowledgements are sent via

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix T: BSA E -Filing System

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  T–5 11/17/2014  Secure Messaging to the submitting user.  Acknowledgements are only available to batch

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: filers,  if the bank’s Supervisory User has enrolled the bank to receive batch

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: acknowledgements.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The tracking statuses that indicate errors for filings are as follows:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Accepted with Warnings .  This status only applies to batch filing.  The submission has

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: been a ccepted and will be processed by FinCEN.  However it contains some errors that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: need to be corrected, once the submission has been acknowledged.  The warnings may be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: reviewed through the Submission Warnings page.  The filer can also optionally download the warnings by clicking on the Download as XML button to receive full detail of the warnings.  The Submission Warnings  page provides important details concerning the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: types of errors received and the location within the submitted file associated with the error.  The column titled “Context” provides the location within the submitted file where the error was generated.  This field will often list the record type, field description, line number, and document number (if applicable).  The document number is equal to the transaction sequence number for each document within a batch submission.  The first document within the batch will have transaction sequence number “ 00001”  and will

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: increment by one for each additional document.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Transmitted with Warnings .  This status only applies to batch filing.  When a submission

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: that was previously “Accepted With Warnings” is transmitted to FinCEN, the status becomes “Transmitted with Warnings.” The user can click on the transmitted with warnings link to view the warnings tha t were issued for the submission; however, the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: bank must wait until they receive the “Acknowledgement” file from FinCEN in order to correct and resubmit their batch submission.  The bank must wait for the Acknowledgement file because a BSA -ID is required f or corrected submissions.  The

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA -ID is not assigned until the file has been “Acknowledged.”

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix T: BSA E -Filing System

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  T–6 11/17/2014  • Rejected.  This status applies to both discrete and batch filing.  Both types of submissions

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: (discrete and batch) will receive a status of “Rejected ” when an inva lid report version is

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: used or the role has not been assigned to the user.  Batch submissions will also receive a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: “Rejected” status if the batch fails to meet the BSA Electronic Filing Requirements upon submission to the BSA E -Filing system.  The “Rejected” link in the Track Status

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: provides a listing of the file errors to be corrected.  Users have the option of correcting the identified errors in a batch file due to data and/or format issues before resubmitting the file, or users can resubmit the same batch file (without correcting the identified errors) with the override option applied if the batch file has no “Fatal” errors.  If the batch file has one or more “Fatal” errors, then the file must be corrected and the override option

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: cannot be applied.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Acknow ledge Failed.  This status only applies to batch filing.  FinCEN was unable to

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: load the batch filing.  Therefore, an acknowledgement file could not be generated.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Hold.  This status applies to both discrete and batch filing.  The filing was placed on Hold by the system administrator.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix T: BSA E -Filing System

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  T–7 11/17/2014  Acknowledgement Notificaton

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: When BSA E -Filing receives acknowledgements from FinCEN for filings, the filer will

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: receive an e -mail containing a link to BSA E -Filing as well as the Secure Message ID that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: contains their acknowledgement.  The user must access BSA E -Filing to view the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: acknowledgment content.  The Secure Message subject field will include the filing tracking

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: ID assigned to the filing upon submission in order to reconcile the acknowledgement with the submitte d filings.  The text box of the Secure Message will contain the Acknowledgement

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: content for the discrete filing, as shown in the following graphic.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix T: BSA E -Filing System

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  T–8 11/17/2014  A batch filing acknowledgement will arrive as an attachment to a Secure Message as shown

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: in the foll owing graphic.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix T: BSA E -Filing System

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  T–9 11/17/2014  Storing Acknowledgements for Your Records

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA E -Filing retains information for a limited time.  For this reason, it is recommended that

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: banks download and store acknowledgements for their permanent records.  Discrete filing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: acknowledgements may be saved as a PDF file and batch filing acknowledgements may be

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: saved as separate attachments.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: BSA E -Filing Administrative Data Retention Policy:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Administrative Data Type Retention Time

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Acknowledgement Data  30 days after being opened or 60 days after being posted, whichever

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: comes first

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Alert Data  30 days after posting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Track Status Data  As of July 1, 2011, 1825 days (i.e. 5 years) after achieving ‘Accepted’ or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: ‘Rejected’ status. Note: The retention period prior to July 1, 2011 was 365

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: days.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Error Categories

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Discrete Filing Errors

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Discrete filing reports have been designed to prevent most errors.  If a filer submitting a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: report leaves certain fields blank (such as those fields not ed with an *), the discrete report

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: will not transmit.  These err ors would be comparable to a batch filer’s primary errors.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Similarly, secondary errors (such as invalid zip codes), will also prevent the report  from

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: transmitting.  If a filer attempts to validate a report that contains errors, the filer will get a messag e saying, “There are validation errors.”  A separate window containing up to seven (7)

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: errors will appear.  If more than seven (7) errors are detected, the window will record the number of additional errors in the report and note through a statement such a s “Message limit

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: exceeded.  Remaining X errors not reported.”  The system will not allow submission until

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: these remaining errors are remedied.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: A discrete report is validated for errors upon submission.  Once accepted and acknowledged

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: by the system, only the BSA ID assigned for the filing is returned to the filer.  No additional

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: errors are sent back along with acknowledgement message for discrete filing.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Batch Filing Errors

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: There are two types of errors identified in batch files: format errors that may result in

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: automatic rejection of a batch file and file errors that represent errors in data entered in individual fields.  Fatal format errors prevent the batch file from being processed.  For example, error F18 “A required 9Z record is missing from the subm itted file” is a fatal

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: format error because each batch file must contain a 9Z record.  Error C404, for a CTR filing,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: “Person street address is blank” is a file error because it indicates data is missing from a

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: street address field.  For a SAR filing, error  S224 “Financial institution type is blank” is a file

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: error because it indicates data is missing from a record.  A batch file with large numbers of

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: file errors can be rejected by the BSA E -Filing Program if the number of errors exceeds

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: programming limits.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix T: BSA E -Filing System

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  T–10 11/17/2014  File errors are classified as primary or secondary errors, depending on their importance.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Primary errors are file errors that violate electronic filing requirements or report instructions and so degrade data quality that they must be corrected.  Primary errors make it difficult for regulators, analysts, and law enforcement investigators to locate the reports in the database or identify the nature and circumstances of the filing.  Examples of such errors include blank last names or legal names, missing fina ncial institution Employer Identification Numbers, or

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: invalid entries in the transaction date field.  Attachment A – Error Code List identifies

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: primary errors by adding an asterisk (*) to the four digit error code.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Secondary errors are file errors that vio late electronic filing requirements or report

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: instructions but have a lesser impact on data quality.  Examples of secondary errors are ZIP

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Codes that end in four zeroe s (e.g. 123450000), blank or invalid financial institution address

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: information, or invali d telephone numbers.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Error Correction

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: A detailed description of error codes can be found in Attachment A -  Error Code List in the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN Currency Transaction Report Electronic Filing Requirements and the FinCEN

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Suspicious Activity Report Electronic Filing Requirements.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Attachment B – Error Correction Instructions are also contained in the Electronic Filing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Requirements documents and identify the requirements and procedures for correcting

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FinCEN errors reported to batch filers during the FinCEN acknowledgeme nt process.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: There are also batch file specifications for the FinCEN DOEP and the FinCEN FBAR in the Electronic Filing Requirements documents for those types of submissions.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Correction Requirements

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Filers should immediately correct and resubmit a batch file rejected for fatal errors or for

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: large numbers of file errors when notified by FinCEN the batch file was not accepted.  Rejection of a batch file does not relieve the filer of the responsibility to file within the

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: required time  frames established by the BSA regulations.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: An accepted batch file containing primary errors, must be re- filed as corrected reports with

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: the primary errors and any secondary errors corrected.  FinCEN reports that contain only secondary errors need not be corrected.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Naming Conventio ns

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The “Filing Name” fields on the BSA E -Filing Header page are for the bank to use as an

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: internal filing in such a manner as to distinguish it from other filings submitted.  As such,

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: each file name should be unique.  This will be especially useful when using the Track Status feature in BSA E -Filing.  Naming conventions optimize the bank’s ability to distinguish files

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: from one another, but not to disclose sensitive inform ation contained on the BSA reports .

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Having a standard naming convention will be even more important if the organization has multiple people responsible for filing.  Each filer will want to distinguish their filings from ones submitted by other filers within the organization.  Conventions may include a filer’s abbreviated name or initials, date of submission, and a sequence number of filings in one day

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Appendix T: BSA E -Filing System

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual  T–11 11/17/2014  (to the extent that multiple filings are submitted in one day).  So, for example the third filing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: prepared by John Smith on April 1st, 2014 might be named JoeSmithCTR04012014- 3.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Once a naming convention has been developed, banks should ensure appropriate personnel

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: are trained accordingly.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Work -In-Progress Reports

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: The Work- in-Progress (WIP) system collects and stores data from FinCEN’s BSA E -Filing

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: System and develops trending information and re ports on BSA electronic filing patterns.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Key functionality of the WIP system includes:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Identifying, capturing and storing data on errors found in e -filed BSA documents;

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Providing statistical outputs of trend metrics, such as filing patterns and behavior, data quality issues, and filing errors; and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Reporting feedback to BSA filers about their overall E -Filing data quality.

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Every month, the Supervisory User will receive two filer feedback reports from the BSA E -

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: Filing Secure Messenger.  These reports are int ended to show trending errors for a given

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: form type and identify systemic problems the filer may be experiencing.  The two reports are identified below:

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Potential Data Quality Issues by Form Type.  This report provides a monthly ranking and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: frequency of fi ling errors by form type;  and

name: 252222333-Bank-Secrecy-Act-Anti-Money-Laundering-Examination-Manual-2014
content: • Filing Statistics by Form Type.  This report provides filing counts by form type over a calendar year.
